loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
La señora Ysabel es socia del banco comunal Las Guerreras del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 27 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo.
Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, los préstamos que generalmente saca lo invierte en la compra de sus productos.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: una vitrina, 4 colonias, 2 desodorantes, 1 crema de afeitar, 1 talco para pies, 1 crema para el cuerpo, 1 champú, 2 lápiz delineadores, 3 lápiz labial, 2 polvos compactos.
Su esposo trabaja en una compañía de la zona, Ysabel lo ayuda con los gastos vendiendo estos productos ya que no le demanda mucho tiempo y lo mejor  de todo es que es el fruto de su esfuerzo.
Ysabel agradece a Manuela Ramos por la oportunidad de poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Ms. Ysabel is a member of the "Las Guerreras" ["The Warriors"] communal bank in the district of Calleria, Ucayali department. She is 27 years old, married, and has one son.

She sells beauty products by catalog. The loans she takes out are generally used to invest in purchasing her products. With her new loan of 2,000 nuevos soles, she will buy: a display case, four colognes, two deodorants, one shaving cream, one foot powder, one body cream, one shampoo, two eyeliner pencils, three lipliner pencils, and two powder compacts.

Her husband works in a local company. Ysabel helps with the household expenses by selling these products. It doesn't demand much time and best of all, it is the fruit of her efforts.

Ysabel thanks Manuela Ramos for this opportunity to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy a display case, colognes, creams, etc.

loans.name: Muthoni

texts.en:
Muthoni, 27, is married to Wallace who is a technician. They are blessed with one seven-year-old child. Muthoni runs a retail shop which has been in operation for ten years. The business earns her a monthly income of 52,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). 

This is her first loan from KADET Ltd. She will use the funds to buy 90 kg of sugar, three bags of rice, and five bales of maize flour for resale. She intends to use the anticipated profits to open a bigger shop and hopes to own a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, flour, and rice for sale

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en: Ngoc was born in 1960. She has two children. They have income. She and her husband are farmers. They have a shoe repair store.They have a monthly income of about 4.000.000 Vietnamdong. Ms Ngoc has participated in SEDA since 2005. The last cycL., she borrowed 6.758.000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycL., she would like to borrow 8.938.000 VND to repair her store.

loans.use: to repair her store.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es: La señora Gregoria tiene 7 hijos D. los cuales 4 son dependientes, su esposo el señor Enrique se encuentra en la localidad D. San Julián trabajando como albañil. La Sra.  Gregoria vive en la zona Plan 3000, la señora se dedica a la venta D. ropa hace aproximadamente 9 años en diferentes ferias D. la capital cruceña. El crédito solicitado es para aumentar su capital D. trabajo para comprar mercadería ropa D. temporada,  ya que disminuyo el capital que tenia a causa D. la inversión que realizo para la construcción D. la casa D. su hijo, le ayudo a construir su casita a su hijo, es una persona muy amable y trabajadora, se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Gregoria has 7 children, 4 of them are still dependent on her.  Her husband, Enrique, is working as a brick  layer in the town of San Julian.   Gregoria lives in a zone designated as Plan 3000, and for approximately 9 years now she has worked selling clothing in different markets around the capital.  The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase clothing for the upcoming season.  She used some of her existing capital to build a small home for her son.  Gregoria is a very amiable and hardworking woman, and she feels grateful for the support she receives from the communal bank.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for the upcoming season to sell to her customers

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.ru: Сабохат проживает в городе Вахдат. Ей 50 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Она имеет высшее образование, преподаватель. По профессии работает 31 год. Кроме того в свободное от работы время она занимается животноводством. В этой области она 12 лет. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en: Sabohat lives in the city of Vahdat.  She is 50 years old, married and has two children.  She has a higher education and is a teacher.  She has been working in this field for 31 years.  Besides this work, she is involved in animal husbandry in her spare time.  She has been involved in this business for 12 years.  She is requesting the loan for the purchase of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Herlin Santana

texts.es:
El señor Herlin, trabaja en una empresa privada como guillotinista, es padre de dos hijas, con su esposa han logrado la cosntruccion de su vivienda, a si como el apoyo mutuo para cubrir los gastos, ya que tambien trabaja como ejecutiva de ventas.
Don Herlin ha venido haciendo mejora a su casa a traves del financiamiento, lo que ha avanzado mucho, con los creditos anteriores logro terminar el muro en la parte de atrás de su casa, dando mejor seguridad a su propiedad  como  a su familia.
Lo que quiere es comenzar el porche, logrando mejor espacio para su familia. en donde comprara materiales en piedras, bloques, quintales de hierro, bolsas de cementos, perlines, y comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Don Herlin works for a private company as a cutting machine operator. He is the father of two daughters. Herlin and his wife have built their own home and help each other with covering the expenses. He also works as a sales manager.

Don Herlin has been able to make improvements to his home through financing. He accomplished a great deal with his previous loans, such as finishing the wall behind his house so that he can have greater security over his property and for his family.

Herlin wants to begin building a porch so that he can provide more space for his family. He plans to buy stones, blocks, iron, bags of cement, and crossbeams so that the work can begin.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for building a porch.

loans.name: Shoy

texts.en:
Shoy lives in the Kompong Speu province.  To make a living, she has planted crops on her farmland, with her husband for the past twenty years. 

They can typically profit about $5 a day and that helps to cover their family’s needs.  They are blessed with four children; two are studying and one is a young child who lives under their care.  Another is employed as a foreman in the construction field. 

This is the rainy season and a good time for the couple to start a new crop, but their cow is too old and it cannot plow any longer.  Because of a lack of funds, Shoy and her husband request a loan to purchase a new cow.  

Shoy hopes to expand the size of her house and send their children to school through at least high school.  Shoy is very happy and thanks the lenders who made her first loan possible.

loans.use: to purchase a new cow for replacing the old one.

loans.name: Yadigar

texts.en:
Yadigar is 43 years old and lives with his wife and three children. He has been a farmer for more than 10 years. Together with his family, he grows diverse products such as cucumbers, onions, wheat, potatoes and other vegetables. It pleases him to sow diverse crops, as it is profitable to invest in a variety of vegetables and sell his harvest monthly, according to market demand. 

His business makes 150 USD per month. But the most tedious part is having to clear his land and take care of his crops day after day. This is his first loan with AqroInvest CU, and he is promising to repay the loan on time. Yadigar will invest the money in purchasing seeds, fertilizers and gardening tools.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and gardening tools

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy groceries like sugar, bread, milk, and drinks for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase various goods such as, salt, rice, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is married with six children. She is fifty  years old and lives in Mahayag, Dumingag, Zamboanga del Sur.

She has a business  to earn a living and  has had this business since she got married. Each month, she earns 4,100 PHP doing this business. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.

In the future, Lourdes hopes to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Eustaquio

texts.es: El señor Eustaquio, es originario de León, tiene 67 años de edad, padre de 7 hijos de los cuales dos de sus hijos los tiene estudiando en la escuela primaria, el es comerciante desde hace 20 años de edad vende ropa, zapato, cosméticos, productos de limpieza y aseo. Sus actividades inician desde tempranas horas de la mañana donde alista su humilde bolso cargándolo de mercadería para vender de casa en casa, entre buses y caminos polvorientos  sale a vender en lugares turísticos de la ciudad de León en busca del pan de cada día de manera digna y honrada, el vende su mercadería al contado y al crédito en lugares tales como Poneloya, LaCeiba, Las Peñitas que son los lugares donde mas vende antes de dedicarse al comercio el trabajaba en la agricultura. El solicita el préstamo para compra ropa, calzado y cosméticos para vender y lograr expandirse fueras de los lugares que actualmente vende. Uno de sus planes es expandir su s ventas a los municipios de Telica y Malpaisillo sobre todo aprovechar la temporada navideña.
texts.en:
Eustaquio is from León. He is 67, and the father of seven children. Two of his children are in primary school.  He has been a small businessman since he was 20, and sells clothing, shoes, cosmetics, as well as cleaning and hygiene products. 

He starts work in the early morning hours, when he gets his simple bag ready, loading it with merchandise to sell from door to door. Amidst the buses, and dusty roads, he goes out to sell at tourist sites in the city of León to earn his daily bread; decently and honestly.  

He sells his merchandise for cash and on credit in places such as Poneloya, La Ceiba, and Las Peñitas, where most of his sales are. Before working as a small businessman, he farmed. 

He is applying for the loan to buy clothing, shoes, and cosmetics to sell, and to expand his sales to places beyond those where he currently sells. One of his plans is to expand his sales to the municipalities of Telica and Malpaisillo; especially to take advantage of the Christmas season.

loans.use: To buy clothing, shoes, and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Simana Group

texts.en:
Receive greetings from Simana Group in Western Kenya! Phanice is the facilitator of Simana group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

She takes care of eight children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Phanice had a very good maize yield harvesting nine bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Phanice was only able to harvest three bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Phanice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from her maize sales, Phanice will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Simana group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Darlyn

texts.en:
Darlyn is 46 years old and married with five children who are currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Darlyn has run a tailoring business in the Philippines for 17 years. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her tailoring business. In the future, Darlyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Hai's Group

texts.en:
Ms Hai is 28 years old with 2 small children. Being a pharmacist, she runs a medicine shop which started in 2009. He business creates 4,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) in profit per month. Joining in Seda’s credit program, she finds that this kind of credit is very suitable. Currently, she wants to borrow a loan of 6,944,000 VND to buy more medicine for her shop.

Ms Dao is 49 years old. She makes tofu to buy in retail. She wants to borrow a loan of 7,840,000 VND to buy beans to use as material.
Ms Ty is 56 years old. Shes sells bamboo. She wants to have a loan of 6,048,000 VND to buy bamboo.
Ms Hoa is 35 years old. She makes spring roll covers. She wants to have a loan of 6,496,000 VND to buy material.

loans.use: to buy more medicine for her shop.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is a 27 year old woman. She is married and has one son. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. He has also worked in agriculture for the past 4 years in order to increase the family income. 

Laila wants to help her husband and share the expenses of purchasing a water tank to irrigate the crops. Because her husband's salary is not sufficient to cover the family daily expenses and the purchase of a water tank, Laila needs to take a loan from FATEN in the amount of $2,000. Taking this loan will enable her to share the expense of purchasing a water tank that will help to irrigate crops well so the family will have better crops and increase their sales. This will also increase the family income and offer the family better living conditions. Laila is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank to irrigate crops.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 43 years old, married with 3 children aged 3, 7 and 9. He runs a tailoring business to earn a living, and has been in this business for 4 years. He describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya he has been able to save his income. He hopes to put his children through good schools in the future. He has applied for 10,000 Kenya Shillings to buy material to tailor.

loans.use: To buy material to tailor.

loans.name: Jamieleh

texts.en: Jamieleh is a 55 year old widow woman who has 2 family members from Ashrafia Amman Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to pay for clothes to sell to her friends and neighbors in the same of area.In the future she wants to expand her project.Also she hopes to increase her income.

loans.use: to pay for clothes to sell

loans.name: Rejoyce

texts.en: Rejoice prepares cooked rice for school children in her vicinity. The children enjoys her food very well. Though the school children who patronise Real\'s meals she is of the view that she needs to provide a cover over the food she sells as required by the Sanitary Act of the local Government Law. Coupled with the training received from Kraban Support Foundation\'s TEACH lessons she believes that it is time she provides a simple cover over the food she sells to the children. To this end, she requires a credit facility of a $750 KIVA loan.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline resides in the Vingunguti area of Dar es Salaam. She owns a shop, selling different consumable items. She has been trained in food processing and canning from the ‘Small Industries Development Organisation’ (SIDO) in Dar es Salaam. The training has helped her a lot. She makes jam, mango pickles, butter and the like, which she sells in her shop. She recently received an order from a nearby region, Morogoro, to supply the items she produces. Since she has nothing to loose, the opportunity should be utilized. What makes her sleepless is inadequate capital. She needs to have enough raw, food preserving, and packaging materials. To implement her plan she needs USD 550.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Ear

texts.en: Mrs. Ear S., 24 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She makes her living by selling a variety of fruits such as mangoes, yams, grapes, and oranges at the local market. She typically makes around $50/day in revenue. Her husband, meanwhile, helps by driving a car to buy and transport fruit from a plantation, which is far from his village, then selling it to retailers at the market. This couple hopes to use the loan to purchase a car to transport their fruit from a plantation and the rest will be used for the business. S. is thinking about being a wholesaler one day.

loans.use: To purchase a car to transport fruit

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is happily married and has one daughter and a grandson. She operates a flourishing shoe shop at the Central Market in Melitopol. Irina has been in the shoe selling business for 15 years and has built up a great repertoire of clients. Her central location helps to ensure that she has plenty of business.

Irina would like to be able to purchase a new supply of seasonal shoes. She has requested a $1200 loan which would enable her to purchase 200 pairs of shoes. She has a wonderful and solid reputation with Nadiya Ukraine and is a very goal-oriented and hard-working person. Her fifteen years in the shoe business attest to that. Irina’s long term goals are to continue to watch her business grow so that she can help her daughter and grandson and provide a stable income for her family.

loans.use: Purchase inventory for her shoe shop

loans.name: Fiti

texts.en:
Fiti V. belongs to Mulivai Leauvaa centre. She is a strong married mother of nine kids. She was employed at one of the companies in Apia but she resigned because of so many kids, no one look after them.

Fiti gets more money from selling cocoa to the village and shops in town than the pay she gets for a week. She brings in 1-2 bags of cocoa once a week for sale and she gets $100.00-$120.00. She uses that money to pay school fees, family expenses, and for her business.

loans.use: To buy more chemicals, knives, fertilizers, and a crowbar

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a 35-year old widow who lives with her three children in the town of Rongo, Kenya. She is well-known in this area because she has been trained in providing home-based health-care services. She is also a successful businesswoman who started selling clothes door-to-door in 1992. She used the funds from her first loan to start her own shop.  Business is so good that she has hired one person to help her run the shop and meet the demands of her many customers.  Beatrice has applied for a loan of $500 to purchase additional second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.use: Purchase second-hand clothes

loans.name: Ligoma Group

texts.en:
Maureen operates a second hand clothes business. She has been in this business for a period of one year and she got her initial capital from an informal rotating savings arrangment which her group used to have. This is commonly referred to as a “merry go round”. This is what she has been using to finance her business and ploughing back profits into her business. She is 29 years old and married with two children.

Her business location is in a place called Maseno in the Kisumu district. Her business is near a university (Maseno University) and most of her clients are from the university community. She hopes to use the loan to increase her business stock so that she can carry more clothes in inventory of several varieties more consistently. This has been necessitated by the growing market due to increased dependence of the increasing student population on nearby clothes. Her clothes are preferred since they are cheaper than new clothes. She also intends to diversify into selling juice after having established and learned that it is a fast-paying business in the locality.

Maureen uses the proceeds from her business to supplement her family's income as her husband's income is small. Her husband is employed in junior ranks and hence has little money to support the business. She saves part of the income for her children and ploughs back the rest to the business. This is her first loan both for her and for the group. She is a sub group leader and has displayed good leadership skills.

Though this is the first time the group is taking a loan, they have displayed a high degree of cohesiveness during group preparation and training. All members of the group come on time and have shown commitment to follow group policies and procedures.

The location of Maureen's business is very strategic as it is close to the university student community who are most of her customers. Most students and the community around can't afford to buy new clothes and hence her business has a high chance of growth.

loans.use: To increase stock of clothing materials. Diversify in to business of selling juice.

loans.name: Ulyana

texts.en:
Ulyana has a small clothing sales business at a market near the bus station in Mukachevo, Ukraine. She started her business about six years ago and it has developed into a stable, profitable enterprise. Ulyana makes about $300 in a typical month, a valuable source of income for her family of four.

Ulyana would like to expand her business by opening a second sales location. She has requested a loan of $1000 to help her with related expenses. Ulyana has been a good client with Nadiya Ukraine in the past. We are happy to be able to assist her in further developing her business.

loans.use: Open a new sales location

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha does her business in Vituka area, a Dar Es Salaam city suburb.   She runs a shop selling both used and new clothes and bags; including school bags and ladies' bags. She has been doing business for the past 5 years and its has really improved her life.  She is now able to send her  two kids to school because of her increase in income. She is in need of USD $1200 to help her expand the business .

loans.use: EXPAND BUSINESS

loans.name: Vero

texts.en:
Vero is 32 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 15,12 and 6 years old. Vero sells cloth and cosmetics. She started in 2005. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business.

In the past, Vero has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Leonidas Pedro

texts.es:
The businessman Leonidas G. is 51-year-old married father of three. For 25 years he’s been selling fish and shellfish like lobster, snails and shrimp. He buys these products directly from artesian fishermen primarily from Bluefields and El Bluff port. He used to sell to the general public in Bluefields. Currently, he’s only buying fish and snails because it’s closed season on shrimp and lobster. This businessman solicits your financial support to buy 250 pounds of Yellowtail at $.90 US per pound, 250 pounds of Pargo at $.90 US per pound and 250 pounds of Croaker at $.80 US per pound.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

El microempresario Leonidas G. tiene 51 años de edad, es originario de Bluefields, es casado tiene 3 hijos y desde hace 25 años se dedica a comprar mariscos, entre estos langostas, pescados, caracoles y camarones. Estos productos se los compra directamente a pescadores artesanales principalmente de Bluefields y el Puerto el Bluff. Posteriormente los vende a la poblacion en general de Bluefields. Actualmente solo esta comprando pescados y caracoles ya que tanto el camaron como la langosta se encuentran en veda. Este microempresario solicita el apoyo con un financiamiento para la compra de: 250 libras de pescado llelotiel el cual compra a US$ 0.90 dolares cada libra, 250 libras de pescado Pargo, el cual compra a US$ 0.90 dolares cada libra y 250 libras de pescado Roncador el cual compra a US$ 0.80 dolares cada libra.

loans.use: To buy 250 pounds of Yellowtail, 250 pounds of Pargo and 250 pounds of Croaker.

loans.name: Lupe

texts.es:
It is Lupe’s wish to give the best and necessary to her 3 young children so they may become successful members of their community and she will spare no effort to reach her goal with the support of her beloved husband. She uses her talent to make beautiful fabrics and produce lovely bedspreads to be sold at the mine where her husband works and at the same time she gets to visit him periodically. It is her dream project to install a space there and start to prepare and offer varied dishes of food to the hundreds of workers that leave all their strength behind carrying out their work in the mine.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Lupe, tiene el anhelo de ofrecerle lo mejor y necesario a sus 3 pequeños niños para que estos puedan desempeñarse con éxito dentro de su comunidad y no escatimará esfuerzos para lograrlo con ayuda de su amado esposo. Ella utiliza su talento para realizar bellos tejidos y producir hermosas colchas de cama a fin de ofertarlas en la mina en la que labora su esposo y a la vez visitarlo periódicamente. Tiene en mente el gran proyecto de instalarse en este espacio e iniciar a preparar diversos platillos para ofrecerlos a los centenares de trabajadores que día a día dejan toda su fuerza en el desempeño de esta labor.

loans.use: Increase capital to start new business.

loans.name: Natiga

texts.en: Natiga H. is a 36-year-old woman who sells milk and yogurt to local people and neighbors. Mainly she keeps a cow for her family and sells the rest of the milk. No one in her family has a job so selling milk and poultry sometimes brings some money to their family. Their main source of income is an Internally Displaced People benefit, which is about $70 USD a month. This amount is not enough to cover their basic family needs. Natiga wants to focus more on selling dairy products, which is why she applied for the loan of $800 USD to purchase one milk cow.

loans.use: To purchase one milk cow.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
Feliciana is a hardworking mother. She has been able to get through very difficult times due to poverty, with the support of her husband and three grown up children. One of her children is a teacher, and he helped Feliciana set up a small general store. Thanks to her sons, she now runs her small shop from her house.

The loan Feliciana is requesting would allow her to expand the products she sells and increase her stock of basic items. She also raises small pigs which she sells. She invested wisely with her son's support, and she will do the same with this loan, making the payments on time and growing her business. She believes that when somebody gives you a hand, you respond with kindness and honesty.

Feliciana es una mujer muy trabajadora, que a pesar de haber pasado por momentos críticos a causa de la pobreza en la que se encontraba, pudo salir adelante gracias al apoyo de su esposo y de sus tres hijos quienes ahora son mayores, uno de ellos es profesor y ayudó doña Feliciana a abrir su pequeña bodega. Gracias a sus hijos, que ahora Feliciana cuenta con una tienda en su casa, surtida con algunos dulces. El préstamo que ella solicita ahora es para ampliar la variedad de sus productos y vender también productos de primera necesidad. Feliciana también cría chanchos, los cuida y alimenta y cuando llegan a la edad y peso adecuado, los vende. Con este préstamo, ella podría también comprar más cerdos. Feliciana ha invertido adecuadamente el apoyo que le brindó su hijo y promete que de igual manera, confíen que este monto será invertido correctamente en su negocio y responsable en sus pagos. Ella sabe que cuando alguien le tiende la mano, le debe corresponder con cariño y honestidad.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MERCHANDISE FOR HER SMALL GENERAL STORE,  AS WELL AS MORE SMALL PIGS WHICH SHE RAISES AND SELLS.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 58-year-old trader who is married with four children. She has sold used clothes and shoes in a local market in Accra for twelve years. With this business, she has been able to support three children through senior high school. Her major challenge over the years has been getting the funds to expand her business. Mary has amassed lots of marketing experience and is very confident that the loan would enable her to make remarkable business progress.

Mary is seeking this loan to buy more bales of used clothes and shoes, increasing her inventory and its variety. She says her greatest joy would be to provide all of her children with a quality education and allow them a brighter future. She hopes to save enough to fulfill this dream of hers. Mary is a member a group called Nyame yie Trust Group. Members in this group support one another in the repayment of their loans.

loans.use: To increase stock of used clothes and shoes

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is married with two grown daughters, 17 and 21 years old. Together with her daughters, she sells children's clothing in the central market of Simferopol, Crimea. Alla has been in this business for 5 years. Currently, she gets about $5000 of gross income each month. Her net profit is over $400 a month.

Alla's business is constantly growing. Two of the advantages she has in the competitive market are affordable prices and regular additions to her inventory. Her little vending kiosks are very popular in the marketplace where she works. Alla realizes that lending services are very helpful to her business, as loans allow her to increase her turnover capital and expand her business. She would like to make it easier for parents to find comfortable and good quality clothing for their kids, which is why she is requesting a loan of 5000 Grivnas. One of Alla's further plans is to continue expanding her trade and eventually generate enough profit to finish remodeling her house and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To open a new children's clothing vending facility

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara M. is 60 years old. She is divorced and a mother with 12 children. 

She sells food stuffs like maize, plantain, cassava and oil in the community market. Her business is on a very small scale because of inadequate working capital. She believes the loan will help her to inject more capital into the business. 

She wants to use the loan to buy stock of bulk maize, plantain, cassava and rice to increase her inventory. Price hikes are another challenge to her business emanating from the current food crisis. She hopes to cut down on costs through bulk purchases. 

She trusts bulk savings would enable her to save enough to support at least two of her kids in school. She is a member of the trust group called "Nyame Mma" meaning God's children Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee one another and assist each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy stock of maize, plantain, cassava and rice

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mrs. Chea S. is a villager in Angkunh village in Takeo Province. She owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice where she and her husband, Mr. Long Neang (pictured on the right in the photo), work as farmers. She is 51-years-old and the mother of six children; five of whom are employed in a garment factory while the sixth works in a casino club.

Even though Mrs. Chea S.’s family members are involved in several different businesses, they still do not earn enough money to support their living conditions. Thus, Mrs. Chea S. has decided to request for a loan to purchase a cow to improve her farming livelihood. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to improve her farming livelihood.

loans.name: Edem

texts.en: Coges, Inc. is a pharmacy that was created by Madame Edem G. and her husband in Wome, Togo.  Edem runs the shop most days, and she and her husband have two children who both attend school nearby.  Coges, Inc. is well known and respected in Wome for the quality of its products.  With this loan from Kiva, Edem hopes to go to Lomé, the Togolese capital that is approximately 130 kilometers away, to restock their shop with anti-malarial and other medications to resell in Wome.  With the profits she and her husband will earn from their increased business, they will be able to pay their childrens’ school fees and improve their quality of life.  In the picture she is the person on the right.

loans.use: To restock her shop with anti-malarial and other medications for resale.

loans.name: Kimleang

texts.en: Mrs. Kimleang L. lives in Sou Sean village in Kampong Cham province. She is employed in a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Meas Veasna, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. He now wants to be a motorbike taxi driver but he does not have enough money to buy a motorbike. In order to deal this problem, Mrs. Kimleang L. decided to request a loan to add to her savings to purchase a motorbike to start the new business, in order to increase their income to support the household. She is 26 years old and the mother of a child who is attending the local school. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to start a new business, in order to increase her income to support the household.

loans.name: Leocadia

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 43 year old Leocadia M. from Mwanza. She is married with five children, between the ages of fourteen and twenty. Leocadia has been running a Furniture business since1990. Her business is selling beds, tables, and chairs. She works at the business for twelve hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by two employees. Leocadia currently earns about 300usd a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 1200usd in order to buy a wood working machine. In the future, she plans to increase her inventory of furniture stock. Leocadia thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy a wood working machine

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda A. is a pig farmer. She finds it challenging and profitable. She is 56 years old and has 5 children. Her husband, Rogelio, is a jeepney driver. Luzviminda believes that her husband's limited income will make it hard for them to raise and send all of their children to school.

Luzviminda is asking for a loan of Php 6,000 to purchase more piglets and feed for her pigs. She is also interested in looking at other potential sources of income. This will provide her with enough money to care for and educate her children.

CEVI is helping Luzviminda to grow her business. CEVI has provided Luzviminda with credit assistance, training, and insurance services.

loans.use: Buy more piglets

loans.name: Faizigul

texts.ru: Розикова Файзигуль проживает в городе Вахдат . Возраст 40 лет. Женат и имеет пятерых  детей.Занитмается шитьем базарных сумок. Кредит планирует использовать для того, чтобы закупить материал. Погасить кердит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Faizigul R. lives in Vakhdat. She is 40 years old and is married with five children. She makes a living by making shopping bags. She would like to receive a loan in order to purchase the necessary materials. She would be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase materials

loans.name: Akouwa

texts.fr: Mme Akouwa A. est née le 13 juin 1955 au Ghana. Elle est mariée avec quatre (04) enfants à charge. C'est une femme très dynamique qui exerce comme activité la culture des champignons. C'est un produit alimentaire très apprécié dans l'art culinaire et utilisé dans la préparation des sauces comme du poisson. Actuellement, la demande dépasse l'offre  mais elle n'a pas les moyens financiers pour répondre aux besoins de ses clients. C'est pourquoi elle demande un crédit pour acheter les outils de travail et tous les éléments qui entrent dans cette culture. Les bénéfices tirés lui permettront d'améliorer les conditions d'existence de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Akouwa A. was born on June 13, 1955 in Ghana. She is married with four children to look after. She a very energetic woman and runs a business growing mushrooms. This is a food much valued in cooking and is used in the same way as fish to make sauces. Demand now exceeds supply, but she does not have the financial means to meet customer requirements. This is why she is requesting a loan so that she can buy the tools of her trade and all the elements involved in mushroom growing. The profit will enable her to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Growing and selling mushrooms

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita A. is blessed to send all her children to college and have their own family. The couple worked together to grow their business. Rebecca joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) to get capital to support her store. She is applying for a loan to buy assorted feed varieties to retail. 

Aside from the purpose of earning an income, she wants to serve her neighbors in the village in order for them not to have to go  to the town proper anymore just to buy a kilo of feed. She hopes that in the future, she can have a stall in the market and save for their old age.

loans.use: To buy assorted feed varieties to retail

loans.name: Oishahon

texts.ru: Бизнес Оишахон развивается и одним из ее достижений является подключение к этому виду бизнеса ее старшей дочери. Оишахон помогла ей с арендой торговой точки, научила нюансам бизнеса и сейчас ее дочь успешно работает. Оишахон по прежнему занимается куплей продажей зелени. Сейчас сезон продажи зелени и Оишахон каждый день в 4 утра выезжает на оптовый рынок в город Худжанд (100 километров) за товаром. К 7 утра она уже раскладывает товар на прилавке, а кроме этого раздает оптом тут же на рынке. Прибыль остается нормальная и Оишахон надеется что сможет улучшить свои социальные условия жизни.
texts.en:
Oishahon’s business is developing. One of her achievements has been including her oldest daughter. Oishahon has helped her with rent for her shop and has taught her the nuances of the business, so now her daughter successfully works in sales. Oishahon works buying and selling greens. Now is the season to sell greens, so Oishahon leaves every morning at 4am to buy goods at the wholesale market in Khujand (100 kilometers away). By 7am, she already has the goods displayed on the counter, and additionally she sells goods wholesale there and then in the market. Her profit is average, and Oishahon hopes that she can improve their living conditions.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 47-year-old Emmy F. from Mbeya. Emmy has been running a general store, purchasing and selling different commodities, since 2006. She works at the business for 9 to 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by two family members. Emmy currently earns about $130 US a month. She is divorced with three children between the ages of 21 and 29.

Emmy is requesting a loan in order to purchase items in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to reopen the business in a new location. Emmy thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through microleasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor coverage of basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase items in bulk

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda C. is a banana vendor. She earns a reasonable profit from selling snack items like banana chips, boiled bananas, and fried bananas to the her neighbors who while away their time talking as they sit on the outside benches. Leonarda is 53 years old and has three children. Her husband, Honorato C., drives a motorcycle taxi. 

Leonarda has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase bananas. The loan will help her increase the number of bananas that she sells and earn a larger income for her family.

Because of CEVI, Leonarda is better able to support her family. CEVI provides not just loans but trainings and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase bananas

loans.name: Jervie

texts.en: Jervie O. is from the village of Bagong Silang, Balangasan, Pagadian City. She is 21 years old, married, and has two infant children. Jervie owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. Jervie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig-feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig-feed and other supplies

location.town: Pagadian - Balangasan District, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane E., 40, lives with her husband Jose, 47, and their three children in the hilly portion of Phase 1, Bagong Silang, Caloocan City.  Jose makes a living as a taxi driver, and all of their children are in school.

Jane, as she is fondly called by her friends, makes a living selling cosmetics and shoes. She buys items from prominent providers in cash so that she can take advantage of rebates, and sells them to customers with payments due weekly or bi-monthly.

She joined CCT last year and is now on her third loan.  She used her most recent loan to build up her inventories.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and shoes to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en: Mahdi is a 29-year-old single man living with his parents. He has been working as a carpenter since 2001 to provide, along with his brother, better living conditions for his parents. Today, Mahdi is requesting to borrow $1,000 to purchase a specific machine to cut wood in order to increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase a chancellor for his business

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es: Emiliana tiene 34 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa y cuidadosa, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Leonardo de 34 años y su hija Sandra de 14 años, y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro con tal de sobre salir en la vida. Todos los días desde las 5 de la tarde, Emiliana empieza a cocinar su delicioso pollimote (menudencias de pollo y mote fritos), el cual llegada las 7 de la noche saldrá a vender a su puesto de siempre. Ella tiene muchos clientes, quienes conocedores de su gran sazón no dudan en buscarla y saborear más de una porción. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, ya que de esta manera hace que la larga jornada de trabajo pasa más rápido, lleva 4 años en esta actividad y considera que los más difícil es tener que vender en las estaciones de invierno y otoño, ya que el frió en esas épocas es muy fuerte y muchas veces le ha causado enfermedades respiratorias, aun así sabe que tiene que continuar con su trabajo. Para el futuro espera alquilar un local donde puedas vender su pollimote con mayor comodidad. Este es el primer préstamo de Emiliana con MFP y se siente en la responsabilidad de pagarlo a tiempo para poder acceder a otro, en su banco comunal es muy activa y siempre participa de todas las decisiones que se toman. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ingredientes para preparar su delicioso pollimote.
texts.en:
Emiliana, 34 years old, is a very loving and attentive mother. She lives in her own house with her husband Leonardo, who is 34 years old, and her daughter Sandra, who is 14. She is willing to work hard in order to excel in life. Everyday since 5 in the afternoon Emiliana starts cooking her delicious “pollimote” (fried giblets and hominy), which as soon as the clock hits 7 p.m. she will sell at her usual spot.

She has many customers, who knowing the great flavor of her food do not hesitate to look for it and to enjoy more than one serving. What she likes the most about her work is to talk to her customers since this way her long working hours pass by faster. She has been doing this activity for 4 years. She considers having to sell during winter and autumn the hardest part of this work because the severe cold weather during these seasons has for may times caused her to be ill. Even so, she knows she must continue to work.

In the future, she hopes that she will be able to rent a location where she can sell her “pollimote” more comfortably. This is Emiliana’s first loan with MFP. She feels a responsibility to repay on time so that she can access another loan. With the amount of 500 new soles that she is requiring she will buy more ingredients to prepare her delicious “pollimote”.


Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Fernandes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to prepare "pollimote"

loans.name: Hidaya

texts.en:
Hidaya is a member of the Bwawani borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 35 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children.Her children are aged 11,8,4 years.

Hidaya started her own grocery business selling beer,soda 7 years ago,she works 12hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 210,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Hidaya`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 350,000 Tsh in order to buy more soda and beer.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan,Hidaya hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more beer,soda

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina operates a general store in their village in Parog Parog, Solana, Cagayan. Aside from managing her store, Gina is also a dealer of cosmetics and apparel from AVON, Natasha, and MSE. She wants to expand her business thus, she is asking for a loan of PHP 23,000. She plans to buy more grocery items for her store and to purchase more products for her direct sales business.

She hopes to increase her business capital and her income; that’s why she is working with double effort. She is married to Melecio, a farmer, 43 years old, and they are blessed with two children. The loan she is requesting will help her family achieve a better standard of living someday.

loans.use: working capital for her store and direct sales businesses

loans.name: María Marta

texts.es: María Marta A. M. de 32 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Cabañas junto a su esposo y  sus tres  hijos. María ayuda a su esposo en los gastos de la familia, ya que el esposo de María trabaja como agricultor, donde recibe un sueldo muy bajo que no cubre las necesidades básica de la familia, es por eso, es que María ha instalado una tienda la cual le permite generar ganancias que son un gran soporte en la economía familiar, pero ahora María solicita de un crédito para invertir en su negocio surtiéndolo de mas productos que le ayuden a incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
María Marta A. M., 32 years of age, lives in the department of Cabañas together with her husband and three children. María helps her husband with the family expenses since her husband is employed as an agricultural worker and receives a very low salary which does not cover the family’s basic necessities. That’s why María has opened a shop which allows her to generate profits that are of great support to the family finances.

Now, María is applying for a loan in order to invest in her business, supplying it with more products that will help her to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her business

loans.name: Silvia Patricia

texts.es:
La socia Patricia; pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU SAN JERONIMO”; nuestra socia es natural de la ciudad del  Cusco.

Nuestra socia  tiene 43 años de edad, ella es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, la socia  alterna sus  actividades del hogar con  el trabajo de doméstica, nuestra socia hace el aseo y limpieza general de casas, ella trabaja desde hace muchos años limpiando casa y es así como ella saca adelante a sus 3 hijos. Ella desea el préstamo para la educación de uno de ellos.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo que le brindan mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This is Patricia. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Kantu San Jeronimo” and a native of Cusco.

Patricia is 43 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 3 children. She divides her time between her household chores and her job as a housekeeper. She has been cleaning houses for several years while raising her 3 children. She is requesting a loan to pay educational expenses for one of them.

Patricia appreciates and values the loan that has been provided to her. She agrees to make her payments on the established due dates.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Educational expenses for one of her children

loans.name: Brisas De California Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “Brisas de California”, esta ubicado en la entrada de Chosica, distrito de Lurigancho es una alcancía que trabaja con EDAPROSPO- Prosperidad desde hace unos días, esta conformado por 7 socios, asume el cargo de presidenta la señora Celia Rosa de 45 años de edad, casada, con 6 hijos dependientes, se dedica a la venta ambulatoria de maíz, papa, queso, morón, menestras, entre otros. Celia incursiono en este negocio porque ella es de la Sierra Central D. país y tiene la facilidad de que su familia le provee los productos para poder venderlos, un grupo de socios se dedican a las actividades de servicio como ayudante cocinero, otro presta servicio de albañil y chofer de transporte publico y otro grupo se dedica a la venta de  comidas y refrescos en los mercados.
 Nuestros socios decidieron el nombre de Brisas de California ya que en el lugar donde viven tiene dicho nombre y se sienten mas identificados con el, con su reciente préstamo todos los socios lo invertirán para ampliar su pequeño negocio y con ello tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Los socios están muy contentos y valoran el apoyo brindado y se comprometen a la devolución  D. préstamo en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
The “Brisas de California” [California Breezes] communal bank is located at the entrance to Chosica, Lurigancho district. It’s a new communal bank that has been working with EDAPROSPO-Prosperidad for a few days. It is made up of 7 members. The president is Celia Rosa. She is 45 years old and married, with six dependant children. She sells corn, potatoes, cheese, vegetable stews, and other things as a street vendor. Celia got into this business because she is from the central mountains areas of the country and she has the advantage that her family supplies her with the products to sell. One group of members work in services, such as: being a cook’s assistant; another works as a mason and a bus driver. Another group of members sells food and drinks in the markets. Our members decided to use the name “Brisas de California” because this is the name of the place where they live and they identify with it. Their recent loan, each member will invest to expand their small businesses and therefore have a better quality of life. The members are very content and they value the support provided to them and they pledge to repay the loan in the determined amount of time.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: con su reciente préstamo todos los socios lo invertirán para ampliar su pequeño negocio

loans.name: Tabotsaneh Group

texts.en:
These are members of the Tabutsaneh group. This will be the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. They have been in business for many years now but business has been developing at a very slow pace. They have thus come to SMT/Kiva to seek a loan of SLL 1,500,000 (or SLL 500,000 for each) to help them improve their businesses. 

Wurie T. in the middle is the leader of this group. Wurie was born in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. He is married with four children. Wurie’s wife is a petty businesswoman and his children are attending school -- one is in junior secondary school and the rest are in primary school. Wurie sells palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil) and husk rice. He has been a businessman for eight years now. He will use this loan to buy husk-rice which he will clean and sell.

loans.use: Buy bags of husk rice

loans.name: Ginna Denisse

texts.es: Ginna Denisse de 25 años es soltera, no tiene hijos, es Licenciada en Contabilidad, trabaja en BANCENTRO Juigalpa desde hace 4 años como cajera, habita junto a su mamá, quien le dio un pequeño espacio para construir su casita la cual ha ido acondicionando poco a poco poniendole ceramica a la sala y construyendo 2 cuartos, sin embargo les falta construir un pequeño garaje por lo que esta solicitando su 2do credito, pues tiene planes de matrimonio y su futuro esposo tiene un vehiculo y necesitan dejarlo en un lugar seguro, el novio trabaja como agente vendedor de medicamentos en los municipios aledaños y le apoya en esta gestion, ya que juntos desean que su hogar tenga las condiciones necesarias para cuando lleguen los hijos.  A pesar que ambos son jovenes son muy responsables con sus compromisos, Ginna es muy querida por sus compañeros de trabajo y tiene como meta seguir estudiando para lograr obtener mejores oportunidades de trabajo que le permitan seguir mejorando su casa.
texts.en:
Ginna Denisse is 25 years old and does not have any children. She has a degree in accounting and has worked as a cashier at Bancentro Juigalpa for four years. She lives with her mother, who gave her a small space to build her own house. Little by little, she has been setting it up, putting ceramic in the living room and constructing two bedrooms. However, they still need to build a small garage, for which she is requesting her second loan. She has plans to get married, and her future husband has a vehicle, which needs to be kept in a safe place. Her fiancee works as a medical salesman in the adjacent municipalities and supports her in this process, since together they desire to have a home that is adequate for when they have children. Despite both of them being young, they are very responsible with their commitments. Ginna is loved by her coworkers and has a goal to continue studying in order to obtain better job opportunities that will allow her to keep improving her house.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a garage

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: La señora Ma Isabel G. es casada con el señor Ángel Guardián Sierra y son padres de familia de 2 niños, el labora en asociacion con una empresa contratista como pintor industrial, y su negocio lleva por nombre “Rótulos Mary “ya que a ese negocio se dedican como familia, además de este ingreso perciben otro que es el de pintura de automóviles, y para estos negocios están tramitando el crédito ya que desean invertir en mayor mercancía.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Isabel G. is married to Mr. Ángel Guardián Sierra; they have two children. Mr. Sierra works as an industrial painter as a subcontractor with a larger company. His company's name is “Rótulos Mary“ (Tags Mary) because this is a family business. Another source of income comes from their auto-painting business. The loan they are requesting today will be invested in improving these businesses by buying supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying supplies for their painting businesses

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa is sixty years old. She is a widowed woman and has given birth to six children. All of her children are out of school. She lives with some of her children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. Adwoa is a trader. She trades in cereals - maize. She procures bags of maize from nearby communities and supplies to food vendors and retailers in her community. She also treks to other towns to supply. Adwoa trades in firewood as well. She has been in business for over thirty years and wants to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy maize.

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en: Wilfreda M. is from the village of Owaon. She is 48 years old. Wilfreda is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Wilfreda manufactures and sells iron products to local businesses and community members. Wilfreda has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 1,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2006, Wilfreda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilfreda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Wilfreda is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to pay the tuition fees of her children. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Wilfreda from PMPC and this is her second time with Kiva. She wishes that someday her children can gain degrees. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees

loans.name: Wilima

texts.en: Wilima M. is currently in the business of selling sodas and beer at home and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer and sodas to sell. Wilima is 30 years old and is married to a policeman. She has six children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer and sodas to sell

loans.name: Hotel Lane Traders Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the 'Hotel-Lane Traders' from Magburaka town, northern Sierra Leone. They have formed themselves into a group to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each person from SMT/Kiva lenders. They made Isatu K. the group’s leader. Isatu is 36 years of age, married to a businessman, and they have 3 children. Two are in secondary school and one is still not of school-going age. For 2 years now, Isatu has been selling clothes – shirts, skirts, bras, etc. With her share of the loan, she will invest in her business by buying shirts, skirts, and bras wholesale to add to her current stock. 

(On the right in the photo is Loan Officer Abdul Karim Conteh handing over the loan during disbursement.)

loans.use: Buy shirts, skirts, and bras wholesale to add to her current stock

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo es un señor que está casado, tiene tres hijos de 19-13 y 12 años de edad respectivamente, todos sus hijos están a su cargo y estudiando. La casa donde vive Wilfredo y su familia es casa propia pero todavía no tiene la documentación y solo cuenta con un plano aprobado. Wilfredo se dedica a trabajar en su taxi y presta también algunas horas como servicio de seguridad en su zona. Existe mucha competencia en el servicio de taxis, no obstante el incremento de la población en  el oriente del país ha aumentado la demanda de pasajeros. El crédito fue para capital de trabajo es decir para la reparación y mejoramiento del vehículo. Wilfredo es un cliente que paga oportunamente sus amortizaciones; siendo este su cuarto crédito en nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is married and has three children, who are 19, 13, and 12 years old respectively. All of his children are in school and under his care. The house that Wilfredo and his family reside in is theirs but he still hasn't formalized the documentation and only has an approved building plan. Wilfredo provides public transportation services with his taxi; he also works as a part-time security guard in his neighborhood. There is a lot of competition in the taxi business. However, population increase in the eastern part of the country has increased passenger demand. He will use the funds for maintenance and repair of his vehicle. Wilfredo is a client who repays on time; this is his 4th loan with our institution.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair

loans.name: Wennie

texts.en:
Wennie S. is from the village of Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Wennie is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Wennie owns & operates a carenderia business serving local foods to customers in the local community. Wennie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Wennie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wennie has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Wennie is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 12th loan taken out by Wennie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Tamara's Group

texts.ru:
Тамара Жайлообаева, лидер группы – жительница г. Каракол. Этот город издавна славен своей необычайной красотой окружающей его природы. Туристы из многих стран приезжают сюда, чтобы насладиться чистым горным воздухом, катанием на лыжах на лыжных базах загородом, а также просто посмотреть на природу, на горные ели и величественные горы Кыргызстана. 
Тамаре пятьдесят восемь лет. Она живёт вместе с мужем, старшим сыном, невесткой и младшей дочерью. Муж Тамары – пенсионер и последние годы находится на постоянном отдыхе. Старший сын – таксист. Второй сын – студент. Он учится в одном из столичных ВУЗов. Одних заработков сына на всю семью естественно не хватает и Тамара и её муж занимаются домашним хозяйством. Они выращивают картошку и сдают молоко ежедневно по пять – шесть литров,  и это приносит им около двух тысяч сомов ежемесячно. А также Тамара продаёт яйца. Однажды Тамара с мужем повезли двадцать тонн картошки в Казахстан и удачно её реализовали. Им удалось приобрести кашар (это стойло (stall) или загон для скота, который находится у подножия гор, рядом с пастбищами). Сейчас их скот находится в кашаре. Таким образом, дома все заняты делом. Тамаре, необходима кое – какая помощь. Она нуждается в кредите, чтобы купить ГСМ на полевые работы. Нужно подготовить поле к посадке картофеля. 

Джумакул Солтоевой пятьдесят лет. Она воспитала пятерых детей. Джумакул всю жизнь старалась ради детей и до сих пор не знала отдыха. Она и сейчас работает в школе раздатчиком в буфете. Её зарплата составляет всего восемьсот тридцать сомов. Муж Джумакул занимается электро – сварочными работами, а один из сыновей занимается сельским хозяйством. Поэтому Джумакул надеется получить этот кредит и помочь сыну купить ГСМ на полевые работы.

Кенжекан Рысбековой сорок восемь лет. У Кенжекан шестеро детей. Старшей дочери двадцать семь, а самому младшему сыну одиннадцать лет. Кенжекан работает заведующим сельского ФАПа, а муж вышел на пенсию и не работает. Кенжекан надеется получить кредит, чтобы купить ГСМ и помочь сыну в полевых работах.

Жылдыз Узаковой двадцать пять лет. У Жылдыз два сына – близнецов. Муж Жылдыз работает трактористом – комбайнером, а Жылдыз ежедневно сдаёт по пять литром молока и тем самым помогает мужу кормить семью. Жылдыз обратилась за этим кредитом, с целью закупить ГСМ для весенних работ на поле. Они собираются сажать пшеницу. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Tamara J., the leader of this group, is a resident of the town of Karakol. This town has been long known for the unique beauty of its surrounding nature. Tourists from many countries come here to enjoy the clean mountain air, skiing at ski resorts and also just look at the nature, mountain trees and majestic mountains of Kyrgyzstan. Tamara is fifty-eight years old. She lives together with her husband, oldest son, daughter-in-law and youngest daughter. Tamara’s husband is retired and spent the last few years on permanent rest. The oldest one is a taxi driver. The second son is a student. He goes to one of the universities in the capital. The son’s salary is obviously not enough for the whole family, and Tamara and her husband are involved in a domestic business. They grow potatoes and milk, five to six liters, per day, and this yields them close to two thousand som per month. Also, Tamara sells eggs. Once Tamara and her husband took twenty tons of potatoes to Kazakhstan and successfully sold it. They were able to buy a kashar (barn for livestock located at the bottom of the mountains near a pasture). So everyone in the family stays busy. Tamara needs some help. She needs a loan in order to buy diesel fuel for field work. It is needed to prepare the field for sowing potatoes. Djumakul S. is fifty years old. She raised five children. Djumakul tried to provide for her children all her life and to this day, finds no rest. Even now, she works at a school as a server at a buffet. Her salary is only eight hundred thirty som. Djumakul’s husband is involved in electrical and welding work, and one of the sons is involved in agriculture. This is why Djumakul hopes to obtain this loan and help her son buy diesel fuel for field work. Kenjekan R. is forty-eight years old. She has six children. The oldest daughter is twenty-seven, and the youngest son is eleven years old. Kenjekan works at the village outpatient clinic, and the husband retired and does not work. She hopes to get this loan in order to buy diesel fuel and help her son with field work. Jyldyz U. is twenty-five years old. She has two twin sons. Her husband works as a tractor-combainer driver, and Jyldyz sells five liters of milk daily, which helps the husband support the family. She requested this loan in order to buy diesel fuel for spring field work. They plan to plant wheat.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of diesel fuel for field work

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is widowed with eight children and all her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She resides in and owns a house where the family stays.  Margaret owns a poultry farm at her home, a business that she is proud of because she manages to pay school fees for her children. Besides this poultry business, she also gets some income from rental houses. Her major customers are shopkeepers and families who stay near her home. Margaret's business challenges include transportation of chicken feed and thieves. She uses public transport to and from shopping. She wants to use this loan to buy chicken feed and 200 chicks. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Margaret aspires to see her business grow big and own 2,000 chickens. She joined MCDT because she wanted to generate capital for her poultry farm.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed and 200 chicks

loans.name: God's Mercy Group

texts.en:
David Q. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called God’s Mercy. He is married and has 10 children. He also cares for 6 siblings. He could not continue his education through college.

For 15 years David has sold radios at the Redlight market in Paynesville, Liberia. He sells quality goods to customers which keeps them returning. He started selling with 4000 LRD as working capital and now he has more than 35000 LRD. Sometimes when goods finish from the market, it can be very hard to see what is not good for business.

He plans to use his 8000 LRD portion of this 34000 LRD group loan to buy more radios to sell. His goal is to expand to a bigger business and educate his children to a higher standard.

David describes himself as a pastor and a hard working man.

In the photo David is holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more radios to sell.

loans.name: El Campanario Group

texts.es:
El grupo Campanario está integrado por tres personas trabajadoras una de ellas es Jesica Zeledon, coordinadora del grupo quien desde hace tres años puso un pequeño caramanchel en su casa donde vende ropa nueva y usada. 
 
Sus compañeras de grupo son Antonia N. quien vende frijoles cosidos y queso y Giovanna M. desde hace seis años comercializa productos avon.
texts.en:
The Campanario Group is made up of three hard-working people. The Group's co-ordinator is Jesica Zeledon. Three years ago she erected an awning outside her house where she sells new and second-hand clothes. Her companions in the group are Antonia N., who sells beans and cheese, and Giovanna M., who has been selling Avon products for the past six years.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine L., 50 years old, is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is married to Franklin and has seven school-aged children. Josephine owns and operates a business raising crops. She and her husband till their land for rice crops and sell their harvest at the market. She also raises some chickens and hopes to acquire more chicken to raise. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-nine years now. In 2007, Josephine joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seed, fertilizer, and other farm inputs. She also plans to buy additional chickens. This loan will be her ninth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer, chickens, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Jerlyn

texts.en:
Jerlyn C. is from the village of Amoyong, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 29 years old. Jerlyn is married and has 2 school-age children. To make a living, Jerlyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Jerlyn has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 13000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Jerlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jerlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Jerlyn is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which also will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Jerlyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is married with four children, all of whom are at school, and she takes care of additional family members. Phoebe is a tailor in Busega Lubaga Division in Kampala. She plans to use this loan to buy more clothing materials and thread. She has been in this tailoring business for 10 years. She sells cooked food for additional income. 

She operates her business from the shop and pays a monthly rent of 45000 Ugandan shillings. Her customers are people around the area. She works six days a week and depends on this job for a living. Her business challenges are thieves and the rainy season, because she works in a place which is prone to floods. 

Phoebe resides in and rents a two-roomed house and family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, food and rent.

loans.use: To buy more clothing materials and thread

loans.name: La Superacion Ii, Grupo 5 Group

texts.en:
Eufrecia is the coordinator of her group La Superacion II, Grupo 5 (The Overcoming). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and two children. She plans to continue enjoying decorating homes, which she likes a lot and learned years before; she also likes to sew fabrics for the home.

Eufrecia is excited to be taK. her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for over six years. She starting by buying flowers and maK. small bouquets, then sold them and reinvested. 

She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying an industrial sewing machine and some fabrics. She will use the profits to buy school supplies for her children.

"School vacation is almost over, and my children will start again soon," she said.

She also wants to buy some medicine, add telephone service and buy a computer. By saving, she is planning to move her business to a more accessible and bigger locale, where she can become sustainable and have employees. For her future, she hopes to build a house and have a car.
   
This Esperanza associate says she began with us because, "I have a business and interest rate(s) are good. I'm maK. friends and this is really important for me and my business."

Her  story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Samana, a lush, rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry.
