This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy an industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Mrs. Than Sothavy Seng Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan includes 15 villagers in Damnak village, Takeo province. Mrs. Than Sothavy S. is the village bank president. She is 38 years old and was selected by the other members who will use their portion of the loan in various ways to support their businesses in the current year. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Trai Sen, is a taxi driver who owns a car in which he can earn some moN. to support his famiL.. Her problem is that her pigs are too small to sell, but she does not have moN. to support those pigs. So to improve this condition, Mrs. Than Sothavy S. is seeking a loan to buy pig food. She is a mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in local school. The third child is just three years old.

loans.use: To buy pig food

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Mr. Musa T., 41, and his wife, Mrs. Asimas Sles, 32, have been married since 1986 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. The family lives along National Road Number Six about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Musa is a fisherman. His wife sells the fish that her husband caught. Because he does not have enough fishing materials to work with, he decided to ask for a loan of $800 to purchase fishing nets for his business. 

Musa was not available for the photo. His wife is pictured instead.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets for his fishing business

loans.name: Egda Odalia

texts.es:
Egda de 31 años, vive en una zona periurbana con caminos de tierras y montañas llamada “paraíso”, se ayuda económicamente trabajando como operadora de una maquina en una empresa de plásticos. 

Trabaja de lunes a sábado en turnos rotativos y diurnos por la motivación  de su hijo ya que esta divorciada. Realiza su trabajo operando una maquina que transporta plásticos ya tiene 9 años haciendo este trabajo. Pero como no ha podido construir bien su casa para ella y su hijo desea con el préstamo construirla mejor comprando bloques, cemento y pinturas (su casa es la que aparece en la foto). 

En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa para que su hijo pueda vivir bien y que el pueda tener una buena educación profesional.
texts.en:
Edga is 31 years old and lives in a peri-urban zone called Paraiso, which has mountains and dirt roads. She helps herself financially as a machine operator in a company that manufactures plastic. She works from Monday through Saturday in rotating morning shifts because of her son; she is divorced. She has been operating a machine that transports plastic for 9 years. However, because she has not been able to construct her and her son's house well, she would like to purchase blocks, cement, and paint with this loan (her house is pictured here). In the future, she would like to finish building her house so that she and her son can live comfortably, and she would also like for her son to get a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement, blocks, and paint

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes and cosmetics for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María es una mujer emprendedora, madre de dos hijos, esforzada para lograr el objetivo como profesional
Hoy en día trabaja como técnico quirúrgico en un hospital, su esposo apoyando a la familia el cual trabaja en ventas.
Juntos han logrado levantar su casa toda de concreto lo que han venido logrando junto con Afodenic por medio del financiamiento lo que está feliz ya que su mayor anhelo es la construcción total de su vivienda.
Aun le falta material para terminar como: perlines, zinc, golosos, cemento, arena, y otros para poder concluir un poco más. Lo que está cerca por lograr de pasarse  a su casa.
texts.en: María is an enterprising woman, the mother of two children and works hard as a professional to reach her goal. Today she works as a surgical technician in a hospital. Her husband, who works in sales, supports the family. Together, they have managed to build their concrete house, which has been made possible by financing from Afodenic. She is happy even though her greatest desire is to complete the construction of her home. She still lacks materials to finish such as: braces, zinc, gloss, cement, sand, and other materials to be able to complete a little bit more. Soon she will be able to move into her house.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to finish putting on a roof, and complete her house.

loans.name: Philippe

texts.en:
Philippe is 28 years old. He is married and has three children between the ages of two and eight. Two of his children go to school. He is married to a businesswoman. Philippe works as a transporter. He transports people and goods. He has had this business for five years. 

Phillippe is requesting this loan to buy another means of transportation which will bring greater returns to his business. With the profit from this business of transporting people and goods he will make sure that his children can be educated. He says that his business is successful because he has a lot of respect for his business. In the future, he would like to supply goods to others.

loans.use: To buy more vehicles for transportation, such as a motorcycle.

loans.name: Sroy

texts.en: Sroy S., 31 years old, is a humble villager who lives in Kompong Chhnang province. She is a housewife who has many duties in her house such as cooking meals, cleaning house, caring for her children and managing property in and and around the house. She is married and blessed with two school-aged children, while her husband is a car taxi driver. Her husband picks up his customers from across the province to Phnom Penh city, and makes approximately $15 per day to cover the family’s daily expenses. Unfortunately, his car often breaks down during use. Therefore, Sroy S. has decided to seek a loan of $1000 from Kiva, which she will use to help her husband change the broken car.

loans.use: To change the broken car

loans.name: Ma. Flora

texts.en:
Ma. Flora S. is from the village of New Tambo, Katipunan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 48 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. Ma. Flora operates a family member's business in the services sector, primarily doing motorcycle repair in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for 10 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2006, Ma. Flora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Ma. Flora is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional accessories needed for motorcycle repair. This will be the 11th loan taken out by Ma.Flora from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchase accessories for motorcycle repair shop

loans.name: Benita Soledad

texts.es: La Señora Benita  es cliente nueva de la institución, la señora Benita tiene un pequeño hijo al cual esta educando sola ya que su marido falleció hace dos años, la señora Benita se dedica a la peluquería en un pequeño salón que se encuentra en la zona de villa armonía ella trabaja todos los días exceptuando los jueves y domingos  ya que estos días se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos en la feria 16 de julio en la ciudad del Alto, doña Benita se esfuerza mucho por salir adelante ella esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de material  como ser champú , tintes para el cabello, liquido para permanente y otros productos que ella necesita para su salón, es una persona muy trabajadora siempre pensando en el bienestar de sus hijo, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del credito
texts.en: Mrs Benita is a new client of the institution. She has a small child whom she is raising alone, since her husband passed away two years ago. She is a hairdresser in a small salon in the Armonia Village. She works every day except for Thursdays and Sundays, as on these days she sells home electronics in the 16 de Julio Market in the city of El Alto. Benita works hard to get ahead. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of materials such as shampoo, hair dye, permanent dye and other products that she needs for her salon. She is a very hard-working person who is always thinking of the well-being of her son. She is grateful to the institution for the support offered through the authorization of this loan.

loans.use: The purchase of merchandise: shampoo, dyes, permanent liquid dyes and others

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza N. is from the village of Maac, Guisiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 36 years old. Analiza is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Analiza owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling seafood products  including fish like sardines and mackerel in the local community. Analiza has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Analiza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analiza is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like sardines and milk fish. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Analiza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like sardines and milk fish

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores T. is a married woman who lives in Bago, Cogon, Compostela, Cebu City.  She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures: hog raising, general store and ready to wear businesses.  Her husband Moncito T., who is 53 years old, works in San Miguel Corp to earn his living. 
They have 6 children who are between the ages of 12 to 25 years old, 2 children have their own family, 2 are working and 1 is currently going to school. 

Dolores joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Dolores has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow.  Her previous loan of 20,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 5,000 PHP, improving the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing 23,000 PHP, which she intends to use as funds in her business operations so that she can continue to save up for the future to have own store in the market. Dolores T. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Funds in business operations

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina tiene 51 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, Perú. 

Su principal actividad de la socia Alejandrina es la elaboración y venta de panes “Chuta”, ella tiene su propio horno donde prepara panes “Chutas”. El PAN CHUTA es un típico pan de la ciudad del cusco, caracterizado por ser un pan gigante que mide aproximadamente unos 30 x30 cm y 4 a 4 cm de grueso y por ser un pan muy delicioso, tanto así que muchos turistas gustan llevar una muestra a sus familiares como obsequio, a fin de que puedan estos saborear un poquito de la magia que envuelve a la ciudad imperial del cusco. 

En esta oportunidad Alejandrina requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo harina, levadura y muchas cosas más. 

Alejandrina pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Alejandrina, 51, lives in the city of Oropesa, Cusco province, Peru.  Her main activity is making and selling “Chuta” bread; she has her own oven where she makes “Chutas.” Chuta Bread is bread that is particular to the city of Cusco.  It is characterized for being giant bread measuring approximately 30cm x 30cm and 4cm thick; it is quite delicious, so much so that tourists like to take samples of it as gifts to their relatives so that they too can taste a bit of the magic that enfolds the imperial city of Cusco.

Alejandrina requires a loan on this occasion to buy ingredients like flour, yeast and many other things.

Alejandrina is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” communal bank and she’s grateful for the opportunity provided through this means.  At the same time, she commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy ingredients like flour and yeast and many other things.

loans.name: Bozor

texts.ru: Атахонов Бозор проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 56 лет. Женат. Имеет 7 детей. Образование - высшее, экономист. По профессии проработал 10 лет. На сегодняшний день он занимается животноводством. Разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. В этой области уже четыре года. Кредит просит для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Bozor A. lives in the Yavan district.  He is 56 years old, married and has 7 children.  He has a higher education, as an economist.  He spent 10 years working in that profession.  Today, he is involved in animal husbandry.  He breeds cattle for future sale.  Bozor has been in this business for four years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle.

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana is 34 years old, got married to M. S., and she moved to Kot Radha Kishan some years back. Kot Radha Kishan is a small city in Pakistan located in Punjab province and famous for its dairy industry. She lives there in the area of Maan Singh Wala in a three-room brick house in a combined family system. 

Rukhsana owns a clothes and bangles sales business. She operates her business from her home. Her community clients visit her and purchase these products from her at reasonable prices. She started this business to financially support her husband who is a driver by profession. Her brother-in-law also lives with her family and he is also a driver by profession. 

Rukhsana is also a very good housewife and does her household work very well. She is a very supportive lady and tries her best to give comfort to her family with her work. She has given birth to two sons. She couldn’t educate them due to poor financial conditions. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her clothes-selling business. With the loan, she will buy clothes in bulk that will allow her to offer more variety to her clients and make more profit. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In every loan year, she has maintained a good credit behavior and attended every meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Rukhsana.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce M. K., from Mshomoroni, is 31 years old, married to Juma Suleiman, and the mother of two children. She has been selling fresh fruit juice for the last two years and her business is doing well.

Joyce is applying for her first loan from KADET in order to purchase mangoes, oranges, avocados and a blender so that she can make more fresh juice for her clients. She knows that this will boost her business and will use the additional profits to expand her enterprise.

Joyce’s dream is to own a bigger shop.

loans.use: to purchase mangoes, oranges, avocados and a blender

loans.name: Sherozjon

texts.en:
H. Sherozjon is married and the father of two children. He lives in Isfara, Tajikistan, with his family. He works at home in a special place which is built for a bakery business. In a day he cooks 2-2.5 bag of flour or 450-500 individual breads and sells bread in the market. He has been in this business for 15 years. He would like to get a loan of 6000 Somoni for purchasing flour and coal. Thanks to this loan, he will be able to grow his business further and help feed his family.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy flour and coal to bake bread.

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina lives in the third largest city of Pakistan called Faisalabad. It is known for its textile industry and is located in Punjab, Pakistan. She has been living there with her family in the area of Dhanona in a two-room brick house for the past 20 years. She is married to M. A. who has a construction supplies business. His shop is located in the market where he offers different construction materials such as cement, bricks and sands to his clients. Robina has given birth to six children. Her eldest son helps his father in his business and the others stay at home. Robina couldn’t provide her children with an education due to poor financial conditions. She herself is a housewife who prefers to stay at home and do her household work. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who will put more construction supplies in his shop and expand. He has been operating this business for the past 10 years and Robina is confident that an investment will help him make better profits. She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application to Asasah. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Robina.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies to sell

loans.name: Farakognouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe FARAKOGNOUMA est composé de femmes toutes mariées, ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales nucléaires avec leurs  enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident à Torakabougou l’un des quartier de la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues par des relations de  parenté et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire leurs clientèles et élargir la taille de leurs activités, elles ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela  pour faire le commerce de chaussures, des draps de lits et des glacières à l’image de  Sadio SANAGRE.
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe dont le précédent a été remboursé correctement. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt, Sadio SANAGRE compte acheter 5 douzaines de glacières auprès de ces fournisseurs de Bamako capitale de la république du Mali pour les revendre  en détail et en gros , au comptant et à crédit au grand marché de BOUGOUNI  à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes.
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 17 500 FCFA  dont une partie sera réinvesti dans l’entreprise et le reste sera  utilisé dans la scolarisation des enfants.
texts.en:
The group FARAKOGNOUMA is composed of married women who average 35 years of age and four children each living in conjugal nuclear families with their children and husband. These women reside in Torakabougou, a district in the city of BOUGOUNI (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of kinship and community.

Concerned about satisfying their customers and expanding their businesses, the group members decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to do commerce in shoes, bed sheets, and insulated containers, as does Ms. Sadio SANAGRE. They are on their second group loan. The previous one has been properly repaid. 

With this new loan, Sadio plans on buy 5 dozen insulated containers from suppliers in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali) and then sell them retail and wholesale for cash or on credit. Her customer base is composed generally of women.

With this loan, she plans on making a monthly profit of 17,500 francs CFA. A portion of the profits will be reinvested in the enterprise, and the rest will be used for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy various goods

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: La Sra. Sandra se dedica a vender dvd's. Ella esta separada de su esposo pero vive junto a sus dos jóvenes hijas, una de ellas es un poco enferma pero gracias al apoyo de Sandra se esta mejorando. Ellas viven en la zona de alto Pampahasi que esta a 20 minutos del centro de la ciudad. Sandra tiene una tienda donde vende los dvd's y también va a vender a la feria 16 de julio de la cuidad de el alto, que es la feria más grande esta ciudad. Sandra es una persona alegre y trabaja muy duro para que sus hijas reciban una buena educación ya que espera que ellas puedan llegar a ser profesionales. Sandra y sus hijas viven en este momento en un pequeño departamento y esperan poder ahorrar lo suficiente para poder comprar una casa. Ella solicita el crédito para poder comprar películas y mostradores para exhibir su mercadería de dvd's. Esta agradecida con emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: Sandra has a business selling DVDs.  She is separated from her husband, but she lives with her two young daughters.  One of them is sick, but thanks to Sandra's support she is getting better.  They live in the Alto Pampahasi neighborhood, which is 20 minutes from the center of the city.  Sandra has a store where she sells DVDs, and she also sells in the "16 de Julio" market in the city of El Alto, which is the largest market in the city.  Sandra is a  cheerful person who works very hard for her daughters so that they can have a good education, since she hopes that someday they will become professionals.  Sandra and her daughters are currently living in a small apartment, and they hope to save enough money to buy a house.  She requests a loan to buy DVD movies and display cases to exhibit her merchandise.  Sandra is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for their trust in providing her with this loan.

loans.use: to buy DVD movies and display cases to exhibit her DVDs

loans.name: Eidy Luz

texts.es: Eidy de 33 años es una confeccionista que se dedica a la producciòn de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, ella tiene un punto de ventas y ya no solo confecciona sobre medidas, sino que presta el servico de maquila; sus principales clientes son mujeres y almacenes pequeños que compran mediante pedidos, su modalidad de venta es credito y tambien en su punto comercial lo hace de contado. Eidy es casada y vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en las edades de 2 y 4 años en Soledad municipio muy cercano a la ciudad de Barranquilla. Su negocio inicò ayudando a su madre, de quien adquirió la mayor experiencia  y luego la aplicò en una pequeña confecciòn donde trabajó por varios años y compró una maquinaria con las cuales desarrollò su actividad como trabajadora independiente, negocio que hoy le genera sus ingresos y quiere hacerlo crecer, pero su capital de trabajo no es suficiente, por eso recurre a su credikiva que es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprarà: telas, hilos adornos e insumos para confeccionar nuevos diseños encargados por sus clientes, para lucir elegantes a propòsito de la celebraciòn del dia del padre.
texts.en:
33 year-old Eidy is a dressmaker who makes women's, men's and children's clothes.  She has a sales location and she no longer only makes custom-made clothes but also provides a manufacturing service.  Her main customers are women, and small stores who buy from her by placing orders.  She sells on credit and, in her sales location, she sells for cash.

Eidy is married and lives with her husband and two children who are 2 and 4.  They live in Soledad, a town which is very near the city of Barranquilla.  She started out in her business helping her mother, from whom she gained most of her experience.  She then applied her experience in a small dressmaking workshop where she worked for several years.  Later Eidy bought some machines and used them to develop her business working independently.  Her business makes her income and she would like to grow it.  However, she doesn't have enough working capital.  For this reason, she is requesting a Kiva loan.

Eidy's Kiva loan is her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she will use it to buy fabric, threads, adornments and supplies for making new designs that her customers have ordered so that they can dress smartly when they celebrate Fathers Day.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads, adornments and supplies for making new designs that her customers have ordered

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten is a 22-year-old married woman who lives in Jabalia Refugee Camp in Gaza Strip. Faten's husband has a barber shop in the refugee camp. He wants to purchase creams and hair products for the barber shop. Faten took out a loan from FATEN to pay for the products her husband wants to purchase.

Faten is a conservative woman; therefore, her husband is photographed instead.

loans.use: to purchase creams and hair products for barber shop use.

loans.name: Daisy Maria

texts.en:
Daisy is neighbor of the "Cuatro Bocas de Upala" zone, located in the province of Alajuela, Costa Rica. This is a region that is known for agriculture, livestock and business. She is a woman who dreams of getting ahead.

She is asking for a loan of ₡400.000 (Costa Rican Colones) to buy a laptop computer and a multifunctional printer to help out the other women in her community bank organization. This will help them to process loans more easily and in a more orderly fashion, in order to improve business earnings. 

This will also help Daisy to submit documents on time, do internet research and use the most up to date technological tools.

She is a member of the "Empresa de Credito Comunal de Bansuperafe S.A.," which various members participate in, the majority of whom are single mothers and are all very hardworking. They feel very happy to be part of the organization and know that the organization has provided great support to help their families get ahead.

Translated from Spanish:

Daisy es vecina de la zona de Cuatro bocas de Upala, esto en la provincia de Alajuela, en Costa Rica. Esta región es dedicada a la agricultura, a la ganadería y al comercio. Ella es una mujer con grandes deseos de superación.  

Ella está solicitando un préstamo por el monto de ₡400.000 (cuatrocientos mil colones),  esto para comprar una computadora portátil y una impresora multifuncional para brindar un mejor servicio a las socias de la comunidad, para poder tramitar los prestamos de una forma más fácil y ordenada, y para lograr incrementar las ganancias de la Empresa.).  

Esto tambien le facilitara a Daisy entregar a tiempo todo tipo de documento, investigar en internet y utilizar muchas de las herramientas tecnológicas actuales. 

Ella es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Bansuperafe S.A, dicha empresa está integrada por varias mujeres, la mayoría madres solteras y muy luchadoras. Las cuales se sienten muy felices por formar parte de la organización y aseguran que ha sido de gran ayuda para sacar adelante a sus familias.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Shodigul

texts.ru: Шодигул проживает в городе Вахдат. Ей 45 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Ее муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Сама Шодигул после отъезда мужа занялась шитьем национальных платьев. Она берет заказы у себя дома. Этим видом деятельности она занимается пять лет. Кредит берет для покупки тканей, чтобы сшить платья для продажи.
texts.en: Shodigul lives in the city of Vahdat.  She is 45 years old, married and has two children.  Her husband works in the Russian Federation.  Shodigul became involved in sewing national dresses after her husband's departure.  She fulfills her orders at home.  She has been involved in this business for five years.  Shodigul is requesting this loan for the purchase of fabrics in order to sew dresses for sale.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Gerardine

texts.en:
Gerardine is 24 years old and single. She sells various goods such as cooking oil, rice, beans, biscuits, sugar, avocado etc. She has two years' experience. Her business is well organized and she works from 7am to 8pm every day.
Gerardine has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to expand her store by purchasing more and various goods such as cooking oil, rice, beans, biscuits, sugar, avocado etc. for resale. With the profits, she will reinvest in her business and will be able to build her own house.

loans.use: to expand her store by purchasing more goods such as sugar, biscuits, avocado etc. for resale.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
Héctor, tiene 37 años de edad, es originario de  San Antonio una comunidad ubicada en Yali municipio de Jinotega al norte de Estelí, es soltero, de oficio caficultor, su nivel de estudios básicos solo curso hasta el quinto grado de primaria. El inicio ayudando a su papa a la edad de 14 años, el limpiaba y cortaba café, aprendió a separar el buen grano del malo, esta actividad las hacia por las tardes ya que por la mañana estudiaba, pero después se dedico de lleno a la siembra y corte de café pues su padre ya no tenia recursos económico para seguir estudiando. Cuando cumplió 25 años obtuvo  5 manzanas de café propias fruto de su esfuerzo y arduo trabajo de tantos años. Ademas de dedicarse a la siembra de café, también tiene cultivos frijoles, su hermano le ayuda a sembrar, el desea que su producto se de a conocer en las grandes cooperativas de café de la ciudad.
Solicita el préstamo para sembrar 1 ½ manzana de café, pagar mano de obra y comprar insumos, abono. Espera sacar una buena producción con calidad y rendimiento. 
En sus planes esta ampliar sus siembras de frijoles y cultivar 6 manzanas de café. Su meta próxima es comprar una motocicleta para que su hermano se traslade a ver los cultivos y agilizar loas tramites para la siembra y comercialización.
texts.en:
Hector is 37 years old, and was born in San Antonio, a community located in Yali municipality, Jinotega, north of Esteli. He is single and cultivates coffee. He only studied in primary school up to 5th grade. 

Hector began helping his father at the age of 14. He cleaned and harvested coffee, learning to separate good coffee beans from bad. He performed this activity afternoons, after studying in the morning. Later, he dedicated himself full time to sowing and harvesting coffee, because his father lacked the economic resources for Hector to continue his schooling. When Hector reached the age of 25, he was given 5 manzanas (3.5 hectares) of planted coffee land of his own, the fruit of his own efforts and arduous work over all those years. 

Besides sowing coffee, Hector also cultivates beans. His brother helps him with planting. Hector wants his coffee to be recognized by the great coffee cooperatives of the city.

Hector is requesting a loan to plant 1 ½ manzanas (105% of a hectare) of coffee, pay laborers, and buy inputs, especially manure. He hopes to have a good crop with quality and a high yield.

Among his plans are to expand his plantings of beans and cultivate 6 manzanas (4.2 hectares) more of coffee. His immediate goal is to buy a motorcycle to provide his brother with transportation to help him oversee the crops and facilitate the cultivation and selling process.

loans.use: to sow 1 1/2 manzanas (105% of a hectare) of coffee, paying laborers, and buying inputs and manure.

loans.name: Fatmata H.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers at a primary school in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to seek a loan of 12,700,000 SLL in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, these teachers will repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment from their salaries and repays SMT/Kiva on their behalf.
Fatmata is the leader of this group of teachers. Born in Kambia town, the 55 year old woman is married and has 3 children – 2 in college and the other is no longer attending school. Fatmata, who has served in the teaching profession for 37 years now is going to use her share of the loan to pay college fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay college fees for her children

loans.name: Donata

texts.es: Donata es natural D. Pariahuanca, un pequeño pueblo ubicado al oeste D. la ciudad D. Huancayo. Ahí vive en compañía D. su esposo y sus 6 hijos. DesD. su niñez se ha dedicado a la agricultura y aprendió D. sus padres el valor del esfuerzo que con el pasar D. los años lo ha venido aplicando fielmente en su vida diaria. Ahora que es una mujer casada, junto con su esposo se dedican a la venta D. dulces en un cafetín D. una escuela que esta en su localidad desD. hace 3 años, toda su familia se esfuerza para mejorar la atención ya que sus principales consumidores son los niños, también sigue dedicándose a la agricultura donD. sigue cultivando diversos productos D. su zona que le permiten  tener también ganancias en época D. cosecha. Para Donata es una gran satisfacción mantener a su familia unida en el trabajo que realizan, siempre necesita D. unj incremento D. capital  en sus actividades que le permitan seguir invirtiendo para crecer. Es la tercera vez que esta solicitando un crédito con MFP, fue invitada a formar parte D. su grupo por medio D. sus vecinos que integran este banco comunal considera que cada préstamo es una oportunidad para crecer. Es por ello que invertirá en la compra D. sacos D. abono para la siembra y una parte en la compra D. mas golosinas para su cafetín.
texts.en:
Donata is from Pariahuanca, a small village which is located to the west of the city of Huancayo.  She lives there with her husband and six children.  Donata has been farming since she was a girl.  She learned the value of hard work from her parents and, over the years, she has been faithfully applying this value to her daily life.  Now that she is a married woman, Donata works with her husband selling sweet treats from a snack bar in a school in their village.  They have been in this business for three years.  The entire family works hard to improve their service.  Their main customers are children.  Donata also farms.  She grows a variety of regional crops and this allows her to make profits at harvest time.  Donata is really happy that she is able to keep her family united in the work that they carry out.  She always needs an increase in capital for her businesses which will allow her to continue investing and growing.

This is the third time that Donata has requested a loan from MFP.  She was invited to join the group by her neighbors who are members of the community bank.  She believes that each loan represents an opportunity for growth.  She will invest her loan in buying sacks of manure for her crops.  She will also use part of her loan to buy more candies for her snack bar.

loans.use: to buy candies for her snack bar and sacks of manure for her crops

loans.name: Benilda

texts.en:
Benilda is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

Benilda has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, beverages & rice per kilogram. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Benilda is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Benilda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan is 31 years old and her husband, Sopho, is 32 years old (pictured together).  They have been married since 1999 and have four children, two sons and two daughters who are in school. The family is living in a village along National Road five, about twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  

Chan sells grocery items, while her husband is a Tuk Tuk taxi driver. She is asking for her first loan of $1,200 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband because it is old and it breaks down.  She will also use part of the loan to buy more grocery items for her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike for her husband and more grocery items for her inventory.

loans.name: Nasianta

texts.en:
Nasianta is a very hard-working woman who practices farming. She has been farming for over three years. She is 28 years old and married, with two children.

She has been a good client with KADET, and this will be her third loan. She plans to use the entire loan to buy farm inputs like seeds, pesticides and equipment which will be used in the next planting season. She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to invest in farming. 

She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: buy agricultural products

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married with 2 children, both of whom go to school.  She lives in her own house and her family has access to electricity and piped water.  She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. For the past 7 years she has been selling milk and bread at the market on a retail basis. She sells to all categories of people.  She works seven days a week.  

Margaret has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more loaves of bread and milk. Her aspirations and goals are to own a milk processing plant and also to build her own rental houses.  Her major business challenges are irregular electricity and transportation. Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more milk and loaves of bread.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 53 years old and married, with 11 adult children. She is from the village of Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, Evelyn plants and harvests a variety of vegetables to sell. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

Evelyn joined GDMPC in 2008 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Evelyn will use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en:
Evelina is 44 years old and lives in Polangyuta, Siquijor, Siquijor.  She is married with 3 school age children.
Evelina has a retail business selling firewood for fuel and earns approximately PHP 4,000.00 each month doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000.00 to purchase firewood for resale.
Evelina has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Coooperative for 4 months.  In the future, Evelina hopes to grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase firewood for retail sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is 24 years old, a farmer in the Philippines who is very eager to do everything just to fulfill what he had promised to his wife. He assured his wife that he would lift her up from poor living conditions into a comfortable life. So he doubles his hard work in his farming business to improve his crops. He has six years of experience in this field, and he knows that it is not an easy occupation.

But despite that, his hunger to achieve his dream inspires him to develop his business. For this reason, he is requesting a loan amount P25,000 to purchase supplies such as corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides and use them to develop his business. He hopes through these supplies he will be able to grow plenty of crops to save for the betterment of his living situation, and certainly fulfill his promise to his wife.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides and use them to develop his business

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya is 34 years old.  She is married and has 2 children, aged 16 and 13.  In 2002, she established her tea shop business.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan from Patan BPW.  She is using this loan to buy food materials for her business.  In the future, Maya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

(Whether on the streets of Kathmandu or in the villages outside of the capital, tea shops are places of business and meeting in Nepal.  Called chiya pasals, these tea shops make a sweet, milky tea that can be purchased for a few cents a cup.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to keep their store shelves stocked while increasing their profit margins by buying in greater volume.)

loans.use: to buy food materials for her business

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma lives in Nor Dvin village with her husband and two children. She keeps cattle and cultivates land. Emma would like to develop cattle breeding, for which she needs sufficient financial means. Emma plans to purchase a calf as well as to pay for renovation of the barn. Development of agriculture will allow Emma to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for a calf and renovation of the barn

location.town: Nor Dvin village of Ararat region

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 40 years old and married to Moses. They are blessed with one child. She has been selling locks for the past two years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET Ltd after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Elizabeth will use the loan to buy a stock of locks for her shop. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will expand her shop. 

Her hopes and dreams are to educate her child up to university level and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy locks to sell

loans.name: Koko

texts.fr: Agée de 38 ans Koko est  célibataire et habite dans le quartier de Bè. Elle  est coiffeuse et fait aussi la tresse il y a 15 ans. Ce crédit lui permet d’associer la vente de défrisant  et  de mèches à la coiffure ce qui lui permet d’attirer plus de clientes et augmenter ses revenus, pour se prendre en charge et aider les parents dans l’éducation de ses frères et sœurs.
texts.en: Koko is 38 years old and single. She lives in the "Bè" neighborhood. She is a hair stylist, and has also been doing hair braids for 15 years. With this loan, she can start selling hair relaxer and extensions. This will allow her to bring in more clients and grow her income so that she can take care of herself and help her parents with her brothers and sisters' education.

loans.use: buy 60 boxes of hair relaxer.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 33-year-old married man with two sons. He has a workshop for making and repairing furniture.

In 2011, he started his own business to improve his living conditions and increase his income. It was an impressive step forward, and that's why he is working hard to improve it.

Today, Fadi is acquiring a loan from a Kiva partner to buy materials for his job, including an electronic saw, fabric, and sponge material. This will allow him to be able to increase his stock, which will lead to an increase in the number of his clients and an increase in his income, and that will help him to improve financial conditions for his family.  

He hopes that he can stay capable of developing his business and increasing his income.

loans.use: to buy materials for his job, including an electronic saw, fabric, and sponge material.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Seven years ago Peninah started farming on a small piece of inherited land in Karigiri, a remote village in the Chuka area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of three children sells milk, eggs and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. 

Dairy farming is close to her heart and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. Through the loan she will have a humble time milking her cow and also feeding. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevent them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. 

Peninah believes that through this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. 

Peninah waits for your kindness during this festive season.

loans.use: To construct a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita makes cleaning products like disinfectant, soap, detergent, shampoo, etc. She has been working in this business for about 20 years. This type of business is very lucrative in this sector because the manufactured versions of these products are usually too expensive for most to afford. Therefore, Angelita can make her own products at home and sell them to other businesses.

Angelita started off as a clothes saleswoman in a business venture with a family member. Due to her lack of capital she could not make the business succeed. She does not want the same thing to happen to her in this operation. She is seeking a loan in order to buy the chemicals necessary to make her products. She is married and has two kids, one who is still in school and the other who works but still lives at home.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She is seeking a loan in order to buy the chemicals necessary to make her products

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: "I want to be able to expand my business, make more money, and send my children to school." This was what Madame Elizabeth said when she was asked why she needed a loan. She knows what this entails from training with the TEACH Lending progam of Kraban Support Foundation. She has training in bookkeeping and needs a loan of $650 to expand her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Barnabas

texts.en: Barnabas is a shopkeeper who deals with retail goods.  He has been in the business since 2000.  He has not undertaken any formal training for his business, but learned through doing.  He started his business when he saw that there was a need for his services in the community.  He is a member of the community group which deals with the H.I.V./AIDS campaign. He has completed his first loan with PEMCI successfully, which enabled him to build himself a shop. Previously he had rented but now he operates from his own premises.  With a second loan from PEMCI, he intends to increase his stock further, to meet the demands of his clients which continue to increase day by day. Through his business, he has been able to build himself a shop, educate his two children and bring services to the community.

loans.use: To increase his stock

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Business Description

Karina has spent three years running a business she started with her own money. She sells clothing, shoes, skirts, and so on. She also sells juices, candies, and many other confections. She sells the clothes on credit and works from eight in the morning to eight at night. Her business is located in her home.

Purpose of the Loan

Karina would use the loan to buy more clothing, which makes up the bulk of her sales because demand is high. She wants to pay cash so that she can get a better price and pass on the savings to her customers.

About the Applicant

Karina is married and has three children who go to school. Her husband makes deliveries from a small vehicle they own. Together, they are able to meet household expenses. They live with Karina's mother-in-law, who has given over a part of her home to them. Karina's wish is to obtain this loan so that she can expand her business and ensure a better future for the family.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

La Señora Karina lleva 3 años dedicada al comercio de ropa y confitería, ella inicio su negocio con un capital propio que tenia. Ella vende ropa, zapatos, faldas, etc. y también jugos, cachitos y todo tipo de confiterías. La ropa la vende a crédito, ella trabaja desde las 8am hasta las 8pm. Su negocio esta ubicado en su domicilio.

Uso del Préstamo

Karina desea el crédito para comprar ropa que es lo que mas vende ya que tiene muy buena demanda de sus clientes. Ella desea comprar de contado la mercadería para obtener un mejor precio. Y a su vez venderla a un valor más accesible a sus clientes.

Información Personal

Karina esta casada, tiene 3 hijos menores de edad que están en la escuela. Su esposo trabaja haciendo fletes en un carrito que tienen y de esta manera ambos aportan con los gastos del hogar. La vivienda donde habitan es de la suegra quien le dio una parte para que vivan allí. Ella desea obtener el crédito de tal forma ir incrementando su negocio y darle un mejor futuro a su familia.

loans.use: To buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Victor Vidal

texts.es:
Victor and his wife, beginning very early in the morning every day, head out to cultivate their land in order to harvest excellent crops. Their two children decided to try their hand in the capital and now work in a textile mill. The knowledge and skill they have acquired over time has motivated them to want to undertake this business with their parents. Therefore, Victor wants to increase his sowing capacity in order to, with the yield generated from selling the corn he grows on his land, begin constructing a textile mill with his family's help. He is asking for a loan in the amount of 650 dollars. He will invest 100 percent of this money in his fields. He promises to repay the loan in 6 months and then will realize his family's dream of constructing a family textile mill. Victor and his family wait for your speedy action.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Víctor junto a su esposa y desde muy temprano todos los días, salen a cultivar sus tierras. Para obtener excelentes productos. Sus dos únicos hijos decidieron abrirse camino en la capital y hoy trabajan en una fábrica textil; el conocimiento y dominio que adquirieron con el tiempo los motivó a querer emprender este negocio junto a sus padres. Por ello el deseo de Víctor es incrementar la siembra con el propósito de que a través de los réditos que le genere la venta de maíz que siembra en sus tierras, iniciar la construcción del proyecto textil con la ayuda de su familia. Por ello solicita un préstamo de 650 dólares que los invertirá netamente en sus sembríos con el compromiso de retornarlos en un período de 6 meses para concretar el anhelo de construir su fábrica textil familiar. Víctor y su familia esperan tu pronto apoyo.

loans.use: Increased sowing will generate increased income in order to undertake the construction of a family textile mill

loans.name: Penah

texts.en: Penah A. owns and operates a home goods store in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. He is 51 years old and is married with four children. He has been working in this business for a number of years and has come to Norwegian Microcredit looking for funding so that he can increase the quantity and variety of his inventory.

loans.use: To increase the quantity and variety of his inventory.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is married with three kids aged 13, 9 and 6. She lives in the small town of Korolyovo and works in the central market selling yummy sweets and pastries. Fortunately for Nataliya, she doesn’t struggle with high competition. Moreover, her business has a very favorable location – her stall sits right at the entrance to the market.

Nataliya is very enthusiastic and focused in her work. She started this business because she believed in the idea and was determined to live life without feeling needy all the time. Nataliya loves the idea of serving her customers. She knows the tastes of her loyal clients and always offers them a fantastic range of delicious candy or cookies. Nataliya is requesting a loan of $1200 to increase the assortment of her inventory and hopefully get closer to the winning touchdown of business profitability and stability.

loans.use: To increase assortment of inventory

loans.name: Justine's Group

texts.en:
Justine is married with four children. Her group has been together for eleven months.

From the profits from her expanded business, Justine will start a new business. She will open a grocery where she can sell various fruits and vegetables. She believes this may be more profitable than her current business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to increase the inventory in her boutique

loans.name: Anah

texts.en: Anah, 43, is married to N. and has 3 children. Her husband repairs flat tires for a living and earns about $3 a day with a small profit. So to support her family's needs, Anah opened a small shop at her house where she sells groceries and earns $15 a day. She has joined MBK and now she is asking for a loan of $100 to expand her shop. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her shop

loans.name: Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
The Triumphant Communal Bank is a bank that began recently and at present has 22 associates. Some of them were guests of associates of another Communal Bank and by the property development company.

The associates have different business such as selling cereals, natural products of the coca leaf, clothes, crafts, cosmetics, cebiche (a seafood dish), jewels, hardware, vegetables, groceries and woven crafts.

The associates need different amounts of loans, such as 300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles, coming to a total of 12,050 soles of loans in the Communal Bank.

The loans will be invested in the purchase of corn, wheat, carbonated water, wool, threads, office supplies, natural products, poles, chompas, pants, lingerie, rice, sugar, lemon, tomato, tools, and jewels.

The dreams of the associates are that their children will study and become professionals, to complete the construction of their house, to do well on their own without the aid of anyone, and to grow their business and have more capital.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

El Banco Comunal Triunfadoras es un Banco que recién inicia, actualmente tiene 22 socias, algunas D. ellas fueron invitadas por socias D. otro Banco Comunal y por la promotora.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. cereales, productos naturales D. la hoja D. coca, ropa, artesanía, cosméticos, cebiche, joyas, ferretería, verduras, abarrotes y artesanía en telar.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles, haciendo un total D. 12,050 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal.

Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra D. maíz, trigo, gaseosas, trigo, lanas, hilos, útiles D. escritorio, productos naturales, polos, chompas, pantalones, lencería, arroz, azúcar, limón, tomate, herramientas, joyas.

Los sueños D. las socias son que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales, culminar la construcción D. su casa, salir adelante sola sin la ayuda D. nadie, que sus negocios crezcan y tener mas capital.

loans.use: To purchase corn, wheat, carbonated water, wool, threads, office supplies, natural products, poles, chompas, pants, lingerie, rice, sugar, lemon, tomato, tools, and jewels for various businesses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use:
to purchase various merchandise for re-sale

El crédito lo utilizara en la compra mercadería variada

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda has become a mother recently, and due to the concern of increasing her income to be able to support her home better, she decided to start selling prestigious brands of cosmetics around her city and among her friends. She hopes to continue this work, and through it, to offer well-being to her beloved baby.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Hilda, se ha convertido en madre recientemente y ante la preocupación de incrementar sus ingresos para mantener mucho mejor su hogar ha decidido incursionar en la venta de artículos cosméticos de las prestigiosas marcas por los alrededores de su ciudad y entre sus amistades.Desea continuar con esta labor y a través de ella otorgarle bienestar a su amado bebé.

loans.use: Increase in capital to offer a better quantity of products

loans.name: Akif

texts.en: Akif Q. is a 58 year old farmer who breeds calves for meat in the southern part of Azerbaijan in the Bilasuvar Internally Displaced People Settlement. He has more than 20 years of experience in this field. Akif is married and has five children. He is working as a teacher at a local school but his salary is too meager to cover his family's needs. His monthly salary is about 30 USD per month. Akif is focused on expanding his livestock business. He is requesting a loan of 800 USD to purchase two calves at 300 USD each and 200 USD of fodder.

loans.use: to purchase two calves and fodder

loans.name: Romelia

texts.es:
Romelia belongs to the communal bank “Sol Naciente”, located in the Calleria district in Ucayali. She is 61 years old and has three children, however her income is not enough to meet her financial needs. It’s for this reason that Romelia, with her first loan of S/. 300 from Manuela Ramos, decided to invest in a small business selling food.

She currently runs the business at night, rising at 7 am to prepare her breakfast and from then on dedicate herself to preparing her food which she sells from 5 pm until 10 pm.

With this loan of S/. 2,500, to be repaid over a period of four months, she bought rice, oil, sodas, condiments, poultry, fish, etc.

Romelia is very happy and her business is growing little by little, and her sales are also are increasing. All the effort she puts forth is to support her family and to demonstrate for other women that they too can work and be successful businesswomen.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Romelia pertenece al Banco Comunal Sol Naciente, ubicado en la Av. Jhon F Kendy 999, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 61 años y es madre D. 3 hijos, pero los ingresos económicos que tiene no le alcanzan para su economía familiar, es así que Romelia con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 deciD. invertir en un pequeño negocio D. venta D. comidas. En la actualidad ella cuenta un negocio D. venta D. comidas en las noches, para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar su desayuno y D. allí se dedica a la preparación D. sus comidas para venderlos en las tardes desD. las 5 pm hasta las 10 pm. Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,500 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, compró menestras, arroz, aceite, gaseosas, condimentos, gallinas, pescado, etc. Romelia está muy feliz, su negocio está creciendo poco a poco y sus ventas también aumentan y todo el esfuerzo que realiza es para apoyar a su familia y demostrar a todas las demás mujeres que si pueden trabajar y ser grandes empresarias.

loans.use: Purchase supplies at wholesale.

loans.name: Saini's Group

texts.en: These ladies work on different businesses like pancakes, vegetable garden, farming, and plantations, but most of them are doing plantations and foodstall businesses.  They sell their products at the schools and their taro and taamu at the main market at Salelologa.  These ladies are from one village and they live close to each other. Their husbands help them run their businesses, and they all help each other on their businesses.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients, tools, and equipment for starting up their businesses.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia is 37 and lives with her husband and 2 children. She has been dedicated to agriculture since she was very young, since she used to help her parents with different activities related to farming. Since she got married, this is the activity that has helped her support her home together with her husband. Since this work is an enormous sacrifice, not only because of putting up with the rain, but also because of the arduous work involved in it, it takes her all day to carry it out. But this doesn't stop her wanting to plant because what she enjoys most is harvesting her products and selling them at market. Nevertheless, what limits her is the expensive prices of insecticides and fertilizers that help protect her crops.

This woman bases her strength on the well-being of her home and educating her two teenage children.

Because she is projecting an increase in production, she wants to invest the money she is requesting in her farmland so she can grow as a farmer and a merchant.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Delia tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Desde muy pequeña está dedicada a la agricultura, ya que ayudaba a sus padres en las diversas actividades concernientes a la actividad del agricultor. Desde que contrajo matrimonio esta es la actividad que le ayuda a mantener su hogar junto a su esposo.Debido a que esta labor es de enorme sacrificio, no solo por soportar las lluvias, sino por el trabajo arduo que se emplea en él, le toma todo un día en realizarlo, pero esto no le quita las ganas de sembrar, ya que lo que más le agrada es cosechar sus productos y venderlos en los mercados.Sin embargo, lo que la limita son los costosos precios de los insecticidas y fertilizantes que ayudan a proteger sus sembríos.

Esta mujer basa su esfuerzo en el bienestar de su hogar y en la educación de sus dos hijos adolescentes.

Proyectándose al aumento de su producción, quiere invertir el dinero que solicita en sus campos de cultivo, y así crecer como agricultora y comerciante.

loans.use: Investment capital to prepare and improve her farmland

loans.name: Rasim

texts.en:
Rasim M. is a 41-year-old man who keeps a veterinary drug store. He has eight years of experience in this field. He is married and has three daughters.

Rasim has applied for $US1,200 to expand his business. Drug stores are one of the more profitable businesses in the southern regions of Azerbaijan as the majority of people keep livestock and injections are necessary to avoid illness.

loans.use: To expand his veterinary supply business.

loans.name: Zawadi Makame Group

texts.en:
Zawadi has owned a small business in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for one year.  She is currently able to earn a profit of approximately $35 each month.  She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more of the commodities necessary for her business to grow.  

Zawadi is 31 years old, married, and has two children, aged 5 and 10.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her business.

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Hoang Thi T. is 35 years old. She has been a member of TYM since 2006. She used her first loan to buy pigs. Now her family's primary income is from growing and selling rice. With an income about 4 millionVND/month, her family has enough money to improve their quality of life. With her next loan of 6 millionVND ($375USD), Hoang Thi would like to buy more pigs for her business.

loans.use: To buy more pigs for her farming business

loans.name: Gorrette

texts.en: K. Gorrette is a hard-working and ambitious businesswoman. She is 27 years of age, married with 2 children. She lives in her own house which she built in the Nansana Navuro area.  Besides owning a guest house along the Kabalagala-Muyenga road, she runs a clothes business in Nansana. Gorrette will use the loan to purchase more clothes to meet the increased demand as the holidays draw near.

loans.use: Purchasing more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es: Lilia cuenta con 42 años de edad, hace 20 años vive con su esposo, aun no han formalizado su situación conyugal, pero de esta relación tiene 3 hijos, los 2 mayores viven fuera, por estudios actualmente están viviendo en un terreno que les dio su suegra mientras que adquiera el suyo propio. Hace 4 años atrás ella y su esposo decidieron ingresar al negocio de la compra y venta de frutas, y en todo este tiempo han notado que le es muy rentable; mientras que su esposo sigue con el labrado de sus cítricos, (antes solo se dedicaban a cultivar la fruta) ella selecciona las frutas y preparar la carga de su producto, que lleva tres veces por semana a un mercado de Lima. Lilia quiere aprovechar al máximo su negocio, con la mira de comprar y construir su propia casa en una ciudad más grande. En los días que sale a vender sus productos gana entre 150 a 200 soles, de ello paga el flete, el alquiler de su puesto y la alimentación del hogar. Mientras tanto su esposo prepara las naranjas de su chacra que habían sembrado hace 5 años atrás; y que hoy cosechan los frutos de esta planta que les sirven para la educación superior de sus hijos. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, donde las devoluciones las ha realizado sin problemas de mora. La cantidad que solicita la invertirá en la compra de frutas en grandes cantidades para que luego las pueda vender encajonadas, así gana más de lo habitual.
texts.en:
Lilia is 42 years old, and has lived with her husband for 20 years, although they still haven't formalised their relationship. But they have three children, the eldest two live elsewhere in order to study - they're currently living on land that her mother-in-law gave them while they acquired their own. Four years ago Lilia and her husband decided to set-up a business buying and selling fruits and in all this time they have realised that it is very profitable. While her husband continues to work with the citrus fruits (previously they only worked growing fruit), she selects the fruits and prepares the packing of the product, that she takes three times a week to a market in Lima. Lilia wants to make the most of her business, with the aim of buying and building their own house in a bigger town. On the days when she goes to sell their products she earns between 150 and 200 soles, from which she pays the rent, the hire of her stall and buys food for her home. During all this her husband prepares oranges from their land which had been planted 5 years ago and today they harvest the fruits of these plants in order to pay for the further education of her children. This is her 5th loan con MFP, of which she has been able to make repayments without any delay. The money which she is asking for will be invested in the purchase of fruits in big quantities so that later they can sell them boxed-up, as this way they'll earn more than normal.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit wholesale for her business

loans.name: Saweda

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 24-year-old Saweda S. R. from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. She is married with three children, between the ages of five and eight. Saweda has been running a beauty salon business since 2006. This is the place where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or braided, and made to look like your own.

Saweda works at the business for 9 to 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Saweda currently earns about 100 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase hair products and cosmetics. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Saweda thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase hair products and cosmetics

loans.name: Abdulahad

texts.ru: Курбонов Абдулахад житель города Яван. Возраст 26 лет, но уже женат и имеет троих детей. Уже шесть лет обеспечивает семью , тем , что занимается купле-продажей крупно рогатого скота. Хочет получить кредит и увеличить поголовье скота. Это даст возможность увеличить прибыль. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Abdulahad K. lives in Yavan. He is 26 years old but is already married with three children. For the past six years he has been making a living by working in animal sales. He would like to obtain a loan in order to purchase more livestock. This would allow him to increase profit. He would be able to pay off the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Reynaldo Ysais

texts.es: El señor Reynaldo O. Gutiérrez tiene la edad de 26 años habita en el barrio Pablo calero junto a su esposa, ella de dedica al comercio y le apoya en la agricultura, ya que ellos tienen a su cargo dos hijos un varón de doce años que estudia segundo años de secundaria y una niña de siete años que estudia su primaria, los planes hacia su familia es apoyarlo con su estudios para que gocen de una mejor vida , el desde hace nueve años se dedica a trabajar como agricultor para poder mantener a sus hijos , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , el inicio su vida como agricultor por sus propios esfuerzos y el apoyo de reforma agraria que le dirigió una capacitación a algunos pobladores , pero sin financiamiento , los planes hacia su negocio o cultivo es mejorarlo para poder tener mayor ingreso , el financiamiento lo quiere para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos para tener una producción buena.
texts.en:
Mr. Reynaldo O. Gutiérrez is 26 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Pablo Calero with his wife. She is dedicated to commerce and he supports her with agriculture as they have two children in their charge, a boy of twelve years in his second year of middle school and a girl of seven years who is in elementary school. Reynaldo’s plan for his family is to support their studies so that they may enjoy a better life.

Reynaldo has for nine years worked as a farmer to be able to support his children with the greatest difficulty being the lack of finances. The start of his life as a farmer was for his own efforts and the support of agrarian reform which gave him training as a settler, but without financing. The plan for his business or farming is to improve it to be able to have better income.

The financing he wants is for the purchase of fertilizers and consumables to have good production.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy consumables for the improvement of the farm

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is 32 years old and she is married with 3 children. She sells clothes in retail to her customers. She hopes for the loan amount of N50000 to purchase more clothes to sell.  She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. is married to Nolie A., a farmer/tenant. Mrs. A. is in her 8th cycle, availing of PHP 5,500.00. Her loan is intended for additional capital for banana vending. Her customers are from their barangay and other neighboring places. She has 3 children and all are still studying at elementary level.

She dreams of a comfortable living, having enough income to sustain their daily needs and to also send their children to college education.

loans.use: Additional capital for banana vending

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia T. is 30 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters. She says three are currently in the primary school. The last is yet to start. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. It is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband works at the local government’s hospital.

Afia is a food vendor. She cooks and sells rice and stew. She cooks the food in the house and sells on the street in the mornings. She procures bags of rice and other ingredients from nearby towns. Afia has been in business for four years and wants a loan to procure bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure bags of rice in bulk.

loans.name: Hochiumar

texts.ru: Хочиумар – пожилой мужчина 59 лет. Женат и отец 6-х детей. Жена домохозяйка, делает работу по дому и присматривает за внуками. Хочиумар как глава семьи работает и зарабатывает деньги. Он водит маршрутное такси по маршруту Худжанд – Гафуров. Он работает по графику: 2 дня работает, 1 день отдыхает. В рабочие дни он старается максимально заработать деньги, и работает с раннего утра до поздней ночи. В выходной день он ремонтирует свою машину. Займ он хотел бы использовать на ремонт своего маршрутного такси.
texts.en:
Hochiumar is an older man of 59 years. He is married and the father of six children. His wife is a homemaker; she does housework and looks after the grandchildren. Hochiumar, as the head of the family, works and earns money. He drives a minibus taxi between Khudjand and Gafurov. His work schedule is 2 days of work and one day off. On working days he tries to earn as much as possible by working from early in the morning to late at night. On days off he repairs his vehicle. He would like to use a loan on repairs for his minibus.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Transportation services

loans.name: Jeremias

texts.en:
Jeremias D. drives a trisikad, a manually operated vehicle which is an improvised bike, providing transportation services to local community members. Jeremias is married and has three school-aged children. He is 54 years old and from the village of GK, Santiago, Iligan City. Jeremias has been in this service business for over ten years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jeremias joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in improving the business. This will be his first loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue to supplement income of his family.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To improve transportation business

location.town: GK, Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Titilayo
