texts.en: Titilayo sells drinks and pepper soup. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of N 140,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. Titilayo is 49 years old and married to A. who is a motor mechanic; they have three children. Titilayo says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Raising pigs for sale is what Jovita T. loves to do. For fifteen years, she has enjoyed the business that primarily supports her family. She is 45 years old and has three children.

Jovita was recognized as an official PMPC member in 2007 and has religiously paid back her loan of PHP 20,000. Now she is requesting a new loan to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She deeply wishes that the profits will support the needs of her family and other family members, too.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Lorigen

texts.en:
Lorigen R.'s main source of income comes from providing motorcab transport services in her community. She is 22 years old, married and has a baby. They are from the village of Silanga, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. Lorigen has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lorigen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Lorigen is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in a motorcab transport service

loans.name: Bamar

texts.fr: bamar N. est membre de la caisse de yoff depuis septembre 2008.il evolue dans la menuiserie et gere un atelier dans le meme quartier.il capitalise une experience de plus de dix ans.il sollicite un credit de trois cent mille(300 000)frs qui lui permettra d'acquerir du materiel pour fabriquer des meubles destines a la vente.l'augmentation de ses profits lui permettra d'accroitre son fond de roulement.
texts.en:
Bamar N. has been a member of the Yoff bank since September 2008. He is progressing in carpentry and manages a workshop in the same area. He capitalizes on over ten years of experience. He’s requesting a loan of 300,000 francs that will allow him to acquire some supplies and equipment for making furniture to sell. The increase in his profits will enable him to grow his working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment

loans.name: Prak

texts.en: Prak S. is the mother of seven children. She currently lives in Siem Reap Province. Since 2000, S. has run a business selling fish in local Psa Kroam Market, and is currently earning an average of $3 per day. As another source of family income comes from her husband who drives a motorcycle. Recently, the income of S.'s husband has slowly decreased due to his no longer working motorcycle. S. has decided to ask for a loan which will allow her to replace her husband's motorcycle.

loans.use: To replace husband's motorcycle

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es:
La señora Dionisia es socia del Banco Comunal “Cuturapi” del centro poblado D. Cuturapi del Distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia del Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 52 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada tiene 9 hijos (6 a su cargo), vive en Cuturapi  Barrio 24 D. Junio  y tuvo la oportunidad  D. estudiar.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 5 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma D. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio D. compra venta D. artesanías.

En la actualidad requiere D. un nuevo préstamo D. S/. 2500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar lanas D. colores lana D. ovino y alpaca para hilado, bayetas, para la fabricación D. frazadas, bolsas, llijllas, etc. Para la exportación desD. Cuzco, y Lima.

Su mayor deseo es seguir trabajando con los préstamos D. Manuela Ramos ya que les ayuda mucho en su negocio.

A ella le  gustan  las reuniones y las facilidades en los préstamos.

loans.use: Para la compra ed lana de alpaca de colores, lana de ovino, bayetas.

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es:
Eulogia tiene 51 años, vive sola en su casa propia. Desde hace 20 años se dedica a la venta de productos alimenticios de su zona, como quesos y truchas, los cuales lleva a vender a la ciudad de Lima.
Ella viaja todos los fines de semana llevando en sus baldes herméticos sus productos, los cuales comercializa en los principales mercados de la ciudad de manera ambulante. Trabajar de esta manera le permite a Eulogia lograr tener los ingresos económicos para su sustento, pues siempre obtiene las ganancias que ha planificado para la semana. 

Para el futuro, desea tener en su casa una tienda de abarrotes y establecerse en su localidad en venta de alimentos.

Esta es la quinta oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP y está muy entusiasmada por el nuevo ciclo de trabajo que va a realizar con su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo usará para la compra de más quesos.
texts.en:
Eulogia is 51 years old, living alone in her own house. For 20 years, she has sold food common to the locale, such as cheese and trout. She transports these things to sell in Lima. She works every weekend, taking her products in sealed buckets to sell in the city's major open-air markets. Working this way allows Eulogia to earn enough income to sustain herself; she always earns enough to cover her weekly budget. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store out of her home and establish herself in the local grocery market. This is the fifth loan Eulogia has received from Kiva partner MFP. She is very excited for this new opportunity to work with her communal bank. The loan she is requesting now will be used to purchase more cheese.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Josue Omar

texts.es:
El socio JOSUE OMAR, pertenece al banco comunal “PROGRESO DE LOS ANDES”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

El socia tiene 38 años de edad, es soltero, vive actualmente en la ciudad del Cusco, el es bachiller en administración de empresas y trabaja en la entidad bancaria Scotiabank, el tiene 2 años ejerciendo su profesión, el socio necesita el crédito para poder implementar una oficina para vender tarjetas de celulares pre pago y hacer llamadas virtuales, necesita comprar muebles, computadoras, etc.

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
JOSUE OMAR, 38, is a member of the “PROGRESO DE LOS ANDES" communal bank. He is from the city of Cusco. He is single and currently lives in the city of Cusco. He is a graduate in business administration and has worked for Scotiabank for the past two years. He needs funding to set up an office to sell pre-paid cell phone cards as well as to make virtual phone calls. He needs furniture, computers, etc. He is grateful for the opportunity this means offers and pledges to make his repayments in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell pre-paid cell phone cards.

loans.name: Valam

texts.en:
Valam is an entrepreneurial man and lives with his wife and three children who all help him in the business of production and sale of national bread “lepeshka”. He began his business to help with household expenses and at the same time to cover the costs of study of his children and their basic upkeep. He began his business five years ago by selling in both his house and on the market, counting already an almost fixed clientele. Valam is asking for a loan of $1500 to buy flour, coal and other products to increase the production of lepeshka in order to give better attention to his clients. Valam and his family thank you very much for the help which you give him in being able to follow through in creating his business and being able to continue with it in the future.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase flour, coal and other products for baking

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La socia A. es una humilde madre de familia que ya son varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”.    

La socia tiene 51 años de edad, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. La menor de todas las hijas estudia en la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado del Departamento de Madre de Dios. 
La socia Antonio vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en la comunidad de Angostura que se encuentra ubicada al sur de la ciudad del Cusco. Nuestra socia tiene un stand de venta de comida en el mercado “Vino Canchon”. Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar, con la atención de su pequeña tienda de abarrotes y su tienda de comida. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere sacar adelante a su familia.  Así de esta manera poder aumentar el capital del negocio y para tener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
A. is a humble mother and has been a member of the "Virgen Purificada - Angostura" community bank for a number years. She is 51 years old, married, and has four children. The youngest of her daughters goes to school in the city of Puerto Maldonado in the department of Madre de Dios. A. lives in the district of San Jerónimo in the Angostura neighborhood, which is located in the southern part of the city of Cusco. This member has a stand where she sells food in the "Vino Canchon" market. She balances her household activities with attending her small grocery and food store. She has had this business for a few years, and it has served her well thanks to the dedication she puts into her work. She is a hard-working and enterprising mother who wants her family to get ahead. With help from a loan, she will be able to increase her business' capital, have a better income, and be able to give her family a better quality of life. A. is very grateful for the opportunity granted through this program, and likewise she pledges to fully comply with her repayment plan.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food for her store such as rice, sugar, pasta, and soft drinks

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua is 45 years old. She is married and the mother of eight children. Currently seven are in school in the community where they live. Akosua loves selling goods, the business through which she obtains her livelihood.  She has been selling cassava and plantain for six years to support her family. She treks to farming communities to buy her stock of food items from the farmers. This saves her from middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices. With this loan, she wants to buy plantain and cassava in bulk to supply her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her children in school.

loans.use: To buy a supply of tubers of cassava in bulk

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 39-year-old trader. She is married and has two children who are in school. She is a very resourceful woman whose hard work brings livelihood to the family. 

Janet supports her family by selling used clothing and by farming. Used clothing has a very big market share in Ghana, because brand new clothes are very expensive for the economically active poor. Janet has been in this business for the past two years. She travels to the nearby city of Kumasi to purchase her stock of goods. 

She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing to increase her inventory. She believes this loan will help her to get a good return on her business investment, and thereby, increase her profits.

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a 38-year-old married businesswoman. She owns a retail shop selling essential home products. She has been running her business for more than three years. She will use the loan to purchase retail items, such as sugar, salt, soap, rice, flour and cooking oil, for business expansion. Her future hope is to buy a plot of land and to construct a house.

loans.use: To purchase retail items in order to expand her business

loans.name: Eric Ouma

texts.en:
Erick Ouma O. is 22 years old and married to Maurine Auma; they live in Nyalenda in the city of Kisumu. They just wedded recently and so they have no children at the moment.  

Erick sells oil which is mostly used in lubricating cars. He is looking for a lender through Kadet Ltd/Kiva to enable him to get funds to purchase five gallons of oil. He has orders to transport some of the oil to to some of his customers in Nairobi. He hopes to be the leading supplier of used oil in Kisumu and wants to use the loan to expand his business. 

Erick's wife is a tailor and he intends to use the profits to buy her another sewing machine to enable her to run her business well and help boost the family income.

loans.use: Purchase 5 gallons of oil to add to his stock

loans.name: Grupo Positivo Group

texts.es:
El comité “Grupo Positivo”  está conformada por 16 integrantes,en la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, las integrantes del comité son madres que se dedican a varias actividades con el fin de fortalecer la economía de la casa y desarrollar sus emprendimientos de manera sustentable y con vistas a un crecimiento constante, con la ayuda de una asistencia financiera permanente.
Estas mujeres se dedican a varias actividades, como la señora Gloria V. quien como actividad complementaria a las labores de su casa y generar ganancia vende perfumes.
Ella ofrece sus productos a sus vecinas o en casas comerciales, sus clientes son cocidas de ellas y le pagan en cuotas ya que es la manera más fácil de colocar sus productos.
Se citan las actividades de las otras integrantes:
1
Gloria V.
Ventas de Perfumes
2
Consorcia C.

Trabajos de Frutas y verduras

Ventas de Verduras
13

14

Promotora
15

16

Ventas de Carnes
texts.en:
The “Grupo Positivo” committee is made up of 16 members in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. The members of the committee are mothers who are engaged in various commercial activities aimed at strengthening their households’ economy and to develop their undertakings in a sustainable way with the goal in mind to continue growing with the help of permanent financial support. These women are engaged in a variety of activities. Gloria V., for example, besides her domestic chores, sells perfumes. Her usual customers are neighbors or store employees. All her customers are known to her and they pay her in installments since this is the most efficient way to sell her products. The other members are in the following activities: 1 Gloria V. Perfume Sales 2 Consorcia C. Food Sales 3 Mirtha F. Fruit & Vegetable Sales 4 Irma B. Beverage Sales 5 Elizabeth P. Food Sales 6 Maria A. Costume Jewelry Sales 7 Maria Luisa B. Domestic Employee 8 Adriana A. Clothing Sales 9 Ada A. Domestic Employee 10 Cinthia B. Perfume Sales 11 Florencia V. Food Sales 12 Gabriela Caceres Vegetable Sales 13 Antonia N. Food Sales 14 Leticia V. Saleswoman 15 Yaquelyn S. Clothing Sales 16 Liz G. Meat Sales

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perfumes.

loans.name: Olivia Anabel

texts.es: Olivia Anabel tiene 45 años, ella tiene 1 hijo y esta a su cargo, este no es el primer crédito de ella, pues le han sido de mucho apoyo los créditos. Ella inicio este negocio hace más de 3 años, por lo que su actividad económica es un cafetín por lo que ofrece diferentes productos, ella se levanta muy temprano pues tiene que ir al mercado a realizar las compras de sus productos. Pues es una persona muy carismática. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra necesaria de materia prima para su negocio. El sueño de Olivia es obtener otro negocio para mantenerse mejor.
texts.en:
Olivia Anabel is 45 years old and has one child for whom she is responsible. This is not her first loan, since she has received plenty of assistance through her previous ones. She started this business more than three years ago, a café where she offers different products. Olivia wakes up very early to go to the market to purchase her products. She is a very charismatic person.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy raw materials for her business. Olivia dreams of obtaining another business so that she can better support herself.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Sikiru

texts.en:
Sikiru sells shoes at retail prices in Ibadan, Oyo State. She loves this business because of the profit she makes. She hopes to own a shoe factory in the future. She is 40 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports their home. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more shoes to sell. 

Sikiru says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries and a deep freezer

loans.name: Sroem's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sroem T. is 47 years old and lives in Krasang village in Takeo province. She is a widow who does not have any children. 

She was selected by the fourteen members of her loA. group to be a village bank president. The group members will each use their loans for different purposes -- to purchase supplies, equipment and other items.

Mrs. Sroem T. is a grocery seller who owns a general store. In order to expand her business, Mrs. Sroem T.  decided to ask for a loA. to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.use: To to purchase more groceries for resale.

loans.name: Tataisutheke Group

texts.en: Fatmata K. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in Makeni city 35 years ago. She is married to a teacher and the couple has three children. Two of the children are in secondary school and one is in primary school. For many years now, she has been selling beans and palm oil (the most popular cooking oil). With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Fatmata will use her share of the loan (SLL 800,000) to expand her business. She will buy beans and palm oil at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy beans and palm oil at wholesale

loans.name: Godonou Justin

texts.fr: D. Godonou Justin est né le 23 Juin 1978 et est marié à KINSOU Bernadette, une ménagère. Le couple a quatre enfants à charge, tous scolarisés. Parmi ces enfants, deux sont leurs propres enfants. Il y a environs cinq ans que Justin s’est installé au quartier Tohouè dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, où il vit avec ses enfants et sa femme. Justin et Bernadette se partagent les différentes charges familiales. Justin a très peu fréquenté l’école. C’est un meunier, ayant près de quinze ans d’expérience dans l’exercice de cette activité. De façon secondaire, Justin fait de l’élevage, ce qui lui permet d’avoir plusieurs sources de revenus. Justin s’approvisionne à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, mais exerce son activité à son domicile. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux faire face aux différentes demandes de sa clientèle, Justin sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
D. Godonou Justin was born on June 23, 1978 and is married to KINSOU Bernadette, housewife. The couple is raising four children, all enrolled in school. Among these, two are their biological children. About five years ago, Justin settled in the Tohouè neighborhood of Sèmè-Podji, where he lives with his wife and children. Justin and Bernadette share in supporting their family. Justin barely attended school. He is a miller with 15 years of experience in his trade. Secondarily, he raises livestock which allows him several sources of income. He gets his supplies in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin, but does his work at his home. Wishing to expand his business and better service the various needs of his customers, Justin is requesting a loan from ALIDé for the very first time.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase a mill for palm fruit

loans.name: Nub

texts.en:
Nub S., 54, is widowed and lives with her three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples.

S. weaves Cambodian traditional silk for an income of USD 5 per day. She is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase more raw silk to produce silk products to sell.

In the future, S. would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy raw silk to produce more silk products to sell

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Mrs. Vicenta C. is from Linconan, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old and is married with four children. Her husband is a farmer which helps to support their daily basic needs.

Vicenta owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store, earning approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Vicenta joined PMPC to gain access to financial support to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in other business activities. She has successfully repaid her previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC which was used for the expansion of her business.

Now Vicenta has a new loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC and this loan is for use as additional capital to buy additional stock. This loan will be her 3rd loan from PMPC.


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Mobibi

texts.en:
M. Mobibi is 53 years old. She is married with 4 adorable children. Mobibi has been able to combine her love of children with a successful business selling kid’s clothing at a busy market in Dushanbe. Mobibi currently has one sales place at the market. Eventually, she would like to open a store in a permanent facility. She has requested a loan of 5400 Somoni to help purchase new clothing inventory.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase additional clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Personal Expenses

loans.name: Aisuluu's Group

texts.en:
Aisuluu S. K. is the leader of this group. She is a 36-year-old widow.  She has three sons, all of whom are at school.  Nine years ago with the initial investment of 2,000 Kyrgyzstan soms Aisuluu started to sell convenience goods.  She now makes 13,000 soms per month; her profits made it possible for her to build a kiosk near her house. With this loan she wants to purchase a variety of convenience goods to increase the turnover of her business. 

Aida S. K. is twenty years old. She is engaged in cattle breeding. She started this activity two years ago with the initial investment of 2,000 soms. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase a bull, fatten it, and then resell it at a higher price. In the future she wants to increase the number of cattle she owns and finish the construction of her house.

Jamilya S., 45, is divorced. She has a daughter and a son; her daughter is married and lives separately with her family, and her son works in Russia.  Three years ago with the initial investment of 6,000 soms Jamilya started to breed livestock. Selling some sheep after fattening she makes 2,000 soms per month. With this loan she wants to purchase sheep for breeding.  In the future she wants to save some money to contribute to her son’s wedding.

Shyrman S. is the treasurer of the group.  She is a 44-year-old widow.  She has raised two sons and a daughter; the first son is married and lives separately with his family, the second son is at school, and the daughter works as a teacher in a kindergarten. Four years ago with the initial investment of 3,000 soms Shyrman started to sell convenience goods. In this way she makes 9,000 soms per month. She hopes to obtain this loan because she needs money to purchase a variety of convenience goods in order to increase the turnover of her business. In the future Shyrman plans to expand her business and build her own shop.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan.

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of convenience goods

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en: Youssef is a 39 years old married man, living in Tripoli with his wife and 2 kids. Youssef ha owned a laundry since 2009 and has 15 years of experience in this field. Youssef is an old A. Majmoua client, this is his second cycle. His last loan helped in improving his business a lot. This time Youssef is requesting a loan in order to buy a car that eases and improves his business. He will use it for delivery needs and this will improve delivery. He hopes to grow his business through opening more branches

loans.use: To buy a car to improves his business

loans.name: Women Of Valour Group

texts.es:
El comité se formo en el barrio Ypati de la ciudad de Villa  Elisa  por medio de otro grupo que trabaja en la misma zona, el comité cuenta actualmente con 15 integrantes todas vecinas entre si. 
Hablaremos de Fátima C. quien es la Directora del Comité, ella  es soltera, tiene 2 hijos (dos mujeres, uno de23 años y 13 años ,respectivamente)vive en su propia casa . 
 S e dedica a la venta de helados ,   que consumen tanto adultos como niños.
Fátima además  estudió peluquería en el SNPP. Ella suele realizar trabajos de peluquería en el barrio a los vecinos , como  por ejemplo : planchitas , peinados , cortes , etc. 
Ella desea ampliar su negocio comprando más variedades de helados y desearía colocar también su peluquería para tener mas ingreso para el hogar y que nada les falte tanto a ella como a sus hijas.
texts.en:
The group was formed in the Ypati district of the city of Villa Elisa and it stemmed from another group operating in the same region. The group is made up of 15 individuals; they are all neighbors. In speaking with Fatima C. we know that she is the leader of the group, she is single, and she has 2 children (both are daughters, aged 23 and 13 years old respectively). She lives in her own house. She sells ice-cream, sought out by both adults and children. Fatima also studied hair dressing at the SNPP. She provides hair dressing services for her neighbors such as ironing treatments, up-do's, hair cuts etc. She wishes to expand her business to have a wider variety of ice-cream and she would also like to set up a beauty shop to have another source of income for their household. Her goal is to always provide for herself and for her daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ice cream and to make downpayments to open a store.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “MUJERES UNIDAS ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de  San Sebastián, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ines;   ella tiene 63 años de edad, es madre soltera; y tiene 6 hijos,  La socia se dedica  a la compra y venta de maíz de jora para la elaboración de chicha blanca y la atención de su stand de venta de abarrotes (leche, fideos, aceites, galletas, harinas, azúcar, arroz, entre otros). Ella trabaja exclusivamente con estos dos negocios desde hace 8 años sin parar.  La socia requiere el dinero para aumentar su mercadería de abarrotes e implementar su stand, ella aún ayuda a sus dos hijos con sus estudios y a algunos de sus nietos en su educación.  La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar abarrotes de primera necesidad para implementar su tienda.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres Unidas" [United Women]. The communal bank is located in the district of San Sebastián, in the province and department of Cusco.

The member is Ines, 63, who is a single mother with six children. She buys and sells jora maize, used in the preparation of traditional corn liquor, and tends to her stand where she sells groceries (milk, beans, oils, crackers, flours, sugar, rice among others). She has dedicated herself exclusively to these two businesses for the past eight years without any breaks. The member needs the money to add to her grocery merchandise and set up her stand. She is still helping two of her children with their studies and some of her grandchildren as well. The member seeks the loan to purchase basic grocery supplies with which to set up her shop. The member appreciates and gives thanks for the loan granted through these means and likewise promises to make her payments within the established time period.

loans.use: To purchase basic commodities to supply her store

loans.name: Oumou

texts.fr: Oumou est une femme mariée, elle a  2 personnes à charge et son mari est un mécanicien. Elle exerce dans la restauration plus précisément elle vend la bouillie et des beignets. Les gens consomment  la bouillie comme petit déjeuner ; elle arrive toujours à vendre tout son stock. Sa bouillie est faite à base de céréales. Le stock de céréales dont elle dispose est fini, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 6 sacs de maïs, 10 bols de sorgho et 50 bols de mil. Ce crédit est son troisième.
texts.en: Oumou is a married lady who has two people in her care, and her husband is a mechanic. She has a restauration activity, more specifically she sells "bouillie" (a type of porridge) and fritters. People eat this "porridge" for breakfast and she always manages to sell her entire stock. Her porridge is made from cereals, but her stock of cereals has run out. For this reason she is requesting a loan from WAGES in order to buy six bags of corn, ten bowls of sorghum and 50 bowls of millet. This loan is her third.

loans.use: Purchase of corn, beans, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Haydalina

texts.es: La señora Haydalina tiene 46 años, ya que vive con su familia. La señora tiene un negocio de venta de cerdos y gallina. La señora dio inicio a este negocio desde hace 5 años, ella inicio por la necesidad de obtener un trabajo que le generara ingresos para su hogar, ya que todos los días se levanta temprano pues tiene que encargarse de los quehaceres del hogar y de su negocio. Ella actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para satisfacer unos pedidos de clientes. Ella ha querido realizar unos arreglos para guardar a los animales.
texts.en:
Haydalina is 46 years old, and lives with her family. This lady runs a business selling pigs and chickens. She started this business 5 years ago, as she needed to get a job to generate income for their home.

Each day she wakes up early to take care of household chores and her business. She is currently seeking a loan to meet customer orders. She would like to make a few adjustments to the animal enclosures.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Evelyn Vanessa

texts.es: Evelyn Vanessa se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Desde hace mas de 13 años, ella tiene su negocio pus siempre se preocupa por proporcionarle a sus clientes ella es una mujer muy lista y disfruta mucho de brindar a sus clientes lo mejor. Ella solicita este crédito para la compra de materia prima ya que acerca una buena temporada como es la navidad, necesita comprar toallas, sabanas, ropa, cosméticos y calzado. Sueña con seguir apoyando a sus 2 hijos menores de edad que todavía están a su cargo.
texts.en: Evelyn Vanessa makes a living selling all types of goods. She has been in business for the past 13 years as she always serves her customers. She is a smart woman who enjoys furnishing the best for her her customers. She is requesting this loan to buy inventory since Christmas is coming up. She needs to buy towels, sheets, clothing, cosmetics and shoes. She hopes to keep providing for her 2  children that still depend on her.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand her husband's shoe shop.

loans.name: Fausto Jose

texts.es:
Fausto de 43 años de edad vive con su esposa Grace Gutierrez quien es ama de Casa y sus hijos quienes le ayudan en las actividades de la Finca, en la Comarca la Tigra, el Jicaro del municipio de El Almendro, es un productor y ganadero. Este señor recibe ingresos por venta de productos de su finca, siendo propietario de su unidad de producción, con esfuerzo propio ha logrado lo que ahora tiene, ya que es una persona muy trabajadora y de buenas costumbres, 
Quiere seguir progresando por lo que solicita su primer financiamiento mediante Kiva para invertirlo en mejorar su vivienda la que dará mejores condiciones a su núcleo familia. 

Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos sean personas de bien y brindarles mayor comodidad en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Fausto is 43 years old and lives with his wife Grace Gutierrez, who is a housewife, and his children who help him with the work on his farm in la Tigra, el Jicaro district of the town of El Almendro.  He is a producer and livestock farmer.  This gentleman makes income by selling products from his farm as he is the owner of his production unit.  Through his own hard work he has achieved all that he now has since he is a very hard-working man of good habits.

Fausto would like to continue making progress which is why he is requesting his first loan through Kiva to invest in improving his home which will provide his immediate family with better living conditions.

Fausto's greatest dream is for his children to be good people and to provide them with better comfort in their home.

loans.use: To buy building materials to improve his home

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 39 years old and married with a 9-year-old child. She is from the town of Sto. Niño. Perla grows rice and pigs and manages a sari-sari (general) store. Her husband, who is a farmer, does the major farming tasks, while Perla fattens the pigs and runs the store. 

Perla joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perla has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy farm inputs, feed and additional merchandise to sell. Perla hopes to be able to maintain the family’s farm, pigsty and store. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by the loan to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, feed and store merchandise

loans.name: Mr. Neang Mao Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of 11 people living in Srae Vong village in Takeo province. Mr. Neang M. is the village bank president selected by the other members, who will use their portions of the loan for different purposes to improve their family's lives.

Mr. Neang M. is a construction worker and bicycle repairer in the local village, earning some money to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Yoeun Chhet, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to feed her family. Mr. Neang M. wants to start a new business, but doesn't have enough money to do so. Therefore, he is applying for a loan to buy six piglets for breeding. Mr. Neang M. is the father of two children, both of whom attend the local public school.

loans.use: to buy six piglets for breeding

loans.name: Sochenda

texts.en:
Mrs. Sochenda S. (in the photo) and her husband sell mangoes. They purchase mango contracts from fellow villagers before the harvest season and when the mangoes grow they transport them to sell in Phnom Penh market. 

The couple hopes to expand their business, so Sochenda is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase additional mangoes.

loans.use: To purchase mango under contract for resale

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen vive  en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, Perú. Ella tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos.  Carmen trabaja en el horno “panificadora Sota” como ayudante del maestro panadero y su horario de trabajo es a partir de la una de la madrugada hasta las una de la tarde del día siguiente.  Ya son dos años que trabaja en el horno y le va muy bien.  Carmen nos cuenta que tiene un pequeño negocio independiente que consiste en la crianza de animales menores como gallinas de doble pechuga pero necesita incrementar un poco más el capital de negocio.  En esta oportunidad Carmen requiere el micro crédito para comprar más gallinas. 

Carmen pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Carmen lives in the city of Oropesa, province of Cusco, Peru. She is 42 years old, married and has two children. Carmen works at the "panificadora Sota" bake shop as an assistant to the master baker, and she works from 1 a.m. until 1 p.m. She has worked at the bakery for two years and it is going very well. Carmen tells us that she has an independent small business raising small animals like double-breasted chickens, but she needs to raise a little more capital for it. She is requesting the loan to buy more chickens. Carmen belongs to the "Ricchariy Puririsun" community bank through Kiva partner Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity provided through this medium and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase more chickens

loans.name: Heidy

texts.en:
Heidy is a 45-year old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  a sari-sari (general) store and farming.  She lives in the municipality of Quezon, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000. Heidy is borrowing PHP 15,000 to purchase more stock to sell.  This will be her eighth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Heidy aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah, 30 years old, is a married woman who lives in the town of San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She has 5 children, the oldest of whom is 8 years old.

Leah is engaged in farming. Her husband, who is also a farmer, does the major farming duties. She also helps in weeding and keeping the crops healthy. Leah sells their harvest to the market where there is more access to customers. Their rice farm currently needs fertilizers and other farm inputs. Leah applied for a loan of 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) that she will use to fund their farm.

Leah does her best to help sustain her family. She takes good care of her young children and makes sure they are healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase farm fertilizers and other inputs

loans.name: Islam

texts.en:
Islam I. is 38 years old, married, and has two children. He sells cattle. As a rule, Islam purchases small cattle in the central market, feeds them, and than resells them at higher prices in the local market. Being in this business for seven years, he knows how to choose the animals, how to breed them, and how to look after them. Islam gets up every morning in order to feed the animals and to look after them. His knowledge and skills allow him to make his business successful and to generate a stable, considerable income for his large family. 

Islam is planning to enlarge his stock and purchase more cattle. For this purpose, he is requesting a loan for 1,000 AZN, which he will use to purchase young cattle and feed for them.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and fodder

loans.name: Saoudata

texts.fr:
Saoudata est une femme qui habite au secteur 06 de Ouagadougou Burkina faso.Elle a 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 12ans et le moins âgé a 07 ans. Deux (02) enfants  vont à l’école. Elle a quatre personnes en charge: ses 03 enfants plus sa sœur.

saoudata mène une activité de restauration (soupe de  viande de bœuf, de poisson etc.) depuis quatre ans Elle s’approvisionne au marché de zabré daaga en ville. Ses clients sont ses voisins du quartier et les fonctionnaires. 

Avec l’argent octroyé, elle veut s’acheter un congélateur pour la bonne conservation de sa viande, et 15 kilogrammes de viande
 
saoudata a pour ambition de bien embellir son  hangar, mettre des ventilateurs  et  préparer la soupe a tout moment. Elle veut réfectionner sa maison quand il pleut, l’eau rentre par le toît.
texts.en:
Saoudata is a woman who lives in Sector 6 of Ouagadougou, Burkina Faso. She has 3 children. The oldest is 12 and the youngest is 7. Two of her children go to school. She takes care of 4 people: her 3 children plus her sister.
Sadouata has been running a restaurant business selling beef stew, fish stew, and other types for the past 4 years. She purchases her supplies at the Zabré market in the city. Her clients are her neighbors, as well as civil servants.
With the loaned money, she wants to buy a freezer to keep her meat fresh and 15 kilograms of meat.
In the future, Sadiouata would like to improve her restaurant's porch by installing fans, and to be able to prepare stew at all hours of the day. She would also like to improve her home's roof because water comes in during the rainy season.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to conserve meat for her restaurant

loans.name: Olga

texts.ru:
Ольга Cмоленская родилась в городе Бишкек, Кыргызстан. Ей 56 лет. В 1973 году, окончив среднюю школу, Ольга поступила в училище на курсы бухгалтеров, а после, в 1983 году, она стала студенткой факультета русского языка и литературы Гуманитарного Института. На последнем курсе института Ольга вышла замуж, ее сыновья родились один за другим.  В 1977 году, окончив институт, Ольга была направлена работать в Лицей преподавателем русского языка в село Боролдой. Проработав более 6 лет Ольга, решила не возвращаться в город Бишкек и обустроить свою жизнь в селе. Несмотря на то, что семья Ольги была городскими жителями,  перебравшись в сельскую местность, они понемногу обзавелись хозяйством - купили телочку, затем корову, возделывали небольшую земельную долю, которую сельская администрация выделила для выращивания своих кормов.  2004 год стал для Ольги тяжелым временем – умер ее старший сын, а затем, некоторое время спустя, от сердечного приступа умер ее муж. За небольшое время Ольга перенесла самые большие потери в своей жизни, потеряв родных ей людей. После гибели сына и мужа Ольга долгое время не могла прийти в себя, но нашла в себе силы для преподавания в Лицее, ставшее большим стимулом для дальнейшей жизни.  
В январе 2010 года Ольга  впервые обратилась в компанию «Бай Тушум и Партнеры» и получила свой первый  кредит в размере 30, 000 сом (KGS), который помог ей приобрести скот. В настоящее время у Ольги в хозяйстве содержится две коровы. Сейчас Ольга планирует взять второй кредит в сумме 60, 000 сом (KGS) на дополнительное расширение поголовья скота. 
Ольга верит, что ее воспитанники достигнут высот в жизни и станут одними из самых  выдающихся деятелей. 
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en:
Olga S. was born in the city of Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan. She is 56 years old. In 1973, after graduating from high school, Olga entered accounting school.  Later, in 1983, she started studying Russian Language and Literature at the Institute of the Humanities.  In her senior year, Olga married and her sons were born one after another.  In 1987, after she graduated, Olga was sent to teach Russian in Boroldoy villiage.  After working there for more than six years, Olga decided not to return to Bishkek but to live in the village. In spite of the fact that Olga's family was city dwellers, once they got to the country they built themselves a family farm.  They bought a calf, then a cow, and they cultivated a small plot of land that the rural administration has allocated for growing feed. 

Olga’s hardest time was 2004.  Her eldest son died, and then a bit later, her husband died of a heart attack. In a short time Olga lost two of the closest people in her life.  After her son and husband died, Olga found herself unable to function.  Eventually, her teaching work gave her reason to continue living. 
In January, 2010 Olga applied for her first loan from Bai Tushun and Partners, and received 30,000 som (KGS) which she used to buy cattle. Now Olga’s family farm contains two cows. Olga plans to take out a second loan for 60,000 som (KGS) to further expand her herd.

Olga believes that her students will attain greatness in life and become some of the world’s most outstanding figures.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to  purchase cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, paint and windows for house construction

loans.name: Doris Mariela

texts.es:
Doris de 38 años, vive en una zona peri-urbana en la Perimetral. Es separada y tiene 3 hijos que estudian en escuelas fiscales. Vende productos de bellezas y ropa por catalogo.

Comenzó hace varios años en la venta de ropa y comesticos por catalogo y fue así como poco a poco fue arreglando su vivienda. Ella labora todos los días recorriendo por su sector haciendo promoción a sus productos a amigos y familiares. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere compras mas productos de belleza como cosméticos perfumes y adecuar su vivienda. Ella anhela terminar su casa hacela de dos piso y que sus hijos pueda terminar una carrera que sean unos profesionales.
texts.en:
Doris, 28, lives in a periurban zone in La Perimetral.  She’s separated and has three children who go to public school.  She sells beauty products and clothes via catalogue.

She started selling clothes and cosmetics via catalogue several years ago and this is how she was able to gradually fix up her house.  She works every day going through her neighborhood promoting her products among friends and relatives.  

With the loan’s help she wants to buy more beauty products like perfume and to furnish her house.  She dreams with finishing her house and adding a second floor and that her children complete careers and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and home decorations.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is divorced and is raising her son, Edward. She is an entrepreneur from Kahovka, Ukraine, where she runs her women's clothing business in the city market. Valentina started her business four years ago because need forced her to support her family and find ways to provide for her son and herself. Today her turnover capital is about 25,000 UAH. Net profit is about 5,000 UAH each month.

Valentina is a determined entrepreneur. She knows how to set goals and achieve them. Today, she is requesting a loan for 10,000 Grivnas to purchase women’s T-shirts, blouses and pants to generate additional profit which will allow her to feel more financially secure.

loans.use: to purchase women’s t-shirts, blouses and pants for retail sale

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is 40 years old and married with four children: three sons and a daughter.  Only her daughter is able to get an education. Her eldest son has a clothes selling business and her second son sells CDs and DVDs. Her husband has a welding business. He provides spare parts, repair and iron welding services to his clients at cheap rates. 

Shazia is very supportive and knows that alone her husband is unable to meet the financial requirements of his family. That’s why she sews clothes for her neighboring customers. She is very skillful and earns a reasonably good income from her business. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her husband’s welding business. With the loan, he will buy a welding machine that will allow him to provide better quality services to his customers and earn more profits. He is experienced in his work and has been operating his business for the past 30 years. Shazia is hopeful that a loan will bring more profits to him and improve her family’s financial conditions.  She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In the previous loan year, she established good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Shazia.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 24 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married and a mother of one infant-age child.

Analyn has a small market at home to make a living. She sells assorted food items and refreshments .Analyn established her business for over four years. She earns PHP 4,000 every month from this business. Analyn has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 at GDMPC to purchase refreshments to sell.

Analyn has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Analyn hopes to own another store in her town.

loans.use: To purchase refreshments to sell.

loans.name: Nakaseeta Savings And Credit Group

texts.en:
Thirty-seven-year-old level-headed Christine is not your run-of-the-mill type of retail business woman. She has for the last 16 years showed forth diligence, determination, perseverance and tenacity in a predominantly male-dominated business setting. By doing that, she has made lots of headway, notwithstanding some drawbacks. Her diligence has been of vital consequence. Hard work to her has meant always being at the beck and call of her clients, listening to their needs and always solving the issues that come forth with fortitude and courage.  Christine has seen the inside lane of success and has also borne witness to failure. The happily married mother of 5 says it has all been worthwhile. 

Christine operates from Mityana. She set forth in this retail trade with savings from her farming business. She still does the farming and says it’s her second business. Weekly, her retail trade transactions generate her gross sales profits totaling up to 90,000 Ugandan shillings.

She says she will use her potion of this Kiva loan to purchase more retail commodities such as sugar, soap, cooking oil, maize flour, plastics, etc. to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities such as sugar, soap,cooking oil, maize flour, plastics, etc. to resell

loans.name: Munkhjargal

texts.en:
Munkhjargal works as a pastry chef at local food manufacturing company in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She is 42 years old and lives with her mother and elder sister, both of whom are retired. Munkhjargal graduated from the Polytechnic University in Russia where she specialized in tailoring. She also obtained a bachelors degree as a food technologist from the Institute of Commerce and Business in 2011. 

Munkhjargal’s family lives in a small house which needs repair and reconstruction. She is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to purchase necessary building materials to fix and renovate the interior structure of the building and install a new iron stove. 

Munkhjargal is a punctual and hardworking woman who is a trusted client of our institute. By obtaining this loan, she will improve the condition of her house and create a place that her family can enjoy.

loans.use: to purchase building materials to renovate her home and install an iron stove

loans.name: Suzan

texts.en:
Suzan is a 24-year-old woman from Madaba, Jordan.

Suzan has her own grocery store and she makes sherak bread, a kind of traditionA. bread in Jordan.

Suzan is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase products for her store and some flour. She is looking to license her store and establish a place for doing the sherak bread.

Due to culturA. issues Suzan refused to publish her picture. thus, the woman in the picture is her uncle's wife.

loans.use: to purchase products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Mira

texts.en:
Mira is 32 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 15 and 13. In 2001, she established her tailoring business. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring business. In the future, Mira plans to expand the business. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines. These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children, as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal. With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional fabric or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buy raw materials

loans.name: Santiago De Gualaceo (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Santiago de Gualaceo está conformado por 8 mujeres y un hombre, quienes son amigos y vecinos, son personas M. carismáticas y amables que mantienen la tradición y cultura de sus padres, laboran en diferentes actividades económicas las mismas que les permiten solventar los gastos de sus hogares. Viven en el cantón de Gualaceo, este lugar es de clima templado, su arquitectura se mezcla entre lo moderno y lo antigua, su gente se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías o al comercio en general y su gastronomía es M. variada.  

Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la Sra. María Betty vive por el cantón Gualaceo y se dedica a la venta de comida.
 
Nuestra socia tiene 51 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos  de 30 y 20 años de edad quienes son casados e independientes. Su esposo labora en la agricultura, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando en este cantón.

La jornada de Doña María Betty empieza su labor a las 3 de la mañana ya que se levanta a preparar sus productos, empieza  la venta a las 6 de la mañana y termina a las 2 de la tarde, luego arregla los utensilios y adelanta un poco para la jornada del siguiente día. Lleva en el negocio 6 meses y labora de lunes a viernes, los fines de semana labora como cocinera en un restaurante del lugar.

Se encuentra en su primer crédito y lo va a invertir para comprar víveres para continuar con su negocio.
 
Su meta es ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
The community bank Santiago de Gualaceo is comprised of 8 women and one man who are friends and neighbors. They are very charismatic and kind people who keep up the traditions and culture of their parents. The work in different trades that enable them to pay their household expenses. They live in the canton of Gualaceo, which is a place with a temperate climate and architecture which is a mix of the modern and the ancient. The people there work creating crafts or in general commerce and the cuisine is very varied. 
One of the members of this group is María Betty. She lives in the canton of Gualaceo and works selling food.
This member or the bank is 51 years old, married, and has 2 children of 30 and 20 years of age who are married and independent. Her husband works in agriculture. They don't have their own house so they rent a place in town.
María Betty begins her work at 3 in the morning when she gets up to prepare her products. She starts selling at 6 in the morning and finishes at 2 in the afternoon. Later she clears up the utensils and gets ready a little for the following day. She has been running this business for 6 months and works from Monday to Friday. At the weekends, she works as a cook in a restaurant. 
This is her first loan and she will use it to buy groceries so she can continue with her business. 
Her goal is to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Marina has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, beverages & vegetable like sayote. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & vegetables for sell.

Marina is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Marina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & vegetables to sell

loans.name: Jumagul's Group

texts.en:
Jumagul is the leader of this group. She is 44 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband she is bringing up three sons and two daughters. The daughters study at school, two sons work in construction and the third son works in Russia. 

Jumagul is engaged in cattle breeding, after her marriage the parents presented her with a calf and since that time she has been breeding cattle. At the moment she is applying for a loan because she needs money to finish her house construction. With money received from the loan she will purchase building materials. 

In the near future she plans to expand her cattle breeding business and also build a new shed to keep cattle. 

---Where Did This Loan Come From?---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line–People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team-Supporters of Kyrgyzstan–Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase building materials

loans.name: Leseyio

texts.en:
Leseyio is 34 years old, married and blessed with four children. He is a livestock trader and has been doing this for the last five years. 

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area. He is a good client and this will be his first loan which he is planning to use to buy more livestock. He hopes to use the profit from this loan venture into farming to educate his children.

His dream is to become a large scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land. He is a finicky man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Ramadan

texts.en:
Ramadan is a 34-year-old married man and father of two children. Ramadan has 25 years of experience in the bakery business. This long experience has given him broad talent to blend new tastes and recipes. He was only 14 years old when he opened his own bakery. It was hard for a young boy to start a business so early, but he had a big family to take care of since he was young.

Ramadan works hard to prevent his children from living his miserable childhood, which is why he tries to improve his business as much as he can.  To continue to develop his business, Ramadan requested a loan from Kiva partner A. Majmoua in order to do necessary maintenance on his shop and on the main oven, in addition to buying necessary raw materials such as oil, flour, and cheese at speciA. wholesale prices.

Ramadan hopes to move his bakery to a wider space, although the present one is located in a high population area, which helps greatly to continually improve business.

loans.use: to do necessary maintenance to his shop.

loans.name: Dashzeveg

texts.en:
Dashzeveg is 38 years old and lives with his wife and four kids in a Mongolian ger in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His wife is an enterpruener and his kids are school students.

He started his dairy products selling business in 1990 with just one cow. Now he owns seven cows and makes various kinds of products. Because his business has been doing so well, he can hardly meet the demands of his customers. As a result, he is requesting a loan in the amount of 2,500,000 MNT to buy two more cows.

He explains that he is a strong and diligent man who will do everything he can in order to educate his children because he does not want them to grow up as he did.

loans.use: To purchase two additional cows

loans.name: Maria De La Concepcion

texts.es: María, de 33 años de edad, casada, tiene tres hijos pequeños de 16,13y 12 años de edad, están estudiando la secundaria , ella es comerciante , tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación, su esposo trabaja en Costa Rica el cual le ayuda con las remesas que le manda mensual. Ella inicio su negocio con esfuerzos propios cuando ella se fue a trabajar a Costa Rica pero se tuvo que regresar porque no podía descuidar a sus hijos pero con lo poco que ahorro compro una refrigeradora empezó vendiendo helados de sabores, gaseosas a medida que su negocio fue creciendo fue invirtiendo en comprar otros tipos de productos tales como dulces, pan, productos de limpieza, sopas para vender la  ido muy bien. Hoy en día tiene 5 años con su pulpería que se ha ido levantando poco a poco. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, cosméticos, enlatados, pan. Estos son parte de los productos que no tiene y sus clientes buscan a diario y con la inversión podrá adquirirlos más fácilmente y así mejorar sus ventas, suplir necesidades de su zona. Ella esta muy enfocada en salir adelante con su negocio para que sus hijos tengan un mejor nivel de vida y tengan educación escolar. Una de sus expectativas es convertir su pulpería en una miscelánea.
texts.en:
María, 33, is married and has three young children, ages 16, 13, and 12.  They are in secondary school.  She is a merchant; she has a grocery store in her home.  Her husband works in Costa Rica, which helps her because of the monthly remittances he sends her.

She began her business with her own efforts when she went to Costa Rica to work, but she had to return because she couldn't neglect her children.  With her small savings she bought a refrigerator and began selling flavored ice cream and sodas, and as her business grew she invested in buying other types of products to sell, such as sweets, bread, cleaning products, and soup.  It has gone very well for her.  Today she has had her store for five years, and little by little she has gotten back on her feet.

She needs the loan to buy rice, sugar, oil, cosmetics, canned goods, and bread.  These are some of the products she doesn't have that her customers look for daily.  With the investment she will be able to get them more easily and so improve her sales and stock the necessities of her area.

María is very focused on getting ahead with her business so her children will have a better quality of life and an education.  One of her expectations is to convert her grocery store into a small general store.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, cosmetics, canned goods, and bread.

loans.name: Mayra Jacinta

texts.es:
Mayra es una mujer de 28 años que tiene dos hijos, uno de 5 y otro de 11 años. Juntos viven en la Cooperativa Santa Martha de la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas en el Ecuador. Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas es una provincia nueva, que era parroquia rural de Quito (capital del país); está entre la costa y la sierra del Ecuador, punto de enlace entre Quito, Guayaquil, Portoviejo,  y otras ciudades importantes. Situado en los flancos externos de la cordillera occidental, así como en la planicie costeña inferior a los 1000 msnm, es la zona de mayor pluviosidad del país. Tiene una gran riqueza hidrológica: existen cinco cuencas y micro cuencas importantes. Es una zona climática lluviosa subtropical, posee una temperatura promedio de 22 °C.

Ella es propietaria de un pequeño negocio de comida rápida, la mejora de la vialidad en esta provincia le ha beneficiado ya que ahora mucha gente visita el sector donde realiza sus ventas. Vende hamburguesas y papas fritas y ella está en búsqueda de un crédito para así ampliar su negocio y tener mejores ganancias; Mayra quiere comprar un coche para preparar su comida y así poder movilizarse y tener más ventas.

Sus pequeños hijos le ayudan durante su jornada de trabajo y juntos quieren hacer realidad sus sueños que son el tener un local de comida grande, amplio y con varias sucursales. De esta manera sus hijos podrán tener su estudio seguro y una calidad de vida mejor.
texts.en:
Mayra is a 28 year-old woman who has 2 children aged 5 and 11.  They live together in the Santa Martha Cooperative in the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas in Ecuador.  Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas is a new province, that was previously a rural parish of Quito (the capital of the country).  It lies between the coast and the mountains of Ecuador, a connecting point between Quito, Guayquil, Portoviejo and other important cities. It is situated on the outer edges of the western mountains and in the lower coastal plain at 1000 meters above sea level. This area has the highest rainfall in the country. There is a great abundance of water as there are 5 important river basins and micro basins here. It is a rainy, subtropical zone and the average temperature is 22 °C. 

Mayra is the owner of a small fast food business. She has benefited from the improvement of the roads in this province, because now many people visit the area where she makes her sales.  She sells hamburgers and french fries, and she is seeking a loan to expand her business so that she can have better earnings.  Mayra wants to buy a fast food cart where she could prepare her food and also move around to get more sales.  

Her small children help her during her working day, and together they want to make her dreams a reality; she dreams of having a big restaurant with a lot of branches.  In this way her children will be able to count on getting an education and will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a fast food cart

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty, aged twenty-four, lives in Masindi, Uganda.  She has one child and deals in a produce and spare bicycle parts business.  She desires to educate her children, save for a wedding, move her business to more permanent location and hire employees to help expand her business.  She wants a loan to buy beans, groundnuts and rice for resale.

loans.use: to buy beans, groundnuts and rice for resale.

loans.name: San Rafael Group

texts.es:
El comité san rafael es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, está integrado por 14 mujeres, todas ellas son amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. Ellas se unieron gracias a su espíritu de lucha, ya que vieron en el programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación una gran oportunidad para salir delante y ayudar a sus familias.
Honoria es una de las miembros, quien dice que empieza a trabajar desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana, comenta que su despensa recibe a los clientes desde muy tempranas horas. Nos cuenta que su negocio le tare buenos ingresos por que la mayoría de sus vecinos compran de ella. Uno de sus sueños es poder seguir creciendo y tener una mayor ganancia para poder ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para abastecer su negocio con productos de primera necesidad, como ser azúcar, fideos, arroz, yerba y demás. Agradece a la fundación por esta oportunidad que le da.
texts.en:
The communal bank "San Rafael" is located in the city of Curuguaty and comprised of 14 women who are friends and neighbors there.  They formed a group because of their common fighting spirit since they saw that the Fundación offered a women's program and a great opportunity to get ahead so they could help their families.

Honoria is one of the members.  She says she begins work very early in the morning when she receives her first customers.  Her business provides a good income since most of her neighbors buy from her.  One of her goals is to keep growing and earn even more money to support her family.

She is requesting a loan to stock her store with essential goods such as sugar, pasta, rice, herbs and other items.  She is grateful to the Fundación for this opportunity.

loans.use: To buy pasta, rice, herbs and other items.

loans.name: Maxrug

texts.ru: Maxrug 37 let. Ona zamujem i imeyet 2 detey. Maxrug yavlyayetya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione posolok Makhmudlu vmeste so svoim lubimim mujem i detmi. Ona uje 8 let kak zanimayetsya pticevodstvom i razvodit kuric. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit kuricci dlya  uvelicheniya kolichestva i razvitiya biznessa.
texts.en: Maxrug is 37 years old. She is married and has two children. Maxrug is a displaced person, a migrant from the city of Fuzuli. She now lives in the settlement of Makhmudu in the Fuzuli district together with her husband and children. She has been raising chickens for 8 years. She needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy chickens to increase her flock and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es: Zulma tiene una tienda de barrio donde vende golosinas y productos de primera necesidad para el hogar. El crédito lo requiere para aumento de capital ya que abrirá una carnicería y para lo mismo necesita comprar una maquina cortadora. Zulma es soltera y no tiene hijos. Vive en casa de sus padres  la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Los Pinos de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la primera  vez que trabaja junto a Impro y Kiva.
texts.en: Zulma has a neighborhood store where she sells snacks and basic staple items for the home.  She needs the loan to increase capital because she will open a butcher shop and needs to buy a cutting machine.  Zulma is single and has no children.  She lives in her parents’ house located in the city of La Paz’s Los Pinos zone.  This is the first time she’s worked with Impro and with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a meat cutting machine because she intends to add meat sales to her grocery store.

loans.name: Benkadi  Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les  8 membres du groupe  BENKADI II  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BENEKO, un des villages de OUELESSEBOUGOU, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec   SIRABA , debout au milieu des 2 assises.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de OUELESSEBOUGOU, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Frais de labour, achat d’intrants et  de semence

loans.name: Djlomahuton Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DJLOMAHUTON est composé de quatre personnes qui vendent dans un même marché. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Léonie (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 45 ans est mariée à un certain Francis. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Léonie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. Léonie a très peu fréquenté l’école. Pour participer aux besoins de sa famille, Léonie vend des liqueurs et divers produits dans sa boutique depuis quinze ans environ. De façon secondaire, Léonie vend également des tissus et des chaussures par la technique de distribution. Léonie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et à Lomé au TOGO. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Léonie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DJLOMAHUTON un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits précédemment reçus ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des tissus et des chaussures.

loans.name: Miwanonvi Group
