texts.fr: Le groupe MIWANONVI est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Elisabeth (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 37 ans. Elisabeth n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Elisabeth est mariée à un matelassier du nom de Toussaint. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et deux à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Elisabeth et son mari. Pour cette raison, Elisabeth vend de la nourriture et du charbon de bois à son domicile depuis douze ans. De façon secondaire, Elisabeth vend aussi des boissons, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Elisabeth s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Elisabeth sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe MIWANONVI, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter du charbon de bois et de l'huile végétale.

loans.name: Wilfredo José

texts.es:
El señor Wilfredo José, es padre soltero de 2  hijos de los cuales estan bajo su tutela y en edad escolar,se dedica al comercio desde hace 4 años, posee una pulpería en su casa de habitación, el realiza esta labor para la solventar los gastos del hogar y así tener un mejor nivel junto a sus hijos.     

El señor Wilfredo, solicito a Ceprodel un crédito el que utilizo en la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, jabón, gaseosas y jugos al por mayor, lo que le permitirá incrementar su inventario y capital de trabajo con variedad de productos y así poder ofertar a su clientela productos de mayor calidad

loans.use: Compra de  arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, jabón, gaseosas y jugos al por mayor

loans.name: Asep

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Asep, one of Ruma's agents. He lives in East Serang, a semi-urban area located about three hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his family.

Asep is a young man who has big ambition to become an entrepreneur. He sells mobile airtime credits to his community. Asep wanted to join Ruma because he wants to learn about how to improve his business, as well as how to give more contribution to his community. He feels happy as well because the sales executive is being kind and helpful to him.

As the business grows, Asep is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community, especially on weekends. Your loan will be very useful to help him improve his business and, accordingly, his community, which needs access to such services. Asep is the one who is seen in the photo. He will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: buy mobile airtime credits to sell.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by ten members of the Gouye Ngalla association, represented by Mamadou T.. Nder is a tiny farming village on the southern edge of the Sahara desert, whose colorful history as the capital of the ancient Wolof kingdom of Walo is still celebrated in Senegalese folklore. In this arid region, profitable cultivation of Nder’s main crops of yams and peanuts relies on irrigation, but capital for investment in irrigation pumps has always been scarce. The Gouye Ngalla association therefore submitted the following application for a microfinance loan:

“The state having established a general support framework for community development associations since the 1960’s, our group quickly realized that grassroots community development will not be a reality unless our members are effectively mobilized and organized for this purpose. Taking into account the extremely difficult socioeconomic context characterized by: 1) migration out of rural areas due to the lack of promising local development alternatives, and 2) The absence in the Diéri zone of any hydro-agricultural system established by the state or managed by the local government, the group rolled up our sleeves and decided to rely on our own efforts and on those of our strategic partners in order to achieve our goals.

The purpose of this loan is to provide the members of the group with a motorized irrigation pump with a capacity of 300m3/hour, which can irrigate 10 hectares of fields and will be managed by a pump attendant who will ensure its maintenance and proper functioning.

The team responsible for this project will keep track of its progress and will begin to repay the loan without difficulty as soon as the first harvests begin.”

Original French :

«L’état ayant défini le cadre général d’intervention des associations de développement depuis les années 1960, à cet effet le groupement a vite compris que le développement à la base ne sera une réalité que si les membres ne seront fortement mobilisés en s’organisant en conséquence.

Compte tenu du contexte socio économique très difficile marqué essentiellement par :

• L’exode rural faute d’alternative de développement endogène prometteuse.

• Absence d’aménagement hydro agricole conçu par l’état et géré par les sociétés d’encadrement dans la zone du Diéri ; le groupement s’est retroussé les manches, pour compter sur ses efforts propres et sur ceux de ses partenaires stratégiques pour atteindre l’objectif qu’il s’est assigné.

Objectif du Prêt :

Il s’agit de mettre à la disposition des membres du groupement un groupe moto pompe d’une capacité de 300m3/heure pouvant irrigué 10 ha de culture et sera géré par un pompiste qui assurera l’entretien et le fonctionnement.

Pour le Remboursement :

L’équipe de suivi du projet fera des descentes dans tous les projets et dès la fin des premiers récolte commencera à faire le recouvrement des crédits sans difficulté.»

Background :

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, which provide the rural poor throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these groups are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional associations from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works with our partner organization CRESP to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Irrigation pump purchase

loans.name: Latifah

texts.en: Latifah is a 25 year old mother of one child. She used to help her husband selling kerosene and motor oil in their small garage. She needs this loan to buy more kerosene, motor oil and some snacks that she will sell from her house. Her husband, Suryadi, works as a factory labourer.

loans.use: Capital to start her business

loans.name: Lidia Carmela

texts.en:
Lidia is a 34-year-old married mother of three. For the past two years, she has been active in the sale of clothing for children, women and men. Once a month she travels to the city of Tuxtla G. (about a four-hour trip on the highway) to buy merchandise, which she resells in her store or fulfills orders from the inland communities of her region. She will use her loan to invest in expanding her business with more merchandise. She belongs to the Santa Lucia 4 group.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

LIDIA TIENE 34 AÑOS, CASADA, TRES HIJOS. DESDE HACE DOS AÑOS SE DEDICA ALA VENTA DE ROPA PARA NIÑOS, MUJERES Y CABALLEROS. UNA VEZ AL MES VIAJA A LA CIUDAD DE TUXTLA G. (QUEDA A CUATRO HORAS DE VIAJE POR CARRETERA) A COMPRAR MERCANCIA, LA CUAL VENDE EN SU TIENDA Y A PEDIDO A LAS COMUNIDADES INTERIORES DE SU ZONA. SU PRESTAMO LO INVERTIRA EN AMPLIAR SU NEGOCIO CON MAS MERCANCIA. PERTENECE AL GRUPO SANTA LUCIA 4.

loans.use: Merchant

loans.name: Micha Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta is 41 years old and lives on a quiet street in Ayacucho, Peru, with her children. Every day, she commutes an hour on the bus to a bustling street corner where she sells “anticuchos”, which are grilled cow hearts, served with potatoes and corn. Her food is very well known, and many of her loyal customers visit her every day for this Peruvian delicacy.

Alberta is a “madre soltera,” a single mother of 5, who was abandoned by her husband 11 years ago. She has since had to rely on this small business to provide for her family. She is currently saving to buy land with space for a house and her business, so she will not have to work in the street anymore. Alberta hopes to receive a loan of US $300, which she will use to purchase materials for her business and then use the increased profits to contribute to her savings.

loans.use: purchase raw materials for her food business

loans.name: Gracia

texts.es:
Gracia, 42, is originally from Tampico [in the northeastern Mexican state of] Tamaulipas. She's married and has three children, a 23-year-old and 21-year-old twins. Her husband is a construction worker. Graciela started her business two years ago so her children could continue their education. She initially sold costume jewelry, then added second-hand clothing and now she's established in the "mercados rodantes"--a kind of temporary street market--where her sales improve with each passing day. Graciela's strong character has helped her to provide a good service to her customers and to build her business.

Graciela is now asking for a US$275 loan that she promises to repay in 4 months. She'll use it to buy more merchandise to cover demand from her customers. Now is the time to help those most in need. Make the decision to help this family and contribute to the development of her business. Thanks very much.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Gracia tiene 42 años de edad, es originaria de la localidad de Tampico, Tamaulipas, está casada y tiene tres hijos, de 23 y unos gemelos de 21 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja en la construcción y para que sus hijos pudieran continuar sus estudios Gracia emprendió su negocio hace dos años, inició con la venta de bisutería y poco después incorporó la venta de ropa usada, ahora se instala en los mercados rodantes y sus ventas mejoran día con día, el carácter de Gracia le ha ayudado a brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes y a hacer crecer su negocio.

En estos momentos Gracia está solicitando un préstamo de $ 275 dólares que se compromete a regresar en 4 meses, con lo que podrá adquirir más mercancía para cubrir las demandas de sus clientes y continuar con su preferencia. Hoy es momento de ayudar a quien mas lo necesita, decídete a apoyar a esta familia, contribuyendo al desarrollo de su negocio, muchas gracias.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Mammadkhan

texts.en:
Mammadkhan Suleymanova is a 32-year-old farmer who owns a sheep herd in the southern Azerbaijani region of Bilasuvar. He is an internally displaced person from the Jabrail region who fled to Bilasuvar during Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993. Mammadkhan is married and has four daughters. Since he and his wife are unemployed, selling sheep is the only  source of income in his family. Mutton is in very high demand all across Azerbaijan and people use meat in their daily life. During all summer Mammadkhan grazes his herd on the mountain. He lives on mountain alone from June to August. During those three months the sheep are getting fat and they can be sold for a higher price than they were purchased. 
Mammadkhan works very hard to cover all his family's  needs. However it is getting harder to keep such a big family each year. Now he has decided to establish financial income for  his family and increase the number of sheep in his herd. For this purpose he has applied for 600 USD. He is going to purchase 12 baby sheep for estimated cost 50 USD.

loans.use: Going to purchase 12 sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: More merchandise for her little store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his watch repair business

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en: Mrs. Sorn S. is 33 years old and married with three school age children. She runs a stand at her home selling coconuts to the people in her community, earning around $1.50 of profit per day. Mrs. Sorn S. is  requesting a loan amount of $500 to purchase a motorcycle for her unemployed husband so he can start a motor-taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her unemployed husband to start a motor-taxi business.

loans.name: Astolfo

texts.es:
Mr. Astolfo is 48-years-old, and he is an independent worker (running wood). Nevertheless, he saw the need to buy some land in which he would like to locate a fuel supplier and a parts replacement sale stand. The area where the land is located is very commercial and strategically placed. With your contribution, this industrious parent will have the possibility to make his dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Astolfo de 48 años de edad, es trabajador independiente(corredor de madera), sin embargo tiene la necesidad de comprarse un terreno que ha ido revisando durante mucho para ubicar en este lugar un abastecedor de combustible y un stand de venta de repuestos, debido a que la zona es muy comercial y está muy bien ubicada. Con tu importante contribución este trabajador padre hará realidad sus propósitos.

loans.use: To Buy land and parts to repair vehicles

loans.name: Kol

texts.en:
Mrs. Kol P., 21, is a grocer and farmer who earn about $2.50 per day. She lives with her husband, Chhorn Kim Non, her only child, and her parents in the Kanher Baydach Village, Pursat Province. Kim Non makes $2.50 per day transporting merchandise to the Pursat Market.

P. requests a $600 loan to purchase small pigs to raise and to buy a used motorcycle. This will make it easier and more economical for her husband to transport goods to the market, thus increasing their income. P.’s mother is pictured in the photo because P. and her husband were not available at the time.

loans.use: To purchase small pigs to raise, and a used motorcycle

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
Haydee is a woman who works a lot in order to achieve improvements in her life. She decided to live in the land of her parents (and her childhood home) and is trying to reconstruct it better for her children. Actually, she is dedicated to the work of growing fodder in order to grow food for her animals. She also grows potatoes,barley, wheat, corn, and vicias (a food especially for animals.) The fodder that seh grows is used to feed hogs and rabbits. She is requesting a loan to better improve her conditions of growing her products and for growing fodder for her animals.

This story has been translated from Spanish to English by Nikita Ramchandani, KIVA Volunteer.

Haydee, es una mujer de mucho trabajo para lograr mejoras en su vida, ha decidido vivir en la tierra de sus padres y de ella misma con muchos esfuerzo construir un futuro mejor para sus hijos.Actualmente se dedica al cultivo de forraje para el alimento de sus animales, también cultiva papa, cebada, trigo, maíz y vicias (un tipo de forraje especial para sus animales). El forraje que ella cultiva le sirve apara alimentar a los cerdos, cuyes y conejos.La solicitud de un préstamo es para mejorar las condiciones de siembra de sus productos y también del forraje para sus animalitos.

loans.use: To buy Seeds

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Mr. K. Kodjo was born the 30 of March, 1981 in Lomé. He is single and is a clothing retailer in the neighbourhood of Adidogomé in Lomé. In 2005 he opened a drycleaning store called ETS EL DORADO. He is only person to open a store in this neighbourhood. His principal clients are students and civil servants. This first loan will allow him to buy a washing machine, 60 outfits for women and 170 bags of mineral water.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur K. Kodjo est né le 30 mars 1981 à Lomé. Il est célibataire et est un revendeur d’habits dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé. En 2005 il a ouvert un magasin de lavage à sec (ETS EL DORADO). Il est le seul à ouvert ce magasin dans ce quartier et ses principaux clients sont les élèves, étudiants et fonctionnaires. Le premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acquérir une machine à laver, 60 habits de femmes et 170 sachets d’eau minérale.

loans.use: buying washing machine and clothing outfits

loans.name: Ki

texts.en: Mrs. Ki M. is a villager in Ta Yuos Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a subsistence farmer. Mrs. Ki M. is a 41 year old widow with three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the youngest one is enrolled in school. All family members currently live in an old house, thus, Mrs. Ki M. decided to request a loan to build a new house. Previously, Mrs. Ki M. obtained a loan from AMK to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.use: To build a new house.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 33 years. She is married with three children between the ages of twelve and six. She became a clothing and cosmetics seller in 2004. Every day she works from 8am to 7pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Faith now hopes for a loan to buy more clothing (vitenge) and cosmetic items for her business to increase sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothing and cosmetic items to increase her stock.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda is single, she is 28 years old, she lives alone with her 4 year old daughter. She is a hardworking woman with great dreams of improving her economic situation to meet the expenses of her small daughter and of her parents, who 40 years ago gave her the gift of life. Yolanda is originally from the city of Cuzco. Lack of opportunities for work made her leave her city of birth and relocate to Juliaca. Since then, she has been selling a variety of mattresses, a business that in the beginning didn’t appear to be profitable, but with effort, dedication and a lot of hard work she was able to grow her business. Today she has a sales stand on one of the busiest commercial streets in Juliaca. The wish of this diligent woman is to increase capital to invest in her business, and she is sure that with your help she will be able to do so, so that in the near future she can expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Yolanda es soltera, tiene 28 años, vive sola con su pequeña de 4 años. Es una mujer emprendedora con grandes ilusiones de mejorar su situación económica para solventar los gastos de su pequeña hija y la de sus queridos padres, quienes hace más de 40 años le concedieron el regalo de brindarle la vida.Yolanda es natural de la ciudad del Cuzco, la falta de oportunidades de trabajo la obligó a abandonar su ciudad natal y radicar en Juliaca, desde entonces, se dedica a la venta de variedad de colchones, negocio que en un principio no parecía resultarle rentable, pero con esfuerzo, dedicación y mucho empeño logró crecer con su negocio, actualmente tiene un puesto de venta en una de las avenidas más comerciales de dicha ciudad. El deseo de esta diligente mujer es aumentar el monto de inversión de su negocio, está segura que con tu apoyo podrá hacerlo, para que en un futuro cercano pueda expandir su negocio.

loans.use: Increase capital to invest in her business

loans.name: Kilisitina

texts.en: Kilisitina F., 31, is married with 4 children. She has many years of experience in the vegetable business. She sells to the village and general public 4 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD). SPBD loans are Kilisitina's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her earnings will be used to improve business and help out with the family. Her husband helps out with the business too.

loans.use: To improve business status and also help to improve her home

loans.name: Zuwena

texts.en:
Zuwena sells charcoal in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar. Charcoal is a common household item in Tanzania, as it is used by many women to cook and heat food. Few families own a stove or oven. Zuwena is currently able to earn a profit of approximately $50 each month.

She completed one prior loan with BRAC Tanzania which she repaid successfully and on time. She is requesting her second loan so that she may further increase her inventory of charcoal.

Zuwena is 46 years old, married, and has four children: ages 17, 15, 11, and 4-and-a-half.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Umarjon

texts.ru: Халимов Умарджон житель района Рудаки. Имеет высшее образование. Работает кассиром. Кроме того, занимается торговлей продуктов питания. У него магазин . Обратилс к нам за кредитом , чтобы сделать ремонт в магазине. Таким образом он улучшит условия работы , а так же привлечь новых клиентов. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 18 месяцев. Женат и имеет двоих детей.
texts.en:
Umarjon H. lives in the Rudaki region. He has a college education and works as a cashier. In addition he sells food products. He owns a store. Umarjon turned to us for a loan in order to repair his store. This will allow him to improve working conditions and to attract new customers. Umarjon can pay back the loan over 18 months. He is married and has two children.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Store Repairs

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
Sao S., 49, is a grocery vendor, who resides with two of her children and her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She typically makes $5 a day, while her husband is a motor-taxi driver and works as a wedding chef. On average, he makes $2.50 a day. This couple also receives support from two children who work as hairdressers.

To make more money and raise their standard of living, Mrs. Sao S. would like to take out a loan of $1200 to add groceries to her inventory and purchase more hairdressing tools for her children.

loans.use: To add grocery and hair dressing tools.

loans.name: Perla Carolina

texts.es:
La Señora de Nombre Perla Carolina Hernández Rodríguez tiene 27 años de edad, su estado civil es acompañada, de esta union tiene 2 hijos, de los cuales el menor tiene 1 año  y el mayor 5. El niño de un año aun no asiste a clases, sin embargo el mayor asiste al 3 nivel de preescolar, su compañero de vida labora como contratista, Doña Perla tiene propósitos para este año, entre estos mantener su negocio y alcanzar mas recursos monetarios que le permitan la manutención de su familia por la que siempre, ha sido ella quien se ha hecho cargo su deseo es surtir su inventario para enfrentar la situación durante el incremento en el  precio de los productos que tiene para ofrecer a su diversa clientela los sueños de Doña Perla son mejorar su vivienda para dejarle a sus hijos un lugar donde puedan vivir con las comodidades necesarias además proporcionarle a sus hijos una excelente educación.

Su actividad económica es la venta productos higiénicos, belleza y pulpería, la ubicación de su negocio es en la casa de su Mama y la pulpería en la casa de su hermana que es la fiadora, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 4 años, Doña Perla inicia este negocio con el objetivo de apoyar en los gastos de su familia es importante resaltar que es un negocio informal que poco a poco se ha ido expandiendo al visitar diferentes instituciones donde hay clientes que le compran sus productos ya sea al crédito o al contado, en esta posición Doña Perla tiene cuentas por cobrar bastante altas es por esto que desea trabajar con un mayor monto para diversificar su producto en calidad, marcas y cantidad y lograr así sus propósitos deseos y sueños, el motivo de su financiamiento es para incrementar su capital de trabajo y alcanzar sus metas establecidas para este año por lo que agradece a fundación león 2000 y otras organizaciones amigas que ayudan a contribuir a esta causa.
texts.en:
Perla Carolina Hernández Rodríguez is 27 years old. She lives with her partner and has 2 children, a 1 year old and a 5 year old. The youngest is not going to school yet, but the oldest is attending Preschool. Her life partner works as a contractor. Perla has several goals for this year. One of them is to maintain her business afloat and to make enough money to support her family as she always has. She would like to stock her inventory now before the prices start to rise up, in order to continue offering a large variety of products to her clients. Perla also wants to make home improvements so her children can have a better place to live in the future. She also wants to provide her children with a better education. Perla sells grocery products and hygiene and beauty products. She owns two shops, one is located at her mother’s house and the other one at her sister’s house who rents her the place. She’s been in the business for 4 years. Perla started her business to support her family expenses. It is important to mention that this is an informal business that has been growing with time, since she started visiting different places offering her products. Now, she has regular customers, who purchase her products in cash or with credit. Perla would like to be able to buy larger amounts of products in order to diversify her stock in quality, makes and quantity. This way, she will be able to fulfill her dreams. With this loan, she would like to increase her work capital to reach her goals for this year. She is very thankful for the support received from “Fundación León 2000” and to other partner organizations that have helped her with her cause.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for her store

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Mambo (Hello!) from Tanzania! This is 39-year-old Victoria M. from Mwanza She is married and has three children between the ages of 13 and 21 years old. She is also responsible for supporting one dependent who is an orphan. Victoria has been running a shop since 2007. She works at the business for 9 hours per day, 6 days per week. Victoria currently earns about $300 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 USD to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, soaps and beans. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Victoria thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, soaps and beans

loans.name: Ismoiljon

texts.en:
Since he was very young, T. Ismoiljon has been in touch with the countryside. His family dedicated themselves to cultivating fruits and vegetables. Ever since he was young, he imagined he’d be in the business of selling produce. And, fortunately, he realized this dream. At the age of 26, he began to sell vegetables in small markets. Nevertheless, little by little, he saved money so he could set up his own shop. Thanks to his efforts and the love he has for this business, Ismoiljon’s business has been growing gradually. Nevertheless, Ismoiljon believes it is the time to inject more capital into the business so that he can buy at wholesale and obtain better prices. As a result, he is soliciting a loan of $ 1100 USD, which he will repay in 6 months. With your help, Ismoiljon will be able to move his business forward and offer his wife and five children a better future.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing of the variety of vegetables

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en:
Abigail T. is a 26-year-old divorced mother of two children (a boy and a girl). Her children live with their aunt in Kumasi, the regional capital. The eldest child is in the basic school whilst the younger is yet to start. Abigail lives alone in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Abigail has been a maize trader for two years. She buys bags of maize from village farmers and treks to markets to sell it to customers, most of whom are food vendors. Abigail wants a loan to procure more bags of maize to be able to supply more customers. She hopes to sponsor her children to high levels in school.

loans.use: To procure maize in bulk

loans.name: Magnus

texts.en:
Magnus N. is 35 years old. He is married with three children. He says two of them are in junior high school and one is in senior high. He lives with his children and wife in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Magnus is a trader. He trades in all kinds of hardware (building materials) such as bags of cement, iron rods, roofing sheets, nails, etc. He buys the goods from wholesalers in the regional capital. Magnus owns a shop in which he sells his products. He has been in business for 12 years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase his profit margin.

loans.use: To buy materials for sale in his hardware shop.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn N. and her family live in the mountainous area of Barangay Caronsi, Patagueleg, Penablanca, Cagayan. She is married to Manny and they are blessed with three children who are now in the primary level of education. With their small business, they are able to support the needs of their family.

Jonalyn sells snacks and cosmetic products in their village. She has been managing the business since 2000 and she purchases most of her products in the city market of Don Domingo, Tuguegarao City. Her business became their alternative source of income to support their family and she is still hoping for improvement to a better living.

Jonalyn operates the business in her little vending stall. She requests a loan of PHP 5,000. She will utilize the loan to buy flour, sugar, sweet potato (kamote), juice drinks (or so-called “camote” juice drinks) and other snacks that are needed by her customers.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, sweet potato (kamote), juice drinks and other snacks

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 25 years old. She is not married. She lives with her younger sister at Kasoa in Ghana. She has owned and operated a dressmaking shop for the past two years. She is a specialist in female clothing with various kinds of styles that suit the taste of her customers, like kaba and slit, wedding dress, funeral clothes etc. She wants to use the loan to buy more supplies of sewing materials like linen, threads, thimbles, etc. to increase her output and efficiency. She is a member of the community group called “Nyame be kyere” Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase sewing supplies.

loans.name: Sayada Group

texts.en:
Sayada is the group leader of Sayada group. There are four members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for their business. They want to expand and progress their businesses.

Sayada and Sameira want to take a loan for their tailoring business. They want to open a new shop for their business. Nasrin wants to take a loan for her husband’s business of a general store. He wants to make his business larger. Arozo wants to take a loan for her husband’s business of selling fresh fruit.

They want to thank all lenders to AFSG and Kiva.

loans.use: To expand and progress their businesses

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
Nguyễn Thị Nụ (228080729) is a 37-year-old female living in the town of Gia Lộc. She is married and has 2 infant-age children. To making a living, Nụ owns and operates a business venture in the food sector; specifically, she runs a food stall. Nụ has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,200,000 VND per month from these activities (primarily from selling a variety of food products in the local community).

In 2008, Nụ joined TYM Fund in order to gain access to financial services and, in turn, to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Notably, Nụ has successfully repaid a previous loan in the amount of 5,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Nụ is now requesting a new loan in the amount of 9000000 VND ($525), which will be used to further expand the business. Nụ plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional food products

loans.name: Zokir

texts.en:
M. Zokir is 31 years old. He is married with 3 children. For more than 10 years, Zokir has been working at baking “lepeshka”- traditional bread. He believes that this business is profitable and is not subject to seasonality. He gets up early and bakes the lepeshka and other bread so that people have the fresh bread on their tables for breakfast. All the input materials like flour, salt, and yeast he purchases in the local market.

Now due to high demand, Zokir wants to increase the number of his breads he bakes so he is requesting a loan of 6500 Somoni. The loan will be spend for purchasing flour and charcoal for baking the “lepeshka”. Zokir deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing flour wholesale for baking  “lepeshka”

loans.name: Jennelyn

texts.en:
Jennelyn D. is from the village of Dabong-dabong, Valencia, Bukidnon. She is 34 years old. Jennelyn is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Jennelyn owns and operates a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish, in the local community. Jennelyn is just starting this business.

In July 2009, Jennelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jennelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jennelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family and support the education of her children.

About HSPFI

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Hadisa

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Рахимова Хадиса - 39 лет. Замужем и мать 4-х детей. Хадиса  работает в ОАО «Таджиктелеком», в качестве оператора связи. Она зарабатывает средне. Хадиса посоветовав с мужем решила сделать ремонт на кухне и в ванной комнате. Поэтому они просят кредит в сумме 1000 сомони сроком на 6 месяцев, а потом погашать кредит с зарплаты мужа. До наступления холодов Хадиса и муж планируют закончить ремонт.
texts.en:
Hadisa R. is 39, married, and the mother of four children. She works as an operator at the public company “Tajiktelecom”, and earns an average income. After consulting with her husband, Hadisa decided to remodel her kitchen and bathroom, so they're seeking a 6 month loan for 1000 somoni, which they'll pay back from her husband’s wages. Hadisa and her husband plan to finish the renovations before the cold weather hits.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 50 años D. edad, vive con su esposo, quien es chofer, y con su hijo D. 25 años que trabaja con ella. Hace 4 años construyó un local al costado D. su casa para iniciar su propio negocio D. venta D. bebidas (gaseosas y cervezas). Para ello, cuenta con el apoyo D. su hijo, quien es el encargado D. atender a los clientes y ella D. administrar los ingresos que produce dicho negocio. Pero la actividad a la que más se dedica Ana desD. hace 10 años es la costura, es así como se siente más a gusto, elaborando ropa para niños y adultos. Además, gracias a sus negocios está cumpliendo sus objetivos, pues ambos le son rentables; tanto su pequeño bar porque está ubicado en una zona muy transitada y con la costura, pues por su experiencia y buena labor tiene una larga lista D. clientes. Por otro lado, el deseo a futuro D. Ana es tener un restaurante, especializado en pollo a la brasa, el cual es llamado “pollería”. Este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP  lo que más le gusta D. trabajar con su banco comunal es que se siente bien con sus compañeros y todos son puntuales en sus pagos. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará más cervezas y gaseosas, además D. telas y otros materiales D. costura para seguir activa en lo que más le gusta.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Ngoay

texts.en: Mr. S., 30, has a skill in carving statues that he learned from his grandfather. He carves pieces of wood into statues and sells them to people who want to decorate or adorn their home. Mr. S. is married to Mrs. Srey, age 23, who is a homemaker. She takes care of her five school-aged children. Mr. S. is requesting a Kiva loan to increase his business capital. This will assist him in making more profit and gaining valued customers.

loans.use: To increase his business capital

loans.name: Alicia Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Alicia socia del Banco Comunal “Gregoria Apaza” del centro poblado de Pusuyo del Distrito de Ilave, Provincia de el Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 21 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente tiene 02 hijos, vive en el la comunidad de Pusuyo, estudio educación secundaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi medio año, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado ovino.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, con este capital ella va a comprar ganado vacuno para engorde, dice que lo compra en las comunidades cercanas, y lo comercializa en las ferias, también se dedica a elaborar artesanías actividad con la que se ayuda.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando para aumentar su capital.

A ella le  gustan  las reuniones y al puntualidad.
texts.en:
Alicia is a member of the Gregoria Apaza Communal Bank in the Pusuyo community center in the Ilave district, Collao province, Puno department. She is 21, in a common law marriage, and has two children. She lives in the Pusuyo community. She has a high school education. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for almost half of a year. Her initial loan was for 500 PEN, which allowed her to increase the capital in her business of buying and selling sheep. She currently needs a new loan for 1,000 PEN to buy cows to fatten. She says she will buy them in near-by communities, and she will sell them at fairs. She also makes handicrafts, an activity which helps her. Her biggest wish is to keep working to increase her capital. She likes the meetings and the punctuality.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cows

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel P. is from the village of Taguima in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He is 59 years old. Samuel is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Samuel owns and operates a general store where he sells a variety of different products in the local community. Samuel has been engaged in his business for over 25 years and earns approximately 7,000.00 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Samuel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Samuel is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be Samuel's first loan from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy products to sell

loans.name: Heydi

texts.es:
Heydi tiene 25 años, comparte su vida con Juan, de 27 años. Tienen 2 hijos: Maira de 6 y Sebastian de 3 años, todos viven cómodamente en su casa propia.  

Desde hace un años se viene dedicando a la venta de ropa, tanto la que ella misma elabora, como la que compra al por mayor. Ella ha trabajado desde muy joven y ha aprendido las “artes del comercio”, que como ella dice, es por ello que siempre está  sonriendo y brindándoles mucha confianza a sus clientes, aconsejándoles sobre si la prenda le queda bien y si los colores le asientan. 
Heydi vende las prendas de forma ambulatoria, y aunque es muy cansado tener que caminar de un lado a otro, lo hace con muchas ganas, pues sabe que de todo gran esfuerzo obtendrá una recompensa. 

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete ser muy puntual con sus pagos, ya que se considera una persona muy responsable. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de tela para la elaboración de los polos que elabora y adorna con mostacillas y lentejuelas.
texts.en:
Heydi is 25 years old and is married to Juan, 27. They have two children: Maria, 6, and Sebastian, 3; and they all live comfortably in a home they own. For the past year Heydi has made a living selling clothing, which she makes herself and also buys at wholesale. She has worked from a very young age and has learned "the art of commerce," as she says. That is why she's always smiling and providing her customers with a lot of confidence, advising them on what outfit fits them the best and what colors match. Heydi sells the clothing outdoors, and although she gets very tired walking from one end of town to the other, she does it with a strong will because she knows that all her efforts will be rewarded. This is her first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she promises to be very punctual with her payments since she considers herself a very responsible person. With the money she is requesting, she plans to purchase a larger quantity of fabrics for the polo shirts she makes and decorates with beads and sequins.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase textile materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her café business.

loans.name: Nuevo Esfuerzo Group

texts.es:
el grupo el nuevo Esfuerzo esta integrado por 3 hombres los cuales son muy trabajadores, tienen mucho tiempo de conocerce, a continuacion se detalla las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan para ganarse la vida diariamente:

JUAN ANTONIO C., es el jefe del grupo, tiene 64 años de edad, esta casado y tuvo 3 hijos en su matrimonio, actualmente el cuenta con un molino para moler maiz, este lo tieen ubicado en su casa de habitacion, atiende en horas de la madrugada ya que el tambien se dedica a realizar trabajos de albañileria despues lo queda atendiendo su esposa, ellos son un matrimonio bien establecido y gracias a los ingresos del molino ellos han sacado a adelante a su familia. ahora el esta solicitando  el credito para mejorar la caseta en donde esta el molino.


ELIAS ANTONIO C. es comerciante, cuenta con un molino para moler maiz, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion, tiene 8 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividiad y gracias a estos ingresos el puede cubrir los gastos familiares y otros compromisos,  es importante decir que el señor C. sufrio un accidente en una maquina cuando el  trabajaba  para una fabrica de elaboracion de cajas para empacar Puros, la que le corto cuatro dedos de su mano derecha, fue ahi cuando el sintio la necesidad de buscar otra fuente de ingresos ya que no podia seguir trabajando en dicho lugar y hasta el momento el sostiene a su familia, tiene 4 hijos los que con mucho sacrificio ha logrado graduar y otros estan estudiando, actualmente el necesita comprar unos repuestos para el molino.

ESTEBAN S. su actividad principal es la venta de helados de diferentes sabores, vende conos en diferentes barrios y colonias de la ciudad de Danli, actividad que realiza de manera ambulante  en una bicicleta, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad que le genera ingresos para cubrir  sus compromisos y gastos familiares, tiene 5 hijos que ya estan casados.
El junto con su esposa siempre siguen luchando por salir adelante, actualmente el solicita un credito para surtir un poco mas su negocio.

todos ellos necesitan el credito para poder salir adelante con sus negocios y sus familias.
texts.en:
The Nuevo Esfuerzo group is made up of 3 hard working men. Below are details of their different activities they do to earn a living:

Juan Antionio Colindre is the leader of the group. He is 64 years old, married and has three children from his marriage. He grinds corn and has a corn grinder in this house. He starts work hours before daybreak despite the fact that he also works as a mason laying bricks while his wife continues with the grinder. Their marriage is very stable and thanks to the income from the grinder, their family has moved ahead. They are now requesting a loan to improve the stand the grinder sits on.

Elias Antonio C. is a store keeper who uses a grinder to mill corn. His business is located at his home and has been working in this type of business for 8 years. Thanks to his income he has been able to cover his families costs and other obligations. It should be noted that Senor C. suffered an accident on a machine while he was working for box manufacturing factory packing Puros. He cut four fingers on his right hand and it was there he felt it was time to look for another source of income as he couldn’t continue working there. Until now, he has supported his wife and 4 children, some of whom, with lots of sacrifice, have managed to graduate and others who are still studying. He needs to replace his corn grinder.

Esteban S.’s income generating activity is selling different flavor ice creams. He sells his cones in different neighborhoods and districts around Danli. He sells ice cream using his bike. He has been selling ice cream for many years and has made money to cover his household costs and financial obligations. He has 5 children that are married. Together with his wife they are always striving to move forward. He is requesting a loan to supply more in his business.

They all need credit so they can move forward with their business.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy ice cream, cones, napkins, blocks, concrete, zinc, and replace a corn grinder

loans.name: M'bé

texts.fr: Cette femme est spécialisée dans la vente de charbons de bois ; elle exerce ce commerce dans le quartier d’Adouba Agoè à Lomé. Cette activité lui permet de se prendre en charge et de subvenir à la plupart de ses besoins. Elle dispose de nombreux clients qui apprécient la qualité de son charbon ; elle vend aussi bien en gros qu’en détail. En ce moment son stock est en baisse ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 50 sacs de charbons. Le reste du crédit lui permettra de couvrir ses frais de transport vers l’intérieur du pays.
texts.en:
This woman specialises in selling charcoal; she practices her business in the Adouba Agoé area in Lomé. This activity allows her to take charge of herself and satisfies most of her needs. She has numerous customers who appreciate the quality of her charcoal; she sells it wholesale as well as retail. At present her stock is decreasing, which is why she has asked WAGES for a loan to buy 50 bags of charcoal. The remainder of the loan will cover her transportation costs inside the country.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Carla Carolina

texts.es:
Carla es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo.
Carla es soltera, tiene 22 años y vive con sus padres, estudia Industrias Alimentarias, Carla vende harina de cereales que procesa en su casa, cuenta con un molino, los cereales los compra de personas que le llevan a su casa, y sus productos los comercializa en tiendas a través de pedidos.
Carla necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales.
Los sueños de Carla son tener una empresa grande, terminar su carrera y obtener su titulo.
texts.en:
Carla is a member of the Triumph Communal Bank. Carla is single, 22 years old and lives with her parents. She is studying Food service. Carla sells cereal flours that she processes in her house. She relies on a mill, purchasing the cereals from people that carry it to her house and marketing her products to stores that place orders. Carla needs a loan of 1400 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of cereals. The dreams of Carla are to have a large business, to finish her career studies and to obtain her degree.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cereals to grind into flour.

loans.name: Evans Ochieng

texts.en:
Evans Ochieng, 32, is from Migosi in Kisumu city. He is married to Vivian Atieno and they have a son who is six years old and is in primary school.

Evans is a clothes vendor and mainly sells jeans and trousers in an open air area. He is looking for a lender through Kadet Limited to enable him to buy more jeans to add to his inventory. He plans to diversify his inventory by buying other clothes, including children's wear.

His future dream is to have a big stall in the city center and also to open a boutique for his wife. He also wants to ensure that his son gets the best education, and wants to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: Buy clothes to add to his inventory

loans.name: John Lawrence

texts.en:
John Lawrence G. is from the village of Brgy. Maddiangat, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 29 years old. John Lawrence is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, John Lawrence owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and for sale. John Lawrence has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, John Lawrence joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. John Lawrence is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the first loan taken out by John Lawrence from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Loutfi

texts.en:
Loutfi is a 54-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their child. Loutfi has been working in construction since 1986. He also works as a home decorator. Loutfi has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that he has requested a loan. 
Loutfi is special in his work because he does it well, and he is known in his region for his good and talented work. His clients are his friends and neighbors, as well as people from the surrounding villages. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on doing this business because he wanted to have independent work based on his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha tiene 61 años, esta señora emprendedora tiene varios financiamientos con Fundación, por lo que hemos ayudado mucho al progreso de su local. Su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de comida y venta de refrescos los años de experiencia que ha tenido con su negocio han hecho que la calidad de sus productos mejore, pues cada día ella siempre logra aprender algo nuevo para su negocio. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de papaya, melones, sandias, mandarina, naranjas y ciertas verduras. Su deseo es establecer una gran pulpería.
texts.en:
Martha is 61 years old. This entrepreneurial lady has had several loans with Fundación, through which we’ve greatly aided the progress of her business. Her economic activity involves providing a food and beverage service. The years of experience she has in this area have resulted in a business that offers quality products, and she learns something new each and every day to help her enterprise. Currently, she is seeking a loan for working capital to purchase papaya, melons, watermelons, mandarins, oranges, and certain vegetables. Her wish is to establish an exceptional general store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of grocery products

loans.name: Ovilla

texts.en:
Ovilla G., 34, makes sure that her family's daily needs are met. She and her husband, Isagani G., a driver, have seven children. She helps the family income by managing a barbecue stall and also operates a jeepney or small bus.

Ovilla, or Beck-Beck, as she is fondly called, has been a member of the Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her barbeque business.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying raw ingredients needed such as fuel, condiments, and seasonings. She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can renovate her house to incorporate her own barbecue stall right in front of it.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying goods she needs (like fuel, condiments and seasonings) for her barbecue business.

loans.name: Renuka

texts.en:
Renuka is a hardworking, 32-year-old married woman living with her husband, one son, and two daughters in the town of Telijjawila. Pictured above with Renuka are her husband and son.

Renuka has managed a cinnamon business for twenty-five years, and is now hoping to expand into tea cultivation. She is doing this business with the help of her mother and sister.

Renuka has asked for a loan of 30,000 LKR from BRAC Sri Lanka to buy tea plants in order to expand beyond her cinnamon growing business.

Thank you for considering supporting this Sri Lankan loan.

loans.use: To buy tea plants

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
La señora  María Dolores  T. es socia del bankito Las Caleras ubicado en  el sector Virgen de Milagro en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se caracteriza por sus ríos, sus paisajes, sus edificaciones mezcla de  lo colonial con lo moderno, su gente, su cultura y su tradiciones  hacen de esta ciudad de ensueños un lugar hermoso para vivir y visitarlo 

María  Dolores tiene 41 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal  concibió seis  hijos que se encuentran de 20, 17, 15, 12, 10, 9 años,  su primera hija estudia en una academia de belleza, sus tres hijos siguientes estudian en el colegio y los  dos últimos estudian en la escuela  de la localidad, su esposo es de profesión albañil y  gracias al trabajo y apoyo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Se encuentra hace seis  años en el banco comunal gracias a la invitación de sus vecinas, con su nuevo crédito comprará pollos y alimento (maíz, balanceado, engorde)  para incrementar su  criadero ya que ella se dedica a la cria y venta de pollos así como también a la venta de frutas y verduras hace quince años recorriendo las calles de la ciudad sólo los días martes, jueves y sábado desde las 09h00 hasta las 16H00.

Su meta es  llegar a tener un galpón de pollos más grande y así ver crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs María Dolores T. is a member of the communal bank Las Caleras ("The Lime Quarries" or "The Lime Kilns") located in the sector Virgen de Milagro ("Our Lady of the Miracle") in the city of Cuenca, known for its rivers, its landscapes, its buildings which are a mixture of colonial and modern architecture, its people, its culture and its traditions. All this makes it a dream city to live in and to visit. María Dolores, aged 41, is married and in her conjugal life became the mother of six children, aged 20, 17, 15, 12, 10 and 9. Her eldest daughter studies at a beauty school, her next three children attend junior high school and the two youngest go to the local school. Her husband is a bricklayer by profession. Thanks to hard work and conjugal support they managed to build their own house. Six years ago her neighbors invited her to join the communal bank. She will use her new loan to buy chickens and feed (corn, balanced feed, feed for fattening) to increase her chicken farm, because she earns a living by farming and selling poultry. In addition, she has sold fruit and vegetables for 15 years, walking through the city streets every Tuesday, Thursday and Saturday from 9 am to 4 pm. Her goal is to have a larger shed for her chickens and see her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens and feed

loans.name: Joceline

texts.fr: A. Joceline est née en 1975 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Mariée à PADONOU Marcellin, un maçon, Joceline est mère de cinq enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Seulement, trois des enfants restent à la charge de Joceline et de son mari. La famille vit à Ekpè III, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji,  depuis sept ans environs. Le couple se partage les différentes charges familiales. Joceline n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins et de participer pleinement aux charges familiales, Joceline vend depuis une dizaine d’année, des produits de quincaillerie à Ekpè. C’est au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin, et aussi à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Joceline achète ses produits. Dans le but de renforcer son capital et d’augmenter le stock de ses produits, pour mieux faire face aux divers exigences de sa clientèle, Joceline sollicite pour la première fois, un prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Joceline was born in 1975 in Porto-Novo, administrative capital of Bénin. Married to PADONOU Marcellin, a mason, Joceline is the mother of five children, some of whom are enrolled in school. Only three of the children are still the responsibility of Joceline and her husband. The family have been living in Ekpè III, in the township of Sèmè-Podji, for about seven years. The couple share the responsibility of supporting the family. Joceline did not go to school. In order to pay her own way and help support the family, she has been selling hardware for some 10 years in Ekpè. She buys her goods in Nigeria, a bordering state of Bénin, and in Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin. Wishing to increase her working capital and her inventory, and thus better serve the needs of her clientele, Joceline is requesting, for the first time, a loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of hardware items (paint, nails, sheet metal, etc.)

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah is married and has four children currently attending school. Hadjah rents a two-room house with access to electricity, but no piped water.  Her monthly expenses are school fees, rent for business, rent for residence and food.   

For 15 years, Hadjah has had a business selling African attires (Bitenge). She works 7 days a week and sells in both retail and wholesale. She buys African attires from shops on Nakivubo complex in Kampala city. She sells all types of attires ranging from Nigerian to Congolese attires. While her business is challenged by the risk of thieves, she aspires of going directly to Congo for attire and even selling on wholesale only. She plans to use the loan to buy more Bitenge (African attires) and rent the shop where she works from.

loans.use: To buy more African attires

loans.name: Chamroeurn

texts.en: Mr. Chamroeurn S. (in the photo), is 30 years old and his wife, Mrs. Seng-eng Pin, is 28 years old. They were married in 2004 and have one young son. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River approximately 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Chamroeurn has been a motorbike and bicycle repairman for two years. He is applying for a loan of $1,000 to help his sister purchase silk materials for her weaving business and to pay school fees for his brother who is in university.

loans.use: To help his sister purchase silk materials for her weaving business and to pay school fees for his brother

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria S.  is in the business of selling bags of charcoal at home. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  

Victoria is 45 years old and married to a peasant. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: María Etelvia

texts.es:
María Etelvina es una madre de familia de 46 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a su hijo en el sector El Sandial, un centro poblado rural del distrito de Pítipo, un distrito agrícola de la provincia de Ferreñafe, se encuentra ubicado a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a labores asociadas a la gricultura desde hace ocho años, actualmente cuenta con un terreno de cultivo donde suele sembrar diversos granos como maíz, por ejemplo. Adicionalmente cría pavillas (gallinas de guinea), un tipo de ave doméstica cuya carne es bastante estimada en la zona. Ella se vale de estas dos actividades para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de su familia.

María desea instalar en su parcela el cultivo de maíz, para ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes y pesticidas ya que ya cuenta con semillas. Con mucho esfuerzo ella espera lograr una buena producción.

Maria es una mujer trabajadora y bastante entregada a su familia, su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para ayudarlos a progresar y salir adelante. En la zona donde vive es considerada una persona tranquila y confiable. En la imagen nos muestra el terreno donde inslalara su cultivo y las aves que comercializa.
texts.en:
María Etelvina, 46, is a mother living with her husband and son in El Sandial, a rural populated area of Pitipo district which is an agricultural district of Ferreñafe province located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. She has been a farmer for the last 8 years. She has a field where she plants various grains like corn, for example. In addition, she raises guinea hens, a type of domestic fowl whose meat is quite popular in the area. These activities make it possible for her to help her husband support the family. María would like to plant corn in her field. To do so, she has approached Edpyme Alternativa for the first time to solicit funds. She needs 1000 new soles to buy fertilizers and pesticides since she already has seed. She expects to have a good crop yield thanks to the amount of effort she plans to exert. María is a hard working woman who is quite dedicated to her family. Her greatest wish is to continue working to help them and continue to progress. She is considered to be a levelheaded, trustworthy person by her neighbors. In the photo she shows us the field where she plans to plant her crops and the guinea hens she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for corn crop maintenance.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia C. is from the village of San Juan, Alicia, Isabela. She is 46 years old, married, and has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, she sells used clothing products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $128 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ofelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 5th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Akarusho Group

texts.fr:
Esperance N. est une commerçante âgée de 30 ans qui habite la Commune urbaine de Nyakabiga en Mairie de Bujumbura. Elle fait le commerce de produits de boutique  au quartier Nyakabiga il ya de cela 10 ans. Elle a fait ses études primaires jusqu’en 6e année. Son époux, Henri Bigirimana, est employé chez Air Burundi. Elle  participe dans le crédit solidaire avec Turame. 

Elle a 4 enfants âgés successivement de 13ans, 10ans, 7ans et 5ans qui étudient.
  
Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  augmenter la quantité des produits de boutique en vue  de réaliser un grand bénéfice. Elle espère avoir une parcelle pour construire sa propre maison mais souhaite aussi que ses enfants finissent leurs études avec succès afin de mener une vie meilleure. Son business a commencé avec un petit capital mais se développe petit à petit avec le temps. 
 Elle est une des membres du groupe  solidaire « AKARUSHO ».
texts.en:
Esperance N. is a 30-year old entrepreneur who lives in the urban commune of Nyakabiga, of Bujumbura Mairie. She sells various dry goods in the district of Nyakabiga. She has finished primary studies until the 6th school year. Her husband, Henri Bigiramana, works for Air Burundi. She participates in the solidarity loan program of Turame Community Credit. She has four children, aged 13, 10, 7, and 5 years respectively; all go to school. She is seeking a loan from Kiva in order to increase the stock of various articles in her store and to increase her revenues. She is hoping to be able to purchase a land plot to have her own house built; also, she would like her children to complete their studies successfully and lead a better life. Her business was launched with a small starting capital but has grown gradually over time. She is a member of the Akarusho solidarity group.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: augmenter la quantité des produits de boutique en vue  de réaliser un grand bénéfice

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en el sector Palominos del distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agricola que produce principalmente frutas como mango, limón y maracuyá, pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra ubicada en la región del mismo nombre a mas de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de jugos, comida, utiles escolares, golosinas y otros productos en un pequeño kiosko situado frente al colegio de su localidad, su negocio cuenta con mucha acogida debido a la calidad de productos que ofrece y al buen trato otorgado a sus clientes. Ella se vale de esta actividad para ayudar a sus padres con el sustento de su economia diaria.

Elizabeth desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas productos para ofrecerlos en venta a sus clientes, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles que le ayuden con el logro de su objetivo.

Elizabeth es una joven trabajadora y que siempre trata de velar por el bienestar de los suyos. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 23 years old, single, and lives with her parents and siblings in the Palominos sector of the Tambogrande district, which is an agricultural zone that primarily produces fruits like mango, lemon, and passion fruit. It is part of the Piura province, located in the region of the same name, more than three and a half hours from Chiclayo, the capital city of the Lambayeque region. She sells juices, food, school supplies, candies, and other products in a small kiosk located in front of the local high school. Her business has been very well-received because of the quality of the products she offers and how well she treats her customers. She values this work as a way to help her parents meet their daily expenses. Elizabeth wishes to expand her business with the purchase of more products to offer for sale. For this reason, she thought it best to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the first time. She is requesting 600 nuevos soles, which will help her to achieve her objective. Elizabeth is a hard-working young woman always tries to look out for the well-being of her own. Those who know her consider her to be a calm and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy products to expand her kiosk, which is located in front of a high school

loans.name: Denny Hortencia

texts.es:
Hortencia de 46 años, vive en una zona urbana llamada las Orquídeas,  vende productos Yambal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes). 

Realiza su trabajo sola para ayudar con los gastos familiares de sus tres hijos, trabaja desde muy temprano ofreciendo los productos de usos personal a sus vecinos y amigos, vende perfumes, cremas, desde $ 20.00 hasta $ 75.00 c/u todo por catalogo.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos Yambal como perfumes, cremas, desodorantes. En el futuro quiere tener su local de cosméticos y ser directora Yambal.
texts.en:
Hortencia, 46 years old, lives in an urban area called Las Orquideas; she sells Yambal products (a business that gives enterprising women the chance to start their own independent sales).

She started working just to help with family expenses for her three children. She starts working very early in the day, offering personal products to her neighbors and friends. She sells perfumes and creams, starting at $20 and going up to $75 c/u throughout the catalog.

With this loan she wants to purchase Yambal products like perfumes, creams, and deodorants. In the future she wants to have a cosmetics store and be the director of Yambal.

loans.use: Purchase Yambal perfumes, creams, and cosmetics

loans.name: Shaba Group

texts.en:
Simon M. is in his mid-thirties and is married with one daughter.  He has been running a food shop for 8 months.  He sells sugar, rice, wheat, and fruits and vegetables.  The shop is open daily between 6 am and 8 pm and earns a profit of about $125 per month. 

This will be Simon's first Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended.  Simon aims to use this loan to increase his shop inventory.  

Simon will share this loan with his loan group, Shaba, which totals 10 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Simon is the man wearing blue.

loans.use: To increase shop inventory

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn G. is from the village of Eastern Wao, of Lanao del Sur. She is 38 years old. Emelyn is widowed and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Emelyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling dried fish like danggit and pinikas in the local community. Emelyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Emelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business.
