Emelyn is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional dried fish & working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Emelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish & working capital

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge Alberto G. V. de 43 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Santa Ana, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposa quien es ama de casa, y junto a sus tres hijos los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Jorge posee un camión, en el cual se dedica a brindar transporte a diferentes personas que soliciten sus servicios, Jorge se encarga de trasportar únicamente materia pesada como: madera, tierra, cemento, ripio, basura y otros más. Él solicita un préstamo por medio del cual cuente con el dinero necesario para comprar llantas nuevas para el camión y así mismo otros repuestos necesarios, esto lo hace con el deseo de poder brindar un mejor servicio y así mismo darle todo el mantenimiento necesario a su herramienta con la cual se gana la vida y sostiene a su familia.
texts.en: Jorge Alberto G. V., age 43, lives in the department of Santa Ana with his wife, who is a housewife, and their three children who study. Jorge has a truck with which he offers transportation to various people who request his services. Jorge exclusively transports heavy materials such as: wood, earth, cement, rubble, garbage, and other items. He is requesting a loan in order to have the necessary money to purchase new tires and other spare parts for his truck. He is doing this out of the desire to offer a better service and to provide all of the necessary maintenance to the truck with which he makes a living and sustains his family.

loans.use: The purchase of replacement parts to improve his truck.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a food-selling business for over one year, selling from her home to her neighbors and passersby. Rehema hopes to open a hotel in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, bundles of wheat flour and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes, wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Vanthan

texts.en:
Mr. Vanthan K. (in the photo) is 32 years old. He and his wife, Mrs. Yoirn Chan, 29 years old, live in a village along National Road Number Five, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have two daughters.

Vanthan is a rice farmer. He also drives a motor taxi when not on the farm. His wife is a garment factory worker.

He is asking for his first loan of $700 to purchase a water pumping machine and to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain his rice farm.

loans.use: To purchase a water pumping machine and to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain his rice farm.

loans.name: Nelly Leonor

texts.es:
La Señora. Nelly D. es socia del banco comunal Nueva Juventud y vive en la parroquia de Tarqui, esta parroquia es conocida por sus llanuras en donde la mayor parte de su población se dedica a la ganadería, mucha de su población ha migrado en busca de estabilidad económica para su familia.

Nuestra socia es comerciante de ropa, actividad que la realiza hace 4 años, labora de domingo a domingo y cuenta con un puesto propio en un mercado de la ciudad, trabaja desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde.

Doña Nelly tiene 23 años, está separada y tiene un hijo de un año de edad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus padres y ayuda en la economía de la casa, su papá es chofer y su mamá comerciante,sus padres  tienen casa propia.

Se encuentran en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de más ropa para surtir su negocio. Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Nelly D. is a member of the 'Nueva Juventud' (New Youth) community bank and lives in Tarqui district.  This district is known for its plains where most of the residents are livestock farmers.  Much of the population has migrated in search of financial stability for their families. 

Nelly's business is selling clothes.  She has been in this business for 4 years.  She works from Sunday to Sunday and has her own stall in a market in the city.  She works from 7.00am to 5.00pm.

Nelly is 23 years old.  She is separated and has a one year-old son.  She doesn't have her own home but lives in her parents' house and helps with the household finances.  Her dad is a driver and her mom is a saleswoman.  Her parents own their own home.

This is Nelly's third loan with her community bank and she will invest her loan in buying more clothes to stock her business.  Her goal is to own her own home.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Mr. Oem Uon Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of nineteen people, who have selected Mr. Oem U. as village bank president. All members of this group, located in Kandal village in Takeo province, will use their portions of the loan to improve their family's lives.

Mr. Oem U. sells brooms door-to-door, earning some profit to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Mao Som, is a farmer who owns a very small piece of land, growing rice to sell to support her family. She is also a rice wine maker. Mr. Oem U. wants to start a new business breeding pigs, but doesn't have enough money to do so. Therefore, he is asking for a loan to buy some piglets and more rice to make rice wine. Mr. Oem U. is the father of two children; one is employed in a garment factory and the other is a waiter.

loans.use: to buy some piglets

loans.name: Eufracia

texts.en: Eufracia is a married woman who lives in Toboso, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a General (Sari-sari) Store business. Her husband Francisco, who is 56 years old, helps in his wife's business activities. They have 6 children who are between 35 to 46 years old. Eufracia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1996 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 21 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Eufracia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 6,000 PHP, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 22nd loan, she is borrowing 19,500 PHP, which she intends to use to fund  her business operations so that she can continue to save up for future family needs. Eufracia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: As funds for her business operations

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Amidst turmoil there can be found an inner peace. This is what Marjorie C., 32, seeks to prove in her life. She reached high school and is now an entrepreneur and mother to two children who are both in elementary school. Her husband, Ritchie, works as a cutter in a restaurant. Their family currently resides in Baseco, Manila.

Marjorie sells fresh fish to her community. She also sells fashion accessories to her friends, neighbors, and business acquaintances. Her four years of experience in these businesses give her the skill of knowing the tastes of her valued customers. These business efforts enable her to earn 6,200 PHP monthly. 

To help continue operation of her businesses, she would like to request a 10,000 PHP loan. This money will truly help her grow her business as it will give her the capability to purchase more fish, as well as quality accessories for her customers. For Marjorie, this loan is one step toward improving and eventually expanding her business.

There are a lot of challenges surrounding Marjorie, so much that she considers her life in flux. The turmoil they have at home and with the rest of her family seems to rob her of the peace and focus she should be having in her business. She is also concerned with her husband, who just got in an accident. Adding to these burdens are the customers who run away from their debts. Still, despite all this, Marjorie strives to fix her eyes on God, the source of her inner peace. She prays for increased savings as her business becomes prosperous. She also never stops praying for a good life and a better future for her children. Marjorie also desires to have her own house and lot.

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase fish and fashion accessories for retail sale

loans.name: Dolgorsuren

texts.en:
Dolgorsuren is 34 years old and lives with her parents and son in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. They live in a rented two-room house. One room is used as a food shop on a busy street in town. Her parents are retired and her son goes to a local secondary school. She began operating her food shop in 2009. 

Although she pays 100,000 MNT for the shop's rent, her income is good enough to support the family.  She was able to buy a car with the money she earned from her business in 2011. She wants to expand her business and have her own store so that she can save money on rent. She is a hard-working and modest person who says, "I am trying to make more profit and save money to have my own shop as well as for my son's future education." 

Dolgorsuren is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase flour, rice and a variety of other foods for her business.

loans.use: To purchase flour, rice, etc. to sell in her shop

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en: Vladimir G. is retired.  He lives with his wife and 2 children in Noravan village in the Syunik region. Vladimir is a driver and has a truck. He also keeps a cattle farm and cultivates his land. In Syunik’s very tough climatic conditions, working in agriculture can be quite challenging. Nonetheless, it is the main source of income for most people. To be ready for the spring farming, Vladimir has applied for this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and fuel.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and fuel for his farm

loans.name: Narzullo

texts.en:
M. Narzullo lives in Isfara, Tajikistan. He is married and a father of three children. He is engaged in cultivation and the production of brooms. He imports his brooms from the Kyrgyz Republic and sells them in a local market. Narzullo has been in this business for over 16 years. His wife and daughter-in-law help him. Narzullo has leased land and he also engages in selling dried fruits and animal husbandry. Narzullo has a car UVAZ, which he uses to transport his goods. He would like to request a loan of 9,000 TJS to purchase dried fruits and fertilizer.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase dried fruits and fertilizer

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 38-year old single mother of two children. She lives in her own permanent house in Fort Portal Uganda. The responsibility to take care of five household members rests solely on her.

Elizabeth works for a tea company called Rwenzori commodities. She has been in service for 13 years. She is happy with her achievements despite the low salary scale. 

Her desire is to educate her children to university level, and she is requesting a loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Maksat

texts.en:
Maksat S. is 31, married and has two school-age children.  He has been engaged in breeding animals since 1999 and worked hard to reach success. Today his farm, which has 4 cows, 20 sheep and 2 horses, gives a profit of 4,000 KGS a month.  In order to develop his farm, Maksat has applied for a loan of 60,000 KGS to purchase cattle.  It will allow him to increase his business and renovate his family's house. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en:
This is 25-year-old Abibatu. She is single and has an eight-month-old child.

In 2003, Abibatu established her assorted food items business. She began her business because she took it up from her mother as a means of livelihood. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,200,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Abibatu requires a loan in order to buy additional bags of rice, boxes of maggi (a popular soup flavoring), water, and plastics. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. Abibatu intends to use the proceeds of this to help her husband buy a piece of land. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy rice, maggi (flavoring), water, and plastics

loans.name: William

texts.es:
William tiene 46 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en casa de sus padres, ellos residen en una comunidad llamada el Porvenir en la ciudad de chiclayo. 

William se dedica al  rebobinado de motores caseros e industriales así como la reparación de artefactos electrodomésticos , actividad que viene desarrollando desde hace mas de 08 años, esta actividad la desarrolla en local alquilado ubicado en zona estratégica y comercial en la localidad de Chiclayo.

William desea adquirir un préstamo en Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar materiales necesarios para la reparación de motores, de esta manera wiliam tendrá el suficiente inventario para poder atender con mayor rapidez a sus clientes.

William es un cliente recurrente a Edpyme Alternativa y siempre demostró ser una persona puntual y responsable.
texts.en:
William tiene 46 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en casa de sus padres, ellos residen en una comunidad llamada el Porvenir en la ciudad de chiclayo. 

William se dedica al  rebobinado de motores caseros e industriales así como la reparación de artefactos electrodomésticos , actividad que viene desarrollando desde hace mas de 08 años, esta actividad la desarrolla en local alquilado ubicado en zona estratégica y comercial en la localidad de Chiclayo.

William desea adquirir un préstamo en Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar materiales necesarios para la reparación de motores, de esta manera wiliam tendrá el suficiente inventario para poder atender con mayor rapidez a sus clientes.

William es un cliente recurrente a Edpyme Alternativa y siempre demostró ser una persona puntual y responsable.

loans.use: Comprar materiales necesarios para la reparación de motores.

loans.name: Tsagaantsooj

texts.en: Tsagaantsooj is a 46-year-old widow who lives with her four children in a house in Uvs province of Mongolia. Her older daughter is a student and the younger three attend a local secondary school. She manages a grocery trading business in her town. She started her business in 1998 and is planning to continue her business in the future. With her earnings, she has been able to expand her house and to pay her older daughter's tuition fee. She is also saving money for her younger three children in order for them to study at a college. Now her savings has reached 1,200,000 MNT. She is a hardworking woman who attributes her success to her good accounting skill. She says, "I want to buy a car and to pay my children's education cost." She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase grocery items for her store.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items to sell

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzu is a married woman with four children, all of whom are adults. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a charcoal-selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge in transportation because of poor roads. She dreams of establishing a retail shop business in the future.

With the loan of Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu to get access to loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is married with 2 children. Nenita is 42 years old and lives in Oroquieta City.
Nenita sells dried fish to earn a living and has had this business for 2 years. Each month, she earns PHP 3000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 7000 to purchase more different dried fish for her retail business .
Nenita has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish for her retail business

loans.name: We Day Pay Group

texts.en:
Meet with the members of the “We Day Pay” group from Kenema, in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 500,000 SLL for each person in the group. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Mohamed is the leader of this group. The 52-year-old is married to a trader and the couple has six children. Mohamed has been a businessman for 30 years now. He sells used clothes.  With his share of this loan, he will buy a large bundle of used clothes to add to his current ones.

loans.use: to buy a large bundle of used clothes to add to his stock

loans.name: Twesigangane Kitonya Group

texts.en: Aloysius is 45 years old and married with five children aged 14 to 4 months. He is a member of the Twesigangane Kitoonya Group. He owns a permanent house where he stays with seven people in Hioma, Uganda. For two years, Aloysius has been dealing in a produce business and from it has been able to expand his business and acquire a means of transport. He faces the challenge of price fluctuations but hopes to have a bigger store. Aloysius needs a loan to buy beans and to sell.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans tosell.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia, D. 54 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Tito D. 54 años y sus 02 menores hijos, los cuales todavía dependen económicamente D. ella y lo que más desea es brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.DesD. muy joven a Delia, le nació el gusto por las prendas D. vestir, es por eso que con el  correr del tiempo decidió dedicarse a la venta D. ropa, actualmente realizando una ardua labor semanal, lleva ropa para vender a distintas zonas aledañas del departamento D. Ayacucho y Cusco, ya que según manifiesta es ahí donD. mejores precios obtiene por sus prendas, las cuales ella misma se encarga D. comprar y transportar desD. la ciudad D. Lima.Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es mostrar a sus clientes las prendas que están D. moda en las distintas ciudades del Perú, ya que así siente que se gana la confianza D. sus compradores, lleva 33 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que transportar los pesados fardos D. ropa a distintas ferias, pero aun así no se da por vencida, ya que sabe que D. esta actividad depenD. el bienestar D. su familia. Con el crédito solicitado comprará más ropas por lo cual tiene que viajar a la ciudad D. Lima para traer los atuendos D. muy buena calidad y por ello espera contar con el apoyo D. los financistas. En lo futuro espera contar con la misma fuerza y por ello se encomienda al todo poderoso que la mantenga con salud para así trabajar con el mismo ímpetu que la caracteriza.Este es su segundo préstamo D. Delia y esta muy contenta D. saber que contará una vez más con el apoyo D. los financistas para seguir avanzando. En su banco comunal es una socia participe.Con los 3,000  nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ropa.
texts.en: 54 year old Delia is a cheerful and hardworking woman who lives in her own home with her husband, 54 year old Tito, and their two youngest children who are still economically dependent on her. What she most wants is to offer her family a better quality of life. Since she was very young, Delia has had a taste for clothing. This is why, over the course of time, she decided to work selling clothes. She currently has a hard work week, taking clothes to sell in the different areas around the departments of Ayacucho and Cusco, as that is where she gets the best prices for her clothes. It is her responsibility to buy and transport her stock from the city of Lima. What she most likes about her work is showing her customers what is in fashion in the different cities of Peru, as she feels that this gains her the confidence of her customers. She has been doing this work for 33 years and thinks that the most difficult thing is having to transport heavy bundles of clothes to different markets, but, even so, she is not defeated as she knows that her family depends on her doing this work. She will use the loan she is requesting to buy more clothes, and she will have to travel to Lima to select good quality clothes and she hopes to be able to depend on the support of her financiers. In the future, she hopes to have the same strength, and so she has asked the Almighty to keep her in good health so that she can keep working with the impetus that characterizes her. This is Delia's second loan, and she is very happy to know that she can count on the support of her financiers once more. She is an active member of her community bank. She will use the $1,100 she is requesting to buy more clothes.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
María es integrante de la Alcancía Comunal “Nueva Esperanza” la cual está conformada por 10 mujeres emprendedoras.
María se dedica hace mas de 2 años a la preparación y venta de tamales, donde los vende a la gente de su comunidad, pero también nos cuenta que con la ayuda de su conyugue a podido iniciar un pequeño negocio de  venta de ropa para niños, la cual  es un beneficio positivo para ella y su familia gracias a ello puede contar con un ingreso extra. La Sra. María es madre de 6 hijos y  a su  58 años de edad ha podido salir adelante y apoyado  en la  educación a sus hijos, con el préstamo que ella solicito a podido comprar insumos para su venta de tamales como maíz, carne, manteca, huevo, aceitunas. María desea terminar de construir su vivienda ya que falta techar para así poner una tienda de abarrotes donde pueda ofrecer productos de primera necesidad. La Alcancía Comunal “Nueva Esperanza” es un grupo responsable ya que no han tenido problemas con su pago ellos agradecen el apoyo y la confianza depositada. La sra. María del Rosario no pudo estar presente por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the “Nueva Esperanza” Communal Bank which is made up of 10 enterprising women.

For more than 2 years, Maria has prepared and sold tamales to people in her community. She tells us that she also, with the help of her husband, has been able to start a small business selling children’s clothes, which has had a positive effect on her and her family for it has enabled her to have extra income.

Sra. Maria is the mother of 6 children and at the age of 58 has been able to get ahead and to provide for her children’s education. With the loan she is requesting she will be able to buy supplies for her sale of tamales such as corn, meat, butter, eggs and olives. 

Maria wants to finish working on her house since it needs a new roof and she also wants to have a grocery store where she can sell staples.

The “Nueva Esperanza” Communal Bank is a responsible group and they have not had any problems with payments. She is grateful for the support and the confidence placed in her. Sra. Maria del Rosario could not be present for the group photo because of work obligations.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the preparation of tamales such as corn, meat, butter and olives.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
Eusebia nació en la provincia del Cusco y tiene 52 años D. edad, ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  
Actualmente, Eusebia vive en la misma provincia donD. nació y donD. desarrolla sus actividades económicas, ella es profesora y trabaja en un colegio particular D. la ciudad del Cusco, ella también se dedica a la venta D. ropa.  Ya son 28 años que se dedica a enseñar educación y le va muy bien.

En esta oportunidad Eusebia requiere el préstamo para comprar ropa como por ejemplo buzos y casacas.  

El Banco Comunal “Comuzone I” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una D. las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Eusebia was born in Cusco Province. She is 52 years old, married, and has two children.

Eusebia currently lives in the same province where she was born, which is also where she conducts her business activities. She is a teacher and works at a private school in the city of Cusco. Eusebia also sells clothing. She has been in the teaching profession for 28 years and is doing very well. Eusebia is taking this opportunity to request a loan so that she can buy clothes, such as track suits and jackets.

The Communal Bank “Comuzone I” meets every 30 days in the city of Cusco, Peru. This city is known for being a tourist and business area. It is also known for the traditional festival of Inti Raymi and for being the home of one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to buy track suits and jackets.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia is 49 years old and married. She has two children who are 11 and 12 years old. Claudia's husband works as a boatman.

Claudia makes bread for a living. She uses a traditional oven and makes bread at the back of her house. Claudia sells her products to store owners in her town. She plans to use her loan to purchase an oven and ingredients such as flour and sugar. She hopes to have her own bakery shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an oven and ingredients such as flour and sugar

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a lotions and cosmetics retailer. She is 36 years old and lives with her husband and four children. Every day she sells cosmetics and, aside from this, she also sells viands within their village. She needs to buy merchandise such as lotions, make-up, lipstick, eye shadow and other beauty products for her direct selling business. This will help her improve the business and the service that she provides to her customers. 

Marites is aiming to fill all the orders coming to her, but the income she generates from her business is just sufficient to cover household expenses due to the high cost of basic commodities. For this reason, Marites is asking for a loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos. She hopes that she can meet the demands of her customers and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase stock cosmetic products such as lotions, make-up, lipstick, eye shadow and other beauty products for her direct selling business

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice has operated her milk shop in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 15 years.  She is 42 years old, and a mother of four children who go to school.

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan funds to buy more stock for her shop.

In the future, Eunice hopes to grow her milk shop and make more profits.

loans.use: to buy more stock

loans.name: Kadidja

texts.fr:
Kadidja est une femme  âgé(e) de 49 ans. Elle est mariée å un  chauffeur. Elle a 02 enfants. 
Kadidja travaille comme revendeuse de bazins de façon ambulante depuis 1996. Afin de répondre à la demande de la population elle achète ses produits à Lomé et chez les grossistes qui viennent du BURKINA-FASO.
Kadidja a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des bazins. 
Dans les prochaines années, Kadidja voudrait ouvrir une boutique pour ne plus se déplacer, aider son mari et voir ses enfants grandir dans de bonnes conditions.
texts.en:
Kadidja is a forty-nine year old woman. She is married to a driver. She has two children.
Kadidja has worked as a traveling reseller of bazins (a type of pagne, or colorful wax cloth) since 1996. In order to respond to the demand of the population, she buys her products in Lomé and from the wholesalers who come from Burkina-Faso. Kadidja has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to purchase bazins. 
In the coming years, Kadidja would like to open a store so that she does not need to travel anymore, and to help her husband and see her children grow up in good conditions.

loans.use: to buy bazins (a type of colorful wax cloth).

loans.name: Avelita

texts.en:
Avelita is 58 years old and is married with three children. She lives in Eastern Looc. To earn a living, she runs a business where she sells fruit and she earns about 15,000 PHP each month. Avelita has been a member of PMPC for four years.

Avelita is requesting a 40,000 PHP loan to purchase a variety of fruits and vegetables to sell. In the future, she would like to succeed in her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Yermias

texts.en:
Yermias is a 42-year-old man married to Afliana, 39. They are blessed with four children: Alfalita, 14, who is attending Senior High School grade 1; Julio, 12, who is attending Elementary School grade 6; Novi, 8, who is attending Elementary School grade 2; and Rivan, who is 2 years old.
Yermias is a construction worker. He worked in an insurance company for ten years but the company went bankrupt. In order to meet his family's needs, he then started to work as a construction worker. Prior to his involvement in this business, Yermias gained some training in carpentry.
Yermias decided that he could not depend on his income as a construction worker because it was unstable. He therefore started another business selling pigs to generate more income. He has been running the business for years. He is now thinking of expanding the business by raising chickens. He would like to purchase two boxes of chicks and fodder. Therefore, Yermias is requesting a loan from Kiva partner TLM amounting to 3,000,000 IDR. He is hoping that his loan application will be approved by TLM soon.

loans.use: to purchase two boxes of chicks plus fodder.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
María emprendedora, trabajadora, humilde tiene la visión de mejorar su nivel de vida así ofreciéndole a su familia mejores condiciones. Comerciante vende joyas, ropas y otras variedades siendo de fuente de ingreso. Planes es mejorar sus ventas mediante el ingreso de nuevos productos. Con el préstamo anterior logro cumplir los pedidos de sus clientes.
Mujer humilde que el bienestar es sus seres querido es su meta por alcanzar. Esta solicitando el préstamo para comprar mercadería ya que en estos tiempos de fiestas navideñas te pedidos por encargos y sus productos son buscados. Comprara variedad de prendas de platas, oro, oro laminado (anillos, pulseras, aretes, juego piedras blanca, variedad de dejes), ropas para dama, caballeros, niños,  entre otros productos. Con esta inversión le generar ganancias que serán utilizadas para el negocio y en realizar algunas mejoras para su familia.  Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo constante al desarrollo de su negoció.
texts.en:
María is enterprising, hard-working, and humble.  She has a vision of improving her quality of life and providing her family with better living conditions.  She works selling jewelry, clothing, anad other various merchandise, which is the source of her income.  Her plans are to improve her sales by introducing new products.  With her previous loan, she succeeded in filling all of her customers' orders.

She is is a humble woman, and the well-being of her loved ones is her goal.  She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise since during this Christmas season, she has more orders, and people are looking for her products.  She will buy a variety of jewelry in silver, gold, and gold laminate like rings, bracelets, earrings, white stone sets, and other items.  She will also buy women's, men's, and children's clothing along with other products.  With this investment, she will generate profits to use in her business and to make some improvements for her family.  She is thankful for this financing and for the constant support as she develops her business.

loans.use: To buy various merchandise like clothing.

loans.name: Ma. Conchita

texts.en:
Ma. Conchita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a lechon vending business in the Philippines.   She is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to buy additional pigs for her lechon vending business.

Ma. Conchita has been in this business for 6 years.  She also earns more income from catering food and raising pigs.

Ma. Conchita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: buy pigs for her lechon business

loans.name: Sandra Arelis

texts.es:
En la parroquia San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Unión Y  Solidaridad.

En este lugar vive la señora Sandra, tiene 27 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 11 y 8 años  los mismos que estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que se dedica al comercio, vende sabanas y edredones las mismas que las realiza puerta a puerta. En las tardes y noches ella instala un local en su casa en el cual vende Hamburguesas, corviches, jugos, sodas y otros alimentos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 17h00 hasta las 21h00 en la venta de sus bocadillos y las ventas puerta a puerta las realizan tres días a la semana en las mañanas,  lleva más de 7 años en su  negocio y  le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar sabanas, edredones y varios víveres para preparar los alimentos. Lleva más de 4 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta la facilidad para realizar los pagos.
 
Su sueño es ampliar más su negocio.
texts.en:
The members of the Unión y Solidaridad communal bank meet every two weeks in the San Pablo parish in the city of Portoviejo.  It is the capital of Manabí, which for many years has been known as the city of the royal tamarinds.  

This is where Sandra, age 27, lives.  She is married and has two children, ages 11 and 8.  The children go to school, and her husband is a merchant.  She is a very good housewife who devotes herself to commerce.  She sells sheets and quilts door to door.  In the afternoons and evenings she sets up a place in her house where she sells hamburgers, “corviches” (deep-fried stuffed pastries made with bananas, fish and onion), juice, soda, and other foods.

She works every day from 5:00 p.m. until 9:00 p.m. selling her snacks.  She makes her door to door sales three mornings a week.  She has been in her business for over seven years, and it has gone very well for her.

She will use this loan to buy sheets, quilts, and various supplies to prepare food.  She has been in her communal bank for over four years.  She likes the ease of making the payments.

Her dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sheets, quilts, and supplies to make food.

loans.name: Beatha

texts.en: Beatha is 48 years old. She is married with eight children between the ages of 4 and 19; all of her children are enrolled in school. She sells goats, and has been running this same business for more than 11 years. The loan will be used to buy more goats to sell. With the profits, she will pay school fees and buy a plot of land for digging. In the future, she dreams to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more goats to sell.

loans.name: Nyanlueth

texts.en:
Nyanlueth is 42 years old and married with four children. Two of her children are in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan for one year.

Nyanlueth is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this to pay the school fees of her children

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: 01.08.01 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Liên operates a food stall/restaurant selling soup. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make the processed food to sell.

Liên is 51 years old and she is married with one child. She is the group leader of the 01.08.01 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of six members. 
Liên lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her children are grown up.

In 2012, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Liên has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Liên hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make processed food for retail

loans.name: Tinkpon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe TINKPON est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans la même zone. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Marie (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 30 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Marie ne vit plus avec son mari et mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés et un à sa charge. Marie vit ensemble avec ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par la bénéficiaire. Pour cette raison, Marie vend des condiments, du maïs et de l’huile végétale depuis cinq ans. Marie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Marie ensemble avec les membres du groupe TINKPON sollicite pour la première fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des condiments, du maïs et de l’huile végétale.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 21-year-old single lady living in Nairobi, Kenya. She has one sister who is in college and three brothers; one in university and others in secondary school. Her mother is a farmer in Kitui County. This is her own real source of livelihood and whatever she fetches out of farming is not enough to support all the family needs. She was privileged to join secondary school and she performed well. Despite her excellent performance in high school education, her dream of being a Finance analyst has always has never come to pass due to the financial status of her family. 
Mercy works with Digital Divide Data Kenya as a Data Management Operator. She hopes to join school in January 2016, and to study successfully, she needs additional money to add onto the scholarship given by DDD and that is why she is asking for a loan of U$ 500 to pay for her fees at university. This loan is important to her because with it she will have the opportunity to do her degree in Business Commerce, finance option. 
Her goal is to help those in need and develop herself as a professional accountant, to see her siblings become professionals, and to get her mother out of worries caused by lack of finances, and develop the society.

loans.use: TO PAY FOR UNIVERSITY FEES

loans.name: Vine

texts.en: Vine is married with seven children. One of her sons runs a stall at the local market. Two are at school. The others are married. Vine is on her seventh loan with SPBD. With her first loan back in 2003, she started a business making and selling pork buns. With subsequent loans she developed this into a successful store which is located in front of her house. The shop is open seven days a week from 6AM to 10PM and is run by Vine and her sons. On any one day the shop will sell to 50 or more customers who live in the surrounding area. Vine has one of the largest loans in SPBD and has a perfect payment record. She is also a leader in her village center group.

loans.use: Purchase stock for the store such as sugar, tinned fish, mutton flaps, washing powder, drinks etc

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Aunty Grace is an ambitious woman who wants to live above the poverty level. She sells second hand clothing so that she can support herself and her family. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation. She has been trained in book-keeping and also in the TEACH Lending program. A loan of $650 will help her expand her business and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Mrs Huong is 48 and her husband is 56 years old. They have to support a daughter’s child who is 5. Vu, her first son became paralytic after falling from an accident at work. The family sold all their land to pay $3125 for Vu. The second son works as a daily laborer but the work is not stable. So selling soup, bread and noodle soup at house in the morning is important to increase their income by about $2/person/month. Average income is $9.5/person/month. Mrs Huong had repaid a loan of $50 in time. Now, she wants to borrow a loan of $75 for her selling business and she wants to raise pigs.

loans.use:
selling soup, bread and 
noodle soup

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia has four children. They were her motivation for starting up her own business selling natural products and food supplements two years ago. Lidia has had to struggle alone to improve her family's life and offer her children a good education. Fortunately, her affinity for sales and her personality have drawn clients and allowed her business to grow quickly.

Today Lidia has more orders than she can fill, and she is asking for a loan of $475 to increase her inventory. She will repay the loan in six months. Lidia and her family appreciate whatever help you can give.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

Lidia no tiene cuatro hijos, ellos han sido el motivo por el cual inició su propio negocio con la venta de productos naturales y complementos alimenticios hace dos años, Lidia ha tenido que esforzarse mucho para sacar adelante a sus hijos y ofrecerles una buena educación ella sola, afortunadamente el gusto por las ventas y su carácter le han permitido incrementar rápidamente sus clientes y crecer con su negocio.

En estos momentos Lidia tiene muchos pedidos que no ha podido surtir, por lo que ahora está solicitando un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía y se compromete a devolver en 6 meses. Se parte de los logros de Lidia, ella y su familia agradecen cualquier ayuda que puedas brindarle.

loans.use: To buy food supplements for resale

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Ake

texts.en: Ake F. is a young woman with so many talents, but she has chosen one to be her future business.  Her business has helped to finance her family and put her children in school.  She’s confident and has no doubts about anything because she has her husband who is helping her to look after the shop when she is away.  She will use her loan to buy more goods to sell and paint her shop to attract more customers.  She’s thankful to the S.P.B.D for the help it gave for a poor woman like her.  She receives an income of two hundred tala a day from her selling.

loans.use: To restock her shop

loans.name: Eladia

texts.en: Eladia C. is 44 years old. Her husband left her to care for their two children alone eight years ago. The eldest child, 23, is wheelchair-bound and requires a great deal of attention. The other child is 16 and currently in school. The younger child often helps Eladia in the store so that she can attend to the older child. The three are lucky enough to live in their own house. Eladia is the sole provider for her two children. With the money she earns from her small grocery she is able to put her kids through school, and feed and clothe them. She is now asking for a loan to buy more groceries for her store so that she can go on providing for her family. She already carries oil, rice, noodles, yerba mate, salt, sugar, and vegetables in addition to a wide variety of conveniences. As a result, she has established a good reputation with the people of her neighborhood. She currently wishes to increase her stock so she is able to better serve her clients. She plans to purchase canned goods, sugar, milk, noodles, and flour.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods, sugar, milk, noodles, and flour.

loans.name: Dian

texts.en: Dian is 26 years old and is a mother of child aged 7. She sells bags on credit. She goes door-to-door to sell her goods and usually earns US$10 per week. She also sells clothes but only in festive seasons. Her husband, A., also sells clothes in Jakarta and earns  about US$30 per week. She is requesting a US $75 loan to buy more inventory and is willing repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Mirvari

texts.en: K. Mirvari is a 50-year-old woman who breeds sheep in a small village of the Saatli region of Azerbaijan. She has 9 years of experience in this business and sells sheep to the local bazaar traders. Mutton is very popular in Azerbaijan and is used almost every day in various dishes. Mirvari is married with five children. Her livestock business is the only source of income for her family and she works hard to support them. She would like to expand her business and purchase 15 additional sheep for estimated price of $65 USD each. She has applied for a loan of $1000.

loans.use: To purchase 15 additional sheep for her livestock business

loans.name: Zulaiho

texts.en:
Zulaiho J. is 37 years old, is married, and has 5 sons.

Zulaiho works the land, and has been in this business for the last 5 years. She and her husband, who helps her, grow potatoes and carrots. The business is quite stable, allowing Zulaiho to support her large family. The generated income is spent on the purchase of seeds, mineral fertilizer, and to pay the salaries of hired seasonal workers.

Zulaiho is requesting a loan of 450.00 US Dollars to purchase seeds and fertilizer. Part of the loan will be spent on improving the living conditions of the family. This is the first loan for Zulaiho and she promises to pay it in time in 5 months and thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer for farming business and improve living conditions.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Angela is a teacher who decided to open up a small grocery store from her home, due to her family’s economic necessity. This new and important occupation has contributed to improve her family's quality of life. Now Angela would like a loan to better stock her store with basic goods.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Angela es maestra y debido a las necesidades económicas por las que atravesaba su familia decidió aperturar una pequeña bodeguita en su domicilio, con esta nueva e importante ocupación ha contribuido con el mejoramiento de la calidad de vida de su familia y ahora está deseosa de obtener un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de mayor cantidad de artículos de primera necesidad a fin de consolidar su pequeño centro de ventas.

loans.use: Improve the quality and quantity of items for sale in her small store

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Mr. Pen S. lives in the Koh Kor Krao Village, Kampong Cham Province. S. is 47 years old and is a construction worker, earning about $3.66 per day. His wife, Mrs. Heng Bora, is 44 years old and a farmer. Bora earns about $1.33 per day and has two children, all of whom are students.

Mr. S. request a loan of $700 to buy a cement mixer to make his work easier. This will help increase his income and support his family’s expenses. Bora is pictured in the photo because S. was not available at the time.

loans.use: To buy a cement mixer to make his work easier

loans.name: Kenda Kaala Self-Help Group

texts.en:
Evelyn A. is a young Kenyan woman aged 30 with 3 children. She also lives with 2 orphan children of her late brother who perished 2 years ago.

Evelyn started her business 3 years ago after accumulating savings from her former work place. She currently operates a small retail shop in the neighborhood where she resides with her family, located in Busia district. She would like to expand her business and start operating a wholesale shop. As she is the primary bread winner for her family, it would enable her to support both her children and her husband, who has a low-paying job. With the little profit that she gets from the business, Evelyn still struggles to feed, clothe, and educate her children and to pay her house rent. With the help of her loan, Evelyn will be able to increase her shop's stock to enable her to boost her monthly sales.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To increase her shop's stock

loans.name: Kholdorboi

texts.en: Kholdorboi K. lives in Asht, Tajikistan, and is married with five children.  Like many of his fellow villagers, he raises livestock for a living.  Over the last five years, he has accumulated a herd of three cows, as well as several bulls and rams.  By trading the meat and milk, he is able to support his family and also work on the nearby collective farm.  Kholdorboi is now applying for a loan of $625 for six months in order to open his own trading outlet.

loans.use: To open a trading outlet.

loans.name: Faaiuga

texts.en: Faaiuga F., 45, is widowed with 2 children. She has many years of experience in the pork bun business. She sells to the general public and villages 5 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD). SPBD loans are Faaiuga’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will be able to use it for the business, Kids school fees and home improvement.

loans.use: Purchase meat, soy, garlic and onions, cement, timber, nails, iron roofing

loans.name: Samut

texts.en:
Mrs. Samut P., 50, and her husband, Mr. Thoeun Sum, 40, who live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1979 and have four children, two sons and two daughters. One daughter is a silk weaver and one   son is a construction worker. Their other two children study in local school.

Mrs. Samut was a silk weaver since her youth but now spins thread for her daughter to weave silk. Her husband has been a carpenter for over ten years, building boats and wooden houses for the villagers. The couple is now in the process of building a new family house but lacks the money to finish it. Therefore, Samut is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase materials to finish her house.

loans.use: To add to her money to build a new house.

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
Mr. Luis Alfredo P. M. is in the process of applying to purchase a home through a Mexican government program called Infonavit. Infonavit provides working families with a low cost mortgage to purchase a small starter home. Some families’ incomes land them just short of qualifying for the program, however. This Kiva loan allows them to make up the difference with a small supplementary loan and thus qualify to purchase their first home.

El señor Pérez ya es una persona grande de edad; en México la gente es jubilada a los 65 años, es por ello que esta persona desea adquirir una casa de infonavit. Al estar jubilado es más difícil adquirir este tipo de créditos que da el gobierno. Luís Alfredo quiere aprovechar esta oportunidad que le otorga una inmobiliaria (lugar que tramita casa de infonavit) ya que si no lo aprovecha en el futuro perderá sus puntos y dinero.Para poder comprar su casa a el le falta la cantidad de $1,050 dólares.

La casa que le ofrece la inmobiliaria queda cerca de la casa de sus hijos, el también consta de una vivienda pero esta es al nombre de su esposa La señora Maria del Carmen Ríos. El Trabaja entre semana en fabrica en esta ciudad y los fines de semana se dedica a vender pulga en Del Rió Texas lugar que queda a unos minutos de la ciudad frontera de Acuña, también la señora lo apoya con los gastos de familiares trabajando de afanadora en una casa y así con estos ingresos van a poder pagar el préstamo recibido.
texts.en:
Mr. Luis Alfredo P. M. is in the process of applying to purchase a home through a Mexican government program called Infonavit. Infonavit provides working families with a low cost mortgage to purchase a small starter home. Some families' incomes land them just short of qualifying for the program, however. This Kiva loan allows them to make up the difference with a small supplementary loan and thus qualify to purchase their first home. Mr. P. is an elder person, in Mexico people retire when they are 65 years old and that’s why he wishes to purchase a house through Infonavit. When retired, it’s more difficult to receive these types of loans that the government offers. Luis Alfredo wants to take advantage of this opportunity from the real estate organization (who manages the Infonavit houses), because if he doesn’t, he will loose his qualifying points and money. To be able to purchase the house, he is short $1,050 dollars. The house being offered to him is close to his childrens' house, he also has a home but it is registered under his wife’s name Mrs. Maria del Carmen Rios. He works during the week in a local factory and on weekends he sells different items in the flea market in Del Rio, Texas, a place minutes away from the border city of Acuña, his wife also helps him with the family expenses working in a residence as a housekeeper; with these different incomes they will be able to repay the loan requested.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a house through the Infonavit program

loans.name: Mesepa

texts.en:
Mesepa T., 32, is married with three children. She has many years of experience in the sewing business. She sells her goods to the public and villagers six days per week.

Mesepa has had one previous loan with SPBD. With this loan, she would like to purchase additional materials and equipment for her sewing business. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 370 Tala (~$154 USD). SPBD loans are Mesepa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her husband is working and helps out with the family needs.

loans.use: To buy materials and equipment needed for sewing goods

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr: Komla M. est un jeune homme de 30 ans et vit à Kpalimé avec ses deux enfants au Togo. Il a une expérience riche en informatique et  désire se lancer dans les affaires pour installer un cyber café ce qui est pour lui une véritable aventure car difficile de trouver les fonds. Par ce premier crédit de FECECAV, il désire réaliser son rêve et tirer rapidement profit de cet investissement. Il compte sur cette opportunité pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Komla M. is a 30-year-old young man who lives in Kpalimé with his two children, in Togo. His experience with computers is rich, and he would like to get started in the business of an internet café, which is a bit of a gamble because of the difficulty of finding the funds. With this first FECECAV loan, he would like to realize his dream and to derive a quick profit from this investment. He intends to use this opportunity to improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy computers to install in an internet café

loans.name: Havas

texts.en:
Education is the most important inheritance Havas and her husband can give to their two dear children. They are both very responsible parents, and they work very hard in farming so that they can give their kids the opportunity to finish school. Finishing school was an opportunity that they never had due to poor finances. 

This happy mother has been working in agriculture since getting married and, with the unconditional help of her husband, she buys and sells cattle. This is a necessary activity in order to cover the family’s most urgent needs. Regardless of current cattle sales, she finds herself with increasing expenditures. Thus, she would like a loan in order to increase their capital and increase their production. Havas and her family are waiting for your quick response and thank you in advance.

loans.use: To purchase additional cattle to expand their business.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Thái năm nay 53 tuổi. Gia đình chị có 3 con đều đã trưởng thành. Chị Thái tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1999. Hiện tại hai vợ chồng chị chuyên trồng và kinh doanh cây cảnh còn các con đều đi làm công nhân. Hàng tháng  ngoài thu nhập từ bán cây cảnh  chị còn nhận được sự hỗ trợ từ các con nên kinh tế gia đình chị Thái đang ngày càng ổn định hơn
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 17.000.000đ để mua thêm giống cây về trồng và bán cho người dân địa phương.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Thái, 53 years old, has three grown children and has been a member of the TYM fund since 1999. She and her husband specialize in growing ornamental potted plants, while all of her children have gone to work as laborers. Each month, in addition to her income from selling potted plants, she receives some support from her children, so her financial situation is slowly improving. In the next lending cycle, she hopes to borrow 17,000,000 VND (1000 USD) to invest in buying seedlings which she will sell to local customers.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ornamental plant sales

loans.name: Phok

texts.en:
Mrs. N., 28, is a rice farmer, while her husband, Mr. Houy, is a carving-wood seller. The young couple has two children, and both are still young. The parents both work hard every day to support their own family. Her husband carves wood from the forest and sells to customers by transporting to customers' home. He uses a buffalo cart to transport but he rents it from a neighbor.

To reduce the cost for renting the cart, N. would like to ask for a loan to purchase two buffaloes to use as transportation.

loans.use: to purchase two buffaloes to use as transportation

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose S. sells bread and is requesting a loan to expand her business and increase her profits.  Rose is 42 years old married with 6 children who attend school. Her husband is a deputy head teacher. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: increase her profits and expand her business

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel sells provisions and drinks. Samuel needs the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. He is 40 years old and married with 2 children. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 36 años, es casada, tiene dos hijos con quienes vive en la casa de su suegra, quien dio en herencia a su hijo un cuarto donde vivir con su familia. Ser madre y negociante son dos actividades que tiene que desarrollar todos los días, sin descuidar ninguna de ellas. Se levanta de madrugada para preparar los alimentos y los útiles de sus hijos a quienes acompaña todas las mañanas al colegio, para luego salir a su puesto dentro de una galería donde vende ropa. Esta actividad es muy agotadora por la gran concurrencia de personas, pero en estos dos años ha tratado de adaptarse a este negocio, el cual es muy rentable, pues el precio con el que adquiere su mercadería es cómodo y le da la facilidad de vender a un costo mayor que cubran sus gastos de inversión, sin la necesidad de elevar los costos por prenda, siendo accesible para las personas de escasos recursos económicos. Con el tiempo, Rosa tiene planeado tener una cadena de tiendas para vender y administrar  su negocio en diversos lugares de su ciudad. Ella es cliente de MFP desde hace 7 años, este es su treceavo crédito, y le agrada el equipo de trabajo que conforman en su grupo. Solicita este dinero porque quiere mayor cantidad de prendas de vestir para venderlas y tener gran diversidad de modelos que llamen la atención de sus clientas, quienes cada vez son más exigentes por la moda que es tan cambiante.
texts.en:
Rosa is 36 years old, married and lives with her two children in her mother-in-law’s house. Her mother-in-law included a room in her will for her son and family to live in. She must be mother and businesswoman every day without neglecting either activity. She gets up at dawn to prepare the food and school materials for her children. She takes them to school every morning and then goes to her stall inside a mall where she sells clothes. It’s a very tiring job dealing with a large number of people but she has tried to adapt to it in the past two years. The business is very profitable since she gets the merchandise at a convenient price to easily sell at a higher price and cover her investment costs. She doesn’t need to increase the cost of the clothing so it is accessible to people with few economic resources. Rosa plans to have a chain of stores to sell clothes and run her business in different parts of her city. She has been a client of Microfinanzas Prisma for 7 years. This is her thirteenth loan and she likes the team that makes up her group. She is requesting this money because she wants a larger amount of clothing articles to sell and a greater diversity of styles to get the attention of her customers. They are more and more demanding with fashion that is always changing.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina A. is 27 years old. She is single with no children. She is single because she has not met the right person yet. Faustina lives with her mother and other siblings in their family house at Cape Coast. She has been a food vendor for a year now. She sells ‘ampesi’ and rice with stew, etc. Ampesi is cooked and enjoyed with any kind of stew. Faustina says the demand for her food has expanded, making it difficult to meet the demands of her customers. Faustina wants the loan to buy more bags of raw materials like rice, meat, and charcoal among others. She is convinced that the loan will help her increase her stock and in the event of a price hike, she would be better prepared to cook food. She says she would be grateful for your assistance. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Amen’.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs like yam, plantain, bags of rice, meat, fish, spices and charcoal etc

loans.name: Precila

texts.en:
Precila A. is 38-years old. Her husband, Nomer, is a farmer and they have an 11-year old daughter named Sharmaine who is in elementary school. Their family is living in Barangay Manamtam, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. They want to give their daughter a more comfortable and convenient life by providing her with a good education.

The couple helps each other in maintaining their rice field. Their main crops are rice and vegetables. But aside from farming, they also manage a hog raising business that assists them in meeting their needs. Precila would like to borrow 10,000 PHP that they can use in purchasing agricultural supplies and to buy additional piglets and feed.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en: Elchin H., 27-year-old single farmer living with his parents, breeds cows for milk production. He is in charge of pasturing and looking after cows, while his mother makes milk products such as cheese and yoghurt. Milk products are very popular among local people and they bring good income to Elchin`s family. Now he would like to expand his business and purchase two milk cows and one calf.

loans.use: To purchase two milk cows and one calf.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife M. is a resident of Barangay Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is an industrious woman and is married to Rolando M.. They have been blessed with six children. Due to lack financial resources two children decided not to pursue their college studies. One of them works as laborer and the other is training to become a soldier. Her other children are in elementary school. Though life can be difficult, the couple strives to give their younger children the best education possible.

Marife is seeking the support of lenders to finance her vending business in their rural village. She requests to PHP 15,000. She sells “buko” (coconut) at Barangay Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. Marife is able to earn an average income of PHP 3,000 every month. She wants to improve her business so her children can continue to receive an education. Marife believes that through the assistance of lenders she can accomplish her goals.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en: Amalia E. is from the village of GK, Santiago, Iligan City. She is 39 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. Amalia owns and operates a food stall, making and selling food. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Amalia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: GK, Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Malik

texts.en: Malik S. is a successful entrepreneur, father and dedicated husband. He has one daughter who inspires him to work hard. Malik began a small grocery store 4 years ago with a small amount of capital from his savings. He is assisted by his wife who helps him with serving his clients. Today his clientele has grown greater and his grocery has become more popular. He is asking for a loan so that he can expand the variety of goods sold in his store. Malik is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: purchase more goods

loans.name: Soatmumin

texts.en:
K. Soatmumin is 60 years old, married and has two children. He has had a trying life, but he keeps an optimistic outlook. He is a strong and persevering person, intent on improving his family’s standard of living.

Soatmumin sells fuel like: petrol and diesel fuel at his own fuel station. Soatmumin’s children are adults and help their dad with the business.

Today Soatmumin is requesting a loan of 6000 Somoni to increase sales. He sincerely thanks you.

------------------------------------------------------- More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase goods to sell to expand his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk for her business.

loans.name: Asoma

texts.en:
Asoma is twenty years old. She is married and has given birth to two children: one boy and one girl who are both in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Asoma is a trader, trading in meat. She procures the meat from nearby towns at moderate prices and supplies to food vendors and chop-bar (a place to eat, not necessarily a bar) operators in her community. She has been in business for two years now and wants a loan to buy meat in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy meat in bulk

loans.name: Ashrafdjon

texts.en: Ashrafdjon is 32 years old and he is the father of two children. His wife is a housekeeper and she supports him in everything he does. The most important thing to him is that his children in future enter university and successfully finish it, so that they will have a better tomorrow and become professionals. Ashrafdjon is a hardworking person and he has been providing taxi services for more than nine years. He wishes to keep his taxi business growing and for this he needs to have his vehicle in good working order. He needs to buy spare parts to improve its condition and that is why he is requesting a loan. Thanks to this work, Ashrafdjon has been able to stabilize his family’s quality of life. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for repairing his vehicle

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice Tafola is a 35 year-old woman living in the town of Faatoia.  She is married and has 6 children adult -aged children.  To make a living, Janice owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fried foods in the local community.  Janice has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately $850 WST a month from these activities.

In 2004, Janice joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Janice has successfully repaid a previous loan of $2000 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase new equipment & tools to expand the business.  Janice is now requesting a new loan of $2000 WST which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business.  The loan will be the 6th loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Janice plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Jurai

texts.en:
Jurai U. is 47 years old and lives with her husband and three daughters in Uvs province in western Mongolia. She lives with her family in a "ger," a yurt or traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her oldest daughter is a university student and her two younger daughters attend a local secondary school. Her husband, Erdenebileg, is a construction worker. 

U. rents and operates a well, providing water to many households in her area. She also sells coal and firewood to supplement  her earnings. U. started renting the well in 1987 and has operated a successful business for many years. All of her customers are very thankful for all of the services she provides, and U. works very hard to make sure they always have plenty of water and firewood. U.'s business is very important to her and she always works hard to improve her family's quality of life. She is requesting a 300,000 tugrug (~210 USD) loan to purchase more coal and firewood to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more coal and firewood to sell

loans.name: Saran

texts.en:
Saran D., 28, is married with three school-aged children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia with her husband and children. To make a living, she is engaged in the agricultural business of raising pigs, and she also goes to the market to sell fish every day, earning approximately US $10 per day. The family is also assisted by her husband who is currently employed in a local factory that produces bricks. He is able to earn an income of US $5 per day to support the three children’s studies and to cover the household expenses.

Mrs. D. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, D. is asking for a loan of US $1200 to purchase more pigs to raise and fish for resale at the market.
