loans.use: To buy pigs and fish.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
After Perlita C. and her husband separated, her 14-year-old daughter and only child became the center of her life. Despite her low economic status, she still works hard to be able to accomplish her dream of giving her child a sustainable kind of life. For this to happen, she joined ASHI to have access to business capital to be able to practice her skill in cooking until she could develop an entrepreneurial skill. Eventually after her first full payment of her first loan, she acquired another loan and have had another business related to the previous one, which is fish selling and hog (pig) fattening. Once her pig is big enough, it will slaughtered by a relative and Perlita will sell its pork by the kilo to people in their village.

Because Perlita realized a lot of potential to become an entrepreneur and achieve her dream for her child, she is requesting a much larger loan. Through the loan she is requesting, she also hopes that she will discover more entrepreneurial skills and will fully develop an entrepreneurial attitude within herself.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients needed for her food production business and purchase rice and pig to slaughter and sell.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
La socia FORTUNATA es una humilD. madre D. familia que ya son varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”.    

La socia tiene 57 años D. edad es casada y tiene 12 hijos que ya son mayores e independientes. Nuestra socia vive en el distrito D. San Jerónimo en la comunidad D. Angostura que se encuentra ubicada al sur D. la ciudad del Cusco. La socia tiene un puesto D. venta en el paradero D. buses D. la comunidad D. Collana en Angostura. Ella prepara almuerzo para los chóferes y cobradores del paradero D. Angostura en San Jerónimo. Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta D. comida. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que va sacar adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos para preparar más platos D. comida. Ella dice ser una madre que no le teme a las adversidades y que seguirá luchando para ser feliz. Ella cuenta que tenia que trabajar mucho para llevar un pan a la boca para los doce hijos pues la situación era difícil pero con  la ayuda  D. los bancos comunales le va mejor.      

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Fortuna is a humble mother who has belonged to the communal bank “Virgen Purificada – Angostura” for several years. She is 57 years old, married, and has 12 children who are all older and on their own. She lives in the San Jerónimo district, in the Angostura neighborhood that is located south of Cusco. She has a stall at the Collana Angostura bus station where she makes lunch for the bus drivers and money collectors. She alternates between her home duties and her food sales. Fortuna has been at this for several years and it’s been going well thanks to all of the hard work she puts into her business. Our member is a hard working mother, and enterprising woman, who is helping her family to get ahead. She needs a loan to buy supplies to prepare more dishes. She says that she is a mother who is not afraid of adversity and will continue fighting to be happy. She tells us that she had to work hard to get enough bread to feed 12 children; it was a difficult situation, but it’s easier with help from the communal banks. The member is grateful for an opportunity like this and promises to make her payments according to schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member needs a loan to buy ingredients to prepare more plates of food.

loans.name: Zakir

texts.en:
Zakir M. is a 48-year-old entrepreneur. He is married and has two children. Zakir sells different kinds of food products such as sugar, salt, butter, and beverages in his store. His wife actively helps him with sales.
Zakir is requesting a loan of 1,600 AZN to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once and a while to achieve his goal of becoming a successful entrepreneur. Zakir's main goal is to educate his beloved child so that someday he, in turn, will become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Anigye Group

texts.en:
Christiana, a 41-year-old trader, is married and the mother of three children. All her children are in school. She is a very resourceful wife and mother. She supports her children through the sale of used shoes (second-hand shoes). Selling of used shoes is a very big market in Ghana as brand new cloths are very expensive for the economically active poor. In addition, second hand shoes are seen as being of higher quality and more durable than the store shoes. Therefore selling used shoes has created a market for many Ghanaian women like Christiana. She takes stock of her goods from the nearby city center called Kumasi and she started her business two years ago. She wants to use the loan to buy more shoes to increase her inventory. She believes this loan would help her to save more for her children’s education and to rent a store for her business.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Anigye’ which literally means joy. She is the one standing in the middle in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders and foods vendors. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy used shoes in bulk.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en: N. Madina is a business lady, 26 years old, and married with three children in school. She has been selling second hand shoes for three years. She is using the loan to purchase different types of shoes, mostly ladies, children, gents, and so forth. Her aim of getting the loan is to expand her business. Her dream is educating her children.

loans.use: To purchase shoes

loans.name: Chork

texts.en: Mr. Chork P. is 46 years old and he lives in Srae Vong village, Takeo province. He and his wife, Mrs. Choun Mich (on the right of the photo), are farmers who own a 1.5-hectare field where they cultivate rice. Mr. Chork P. needs 1,300,000 Riel from AMK/Kiva to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his field crop and a cow for breeding.  Mr. Chork P. has six children: one is employed in a garment factory, one is a construction worker, three are students in the local school and one is too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for his field crop and a cow for breeding

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 45-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their four children.

Khalil has been working as a builder for over two years now. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Khalil has requested a loan.

Khalil is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties except making himself known to the public. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent work as well as having previous experience.

In the future, Khalil plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina tiene 41 años, es una madre de familia muy luchadora y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Simon de 42 años, quien trabaja con ella en la chacra y juntos desean brindarles a sus dos hijos una mejor vida.

Desde muy pequeña Delfina aprendió a trabajar en la agricultura junto a sus padres, quienes le enseñaron todo lo que se tiene que hacer para lograr una buena cosecha. Ahora tiene sus propias tierras, las cuales cultiva y cuida con mucho amor y paciencia; siembra alverja, papa y gladiolos (flores), las cuales lleva a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus cultivos, ya que siente que su arduo trabajo está dando sus frutos. Lleva 27 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden afectarlos. Su mayor deseo es comprarse un carro, con el cual pueda trasladar sus productos hasta el mercado de la ciudad.

Este es el octavo préstamo de Delfina con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y siempre está poniendo la cuota de humor en el grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará abono para sus tierras, ya que desea que sus nuevas siembras le den buenos frutos.
texts.en:
Delfina is 41 years old and a determined hardworking mother. She lives in her own house with her husband Simon (age 42), who works with her on their farm. Together they hope to provide their two children with a better life.

From a young age, Delfina learned how to work on a farm from her parents. They showed her everything that needs to be done to achieve a good harvest. Now she has her own farmland where she looks after her crops with great love and patience. She grows peas, potatoes, and gladiolas (flowers) and later sells them at the city wholesale market. What she enjoys most about her work is harvesting her crops because she experiences the fruits of her hard work. Delfina has been in this line of work for 27 years and considers the most difficult part to be protecting her crops from pestilence. Her greatest wish is to buy a car so that she can transport her products to the city market.

This is Delfina’s eighth loan with MFP. She knows that she has to submit her payments promptly and is inclined to do so. In her Communal Bank, she is one of the most cheerful members and always contributes her share of humor with the group. With her loan of 1000 PEN, Delfina will buy compost for her land because she wants her new crops to result in a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost

loans.name: Cécile Edwige

texts.fr: G. Cécile Edwige est née le 22 Novembre 1977 et vit depuis 15 ans environs à Fidjrossè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Cécile Edwige est mariée à GLELE Paul, un plombier et est mère de deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. La famille vit ensemble à Fidjrossè. Cécile Edwige vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les différentes charges de la maison. Cécile Edwige n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et assurer les besoins de ses enfants, Cécile Edwige vend divers produits (conserves de tomate et de sardine, lait, vinaigrette, pâtes alimentaires, petits pois, mayonnaise, allumettes, savons, etc) à son domicile. A côté de cette activité, Cécile Edwige vend également des chaussures et des tissus. Cécile Edwige s'approvisionne à Lomé au Togo, et aussi à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Cécile Edwige exerce cette activité depuis une dizaine d'année. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Cécile Edwige sollicite un autre prêt pour investir beaucoup plus dans son activité afin d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire et se faire encore plus de revenu.
texts.en:
Cécile Edwige G. was born 22 November 1977 and has lived the past 15 years in the Fidjrossé area of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Paul GLELE, a plumber, and is the mother of two children, both attending school. Cécile Edwige has only attended primary school herself. The family lives together in Fidjrossé. Cécile Edwige helps her husband and shares with him the different household expenses. To meet her needs and those of her children, Cécile Edwige retails various products from her home (canned tomatoes and sardines, milk, salad dressing, pasta, peas, mayonnaise, matches, soap, etc.). As a secondary activity she also sells shoes and pieces of fabric. She gets her supplies from Lomé in Togo, and also from Dantokpa, Benin’s international market. Cécile Edwige has been in business for about ten years. She is a regular client of ALIDé, who reimburses her loans correctly. She is now requesting another loan to invest more in her activity to increase her turnover and consequently her earnings.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various products (pasta, canned food, milk, sugar, soap, toothpaste, etc.)

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda S., 56, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Domingo S., an Overseas Filipino Worker based in Qatar, and they are blessed with two children. She helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own hog-raising business while operating a jeepney and a variety store.

Yolanda has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT)* for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her businesses.

To ensure the success of her business, she has applied for a 20,000  Philippine peso loan. This money will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business to buy a few piglets for the hog business and groceries for the variety store. She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy a few piglets for a hog business and groceries for a variety store

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is widowed with children. She resides in and rents a one roomed house where the family stays. Her monthly expenses include rent, feeding the family and school fees. Harriet has a store where she sells charcoal at both retail and wholesale.  She incurs little transport costs to and from buying charcoal. Harriet works seven days a week. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal. Her business challenges include debtors and the rainy season.  She aspires to see her business grow big and earn enough profits to build her own house.  She joined MCDT because she wanted to boost her business by getting more capital.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
el sr. Isidro O. P. tiene 58 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras como ser mangos, platanos maduros y minimos, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, su negocio esta ubicado contiguo a la terminal municipal de buses de la ciudad de Choluteca, este lugar es estrategico para las ventas ya que por aqui circulan muchas personas diariamente y esto hace que las ventas sean muy buenas, ademas las personas consumen mucha fruta por ser nutritiva y sabrosa.
Isidro es una persona de la tercera edad y esta es su unica fuente de ingresos.
el credito lo va a utilizar para comprar mas mangos y platanos, con las ganancias que obtenga podra cubrir con los gastos de su hogar y mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Isidro O. P. is 58 years old. He sells fruit and vegetables such as mangos, plantains and bananas. He has been doing this for several years. His business is located nest to the city bus station in Choluteca. This is a strategic place since many people circulate there daily and this makes for very good sales. People also consume a lot of fruit because it is nutritious and tasty. Isidro is elderly and this is his only source of income. He is going to use the loan to buy more mangos and bananas.With the profit he obtains, he will be able to cover his household expenses and support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy green and ripe mangos, plantains and bananas

loans.name: Abdou Lahad

texts.fr: Monsieur Abdou  Lahad G. est un bijoutier qui exerce cette activité depuis plus de 10 ans. Il habite à Wakhinane Guediawaye. Il  est membre de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis décembre  2005. Il a déjà rembourse trois crédits antérieurs. Il est marie sans enfants. Monsieur G. a choisi cette activiste  qu’il a hérité  de ses parents .Il  est ne dans une famille de bijoutiers et  a été initie depuis le bas âge  par la famille .Actuellement il est devenu maitre bijoutier en gérant  ses propres activités. Il sollicite un crédit  de 150 000 frs destine a l’achat d’or brut qui lui permettra de fabriquer des bracelets et des bijoux destines a la vente. Ce sont ses gains qui lui permettent de gérer  sa famille en toute  sécurité  compte tenu de la cherté de la vie.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdou Lahad G. has been a jeweler for more than 10 years. He lives in Wakhinane Guediawaye. He has been a member of the Baye Laye credit association since December 2005. He has already repaid three previous loans. He is married with no children. Mr. G. inherited this business from his parents. He was born into a family of jewelers and was introduced to it at a young age. Currently, he has become a master jeweler by running his own business. He is requesting a loan of 150,000 XOF to purchase raw gold that he will use to make bracelets and jewelry to sell. The money he makes will allow him to take care of his family.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Rasheeda Begum's Group

texts.en:
Rasheeda begum does embroidery work to support her family financially. She lives in Multan where the cost of living is very high.

Rasheeda makes embroidered dresses to order and earns a good profit on the completion of each dress. The profit gives her courage to move her business forward towards success. Earlier, she received orders from her relatives but now her work is acknowledged by her neighbors as well. She earns 500 PKR profit on each dress, which helps her to pay for the utilities.

Rasheeda has applied for a loan from Asasah to buy embroidery material such as clothes, beads and thread in bulk. The material in bulk will help her to make more embroidered dresses and improve her chances of making more sales and income.

loans.use: To purchase embroidery material in bulk to make more embroidered dresses

loans.name: Kanizan's Group

texts.en:
Kanizan is a wife of M. A., living in a city named Arifwala, in Pakistan. She owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over 15 years. She has given birth to six children: four sons and two daughters. All of her kids are enrolled in a local school and are getting an education. Kanizan is a caring and supportive lady. She manages the children's education expenses with her embroidery business.

Her husband has been a rickshaw driver for five years. In his years of experience, he has not been able to buy his own rickshaw because he was the only breadwinner of his family. But now his wife Kanizan helps him by making embroidered dresses on order.

Kanizan is applying for a loan from Asasah to purchase a rickshaw for her husband. By being the owner of his own rickshaw her husband will work more efficiently and earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase a rickshaw.

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Solidaridad Group

texts.es:
Grupo Solidario Solidaridad esta integrado por dos socios, Manuela de los Santos R. R. y Arecely del Carmen M. R..  Residen en Colonia Solidaridad en Juticalpa, Olancho, Honduras.  

Manuela de los Santos R. R. tiene 71 anos de edad, esta casada y tiene 9 hijos.  Se dedica a la elaboracion de coronas de flores desde 28 anos y aprendio con su madre.  Trabaja con sus hijos desde las 6 de la manana hasta las 7 de la noche aunque ella no tiene horario de salida.  No tiene mucha competencia pero cuando llueve tiene muchas dificultades. 

Invertira el prestamo en materias como papel y alambre para elaboración de las coronas.  Los prestamos le ha ayudado ya que hizo su vivienda y le sigue ayudando para mantener su negocio.  

Vive afuera de la cuidad y paga mucho transporte y padece de alta presion.  Su meta es mejorar su casa y tener siempre su negocio.       

Arecely del Carmen M. R. vende frutas y verduras en el Parque Central de Juticalpa.  Con el prestamo comprara frutas y verduras para vender y aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Grupo Solidario Solidaridad is formed by two members: Manuela de los Santos R. R. and Arecely del Carmen M. R.. They live in Colonia Solidaridad in Juticalpa, Olancho in Honduras.

Manuela de los Santos R. R. is 71 years old, married, and has 9 children. She has worked making flower wreaths since she was 28 years old and learned from her mother. She works with her children from 6 o’clock in the morning until 7 o’clock at night, although she doesn’t have an ending schedule. She doesn’t have much competition but when it rains it is problematic.

She will invest the loan in materials such as paper and wire to make the wreaths. The loans have helped her as she made her home and they continue helping her to maintain her business.

She lives outside of the city and pays for a lot of transport and suffers from high blood pressure. Her goal is to improve her home and to always have her business.

Arecely del Carmen M. R. sells fruits and vegetables in the central park of Juticalpa. With the loan, she will purchase fruits and vegetables to sell and increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase material such as paper and wire for making wreaths

loans.name: G.s. Quintana Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Q. está conformado por Elida Luisa y Sandra Esther. Ambas se dedican a la venta de mercadería en general, pues las dos tienen bastante tiempo de ser amigas, Sandra tiene 2 años preocupada por ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios, tuvo esta idea. Ella sale a vender todos los días sus diferentes productos, dice que es una gran ayuda para ella, además quisiera tener más inventario y mejorar el servicio para sus clientes. Elida al principio vendía solamente pocos productos pero ahora tiene más cosas, pues juntas han decidido realizar este financiamiento para la compra de  materia prima como pantalones, ropa interior, calzados, perfumes, toallas y sabanas.
texts.en:
The united Q. group is made up of Elida Luisa and Sandra Esther. Both of them sell general merchandise and have been friends for a long time. For two years, Sandra has been worried about helping her children with their schooling and had this idea. She goes out daily to sell different products. She says that it's a great help to her and would like to have a greater inventory. She also wants to improve her customer service. Elida has been selling fewer products, but now she has more items. They have decided to request this loan together, so that they can buy additional items, such as pants, underclothing, shoes, perfumes, towels and sheets.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel V. is from the village of Poblacion 4, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old and is single. Raquel owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products like diapers, shampoo and soap in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Raquel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Raquel is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Meilikan's Group

texts.en:
Meilikan K. is the leader of this group. She is forty-nine and married. She has two children: her son is twelve and her daughter is nine. Both of them go to school. Her husband is a taxi driver.

Meilikan farms and sells barley. She started farming barley two years ago in accordance with a decision taken by Meilikan and her husband. She started with an initial investment of 1,500 soms and she makes 3,000 soms monthly. With the profits from farming, she was able to buy cattle. So, now she also breeds cattle. She is applying for a loan in order to buy more cattle and one ton of cement to build the foundation for her house. In the future, she is planning to continue construction of her house. 

Group members:

Suiumkan D. is treasurer of the group. She is twenty-three and divorced. She also breeds cattle. Three years ago, she bought a calf for 12,000 soms and started breeding cattle. She plans to increase her turnover so she is applying for a loan. With the help of the loan she will buy cattle and continue cattle breeding. With the profits from cattle breeding, she plans to build a house. She is pregnant.

Asanbai D. is sixty-two and married. He has seven children: his sons are twenty-six, twenty-three, twenty-two and his daughters are twenty, twelve and eleven years old. His elder children are sellers and his youngest two daughters go to school. Asanbai is a farmer and breeds cattle. Eighteen years ago, he decided to start cattle breeding and farming with an initial investment of 1,500 soms. His current monthly income from cattle breeding and farming is 3,000 soms. With the profits from cattle breeding, he was able to make capital repairs at his house and buy a car. He is applying for a loan in order to have sufficient funds to finance cultivating crops. With the profits from farming and cattle breeding, he is planning to marry off his sons and build a house. 

Akdana A. is twenty-seven and married. She has six children: her sons are eight and seven years old and 4 months; her daughters are five and four years old. Her two elder sons go to school, while the others are still at home. Her husband is a mullah. Akdana breeds cattle. Four years ago, after she married, she started cattle breeding with an initial investment of 2,000 soms. Now, cattle breeding brings her 1,500 som monthly. She is applying for a loan to buy cattle to increase her turnover and her profits. With the profits from cattle breeding, she has already bought a house and furniture. In the future, she is planning to spend the profits from cattle breeding on providing higher education to her children and improving the family's living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Mirian Irma

texts.es: La Sra. Mirian, vive en la Localidad de el Torno Barrio Naciones Unidas, tiene  3 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar es  casada con el señor Juan hace 20 años, su Actividad es la venta de comida hace 2 años en un colegio tecnológico y como segunda actividad trabaja como profesora en el colegio cerca a su casa  y su esposo también trabaja como director de un  colegio en la  localidad limoncito, oriunda de Potosí sud chichas vive en el torno hace 25 años, el  destino del crédito es para la compra de abarrotes como ser aceite, papa, arroz, etc. y también refrescos  y aumentar capital de trabajo, al mismo tiempo se siente muy agradecida con emprender por haberle brindado este apoyo dándole el crédito cuando mas lo necesitaba.
texts.en:
Mrian lives in the Naciones Unidos neighborhood of El Torno. She has three school age children. She has been married to Juan for 20 years. She has been selling food at a technological school for 20 years. As a second activity she works as a teacher at a school close to her house. Her husband works as a principal of a school in Limoncito. She is a native of Potosí Sud Chichas, and she has lived in El Torno for 25 years. The loan is to buy groceries like oil, potatoes, and rice, etc. She will also buy soft drinks and increase her working capital. She is very grateful to Emprender for having given her this support and giving her the loan when she needed it the most.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soft drinks and groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stock up on beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell to her customers

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia D. is from the village of Villalin, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old. Lucia is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Lucia owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling clothing & shoes in the local community. Lucia has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lucia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to additional capital for her business. Lucia is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Lucia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elsa Isolina

texts.es: Elsa Isolina P. G. de 44 años de edad, es una madre de familia responsable, la cual trabaja muy duro por sostener a sus dos hijos de 15 y 10 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar y junto a quienes reside en Colón, departamento de La Libertad. Elsa posee una venta de piñatas y accesorios para fiestas de cumpleaños, así mismo vende diferentes tipos de juguetes, su hija mayor en sus tiempos libres la apoya con las ventas al atender a sus clientes. Elsa solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en su negocio, comprando mayor cantidad de piñatas en diferentes figuras, y así mismo comprar más juguetes. De esta forma ella espera mejorar sus ganancias y poder contar con una vida mejor para sus hijos y ella.
texts.en:
Elsa Isolina P. G. is 44 years old. She is a responsible mother who works very hard to support her two children, ages 15 and 10.  The children attend school and they all live together in Colón in the department of La Libertad.  Elsa has a business selling piñatas and other birthday party goods.  She also sells different types of toys.  In her free time, her older daughter helps her with sales by waiting on customers.  

Elsa is requesting a loan so that she can have the money necessary to invest in her business.  She will buy a larger quantity of piñatas in different styles as well as more toys.  She hopes that this will improve her earnings and provide her and her children with a better life.

loans.use: To purchase piñatas and other party goods and toys

loans.name: Nasira's Group

texts.en:
Nasira (pictured with her hand raised) is a 36-year-old, married woman living with her family in a small city called Vehari in Pakistan. Vehari, she explains, is famous for its agriculture industry. She and her husband have four daughters and one son. All of her children, except for her 9-month-old son, are currently attending school. She and her family live in a small home consisting of three rooms in the area named 34-WB. She is married to M. A., who operates a tailoring shop in the market. He is an expert at sewing men's clothes and is very well known in their area for the quality of his work.

To earn a living, Nasira runs a sewing business. More specifically, she receives regular orders from her neighbors due to her ability to finish her work on time and to provide quality work. She generates income each month, which she uses to pay her children's school fees. She also runs another business of selling cosmetics from her home. Ladies from neighboring areas come to her home to purchase cosmetics.

Nasira has applied for a loan from a Kiva partner, Asasah, for her cosmetics sales business. With the loan proceeds, she would like to buy cosmetics such as lipstick, mascara, eye liner, and nail polish in bulk quantity to sell to her customers. She is hopeful that an infusion of capital will enable her to generate an increase in her business's sales and, in turn, her profits. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah, so this would be her first loan through Asasah.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional cosmetics in bulk

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.en:
Guillermo D. is from the village of Cabisera 25, Ilagan, Isabela. He is 49 years old. Guillermo is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Guillermo owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting corn for sale. Guillermo has been engaged in his business for over 28 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Guillermo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Guillermo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Guillermo is requesting a new loan of 29000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Guillermo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for his  children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, seedlings & young crops

loans.name: Zeina

texts.en:
Zeina is a 40-year-old, married woman from Baalbeck, the mother of four children and owner of a grocery store since 2007.

Zeina is requesting a loan for the ninth time from Al Majmoua, in order to increase her capital and to expand her business. Zeina is a loyal client in Al Majmoua, she’s an upstanding person and pays always on time. She works hard on expanding her business and on providing the best to her family. She helps her husband in their family’s income and outcome, and she hopes to achieve more in the future. Her clients believe in her ambitions and know that when she insists on doing something she will definitely do it and succeed in it.

loans.use: To increase her capital.

loans.name: Aijamal's Group

texts.en:
Aijamal K. K. is the leader of this group. She is the resident of Bokonbaevo, a nice village in Isyjuk region. She is 20 and married to a driver.  In order to make additional money two years ago Aijamal started to breed livestock. Reselling livestock animals after fattening, she earns 11000 soms per month. That profit made it possible for her to save money and purchase a piece of land for building a house. With money received from the loan Aijamal wants to purchase a bull calf for breeding. In the future she wants to start building a house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a bull-calf

loans.name: Lai

texts.en:
Mrs. Lai E. is 46 years old and her husband, Mr. Phat Ban, is 48 years old (both are in the photo). They live along National Road Number 1 about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. The couple has been farming for 15 years. They have been married since 1987 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. Two are in school, one has full-time employment and another one is still young. 

Besides farming, Lai also grows flowers and buys some flowers from the fellow villagers for resale in the Phnom Penh market. 

She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her children to get work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her children to get work

loans.name: May Joy

texts.en:
May Joy, 29 years old, lives in the town of Banga with her family. Her family owns a rice farm that she maintains with her husband. They plant and harvest rice. May Joy works hard to help provide for the increasing needs in their household. She does her best to keep her family happy and healthy.

May Joy joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. May Joy is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to support her family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Chingiz

texts.ru:
Chingiz G. 29 let. On jenat i imeyet odnoqo rebonka kotoromu 4 qoda. Chingiz jivet v qorode Baku vmeste s lubimoy jenoy i rebonkom. Chingiz uje 5 let kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom prodaji suxofruktov , orexi i t.d.
On pokupayet orexi v optavuyu, a frukti on visushivayet sam doma, yemu v etom pomoqayet yeqo jena, posle cheqo on prodoyot ix v etom magazine. 
Seychas Chingiz nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit frukti dlya visushki , takje on xochet kupi qrecskiye orexi , fishtashki i t.d dlya prodaji.
texts.en: Chingiz G. is 29 years old.  He is married and has one child, who is 4 years old.  Chingiz lives in the city of Baku together with his beloved wife and child.  Chingiz has been involved in the business of selling dried fruits, nuts and such for 5 years.  He buys nuts wholesale and dries fruits at home.  His wife helps him with this business.  Chingiz then sells nuts and fruits at his store.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy fruits for drying.  He also wants to buy walnuts, pistachios, etc. for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of products for future resale

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona L. is from the village of Abu, Baylao, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 36 years old. Chona is single and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Chona owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, detergents,  canned goods, eggs, & snack foods in the local community. Chona has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Chona joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Chona has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Chona is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like beverages & biscuits. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Chona from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as beverages & biscuits

loans.name: Kablan

texts.ar: قبلان عمره 55 سنة متزوج وله 2 اولاد يعمل في حفر وبيع لوازم الآبار الصناعية له في عمله 18 سنة يتميز بالدقة في العمل وايضا بالانفراد في هذه المصلحة في منطقته يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء معدات جديدة واكسسوارات  كان يواجه صعوبات في عدم معرفة الناس به والصعوبات المادية ايضا لكنه يحلم دائما في تحسين وضع الزراعة والعمل في ضيعته وتقوية عمله
texts.en: Kablan is 55 years old and married with two children. He works in well-digging and sells well supplies. He has 18 years experience in this. He is distinguished with attention to detail and his business is unique in his locality. With this loan he wants to purchase new equipment and accessories to sell. He struggles with lack of financiA. capitA., and also the fact that not many people know about his business. However, he dreams of improving his position within the agriculturA. sector and of strengthening his business.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment and accessories to sell.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es: María del Carmen M. R. de 52 años de edad, habita en casa propia con su esposo e hijo. Doña María ha trabajado toda su vida para dar a su familia el pan de cada día que con gran sacrificio se gana. Ella posee una pequeña tiendita a las afueras del mercado de Armenia del Departamento de Sonsonate, en la que ofrece diversidad de productos como: azúcar, frijoles, arroz, aderezos, galletas, condimentos, café, entre otros. Este lugar goza de mucha accesibilidad y prestigio ya que Doña María se esmera por atender a sus clientes de la mejor manera cada vez que solicitan sus productos. Ella sueña con poder surtir su negocio para poder dar a sus clientes mayor variedad de productos. Esto la ha impulsado a solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para poder abastecer su tienda con variedad de: golosinas, cereales, verduras, bebidas, café, leche y de mas productos de necesidad de sus clientes. De esta manera espera obtener mayores ventas y por ende mayores ingresos que le ayuden a mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
María del Carmen M. R., 52, lives in her own house with her husband and son.  She’s worked her whole life to provide her family with their daily bread which she earns with much sacrifice.  She has a small store outside the market in Armenia, Sonsonate Department, where she stocks a variety of products like: sugar, beans, rice, spices, cookies, condiments and coffee, among others.  This place enjoys much accessibility and prestige because María always strives to tend to her customers in the best way possible every time they request her products.  She dreams with being able to stock her store to provide a wide variety of products for her customers.

This has led her to request a loan from INTEGRAL to stock her store with a variety of items: snacks, cereals, vegetables, beverages, coffee, milk and other products needed by her customers.  She hopes this way to obtain better sales and thus higher income that will help her improve her and her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sugar, beans, rice, spices, cookies, condiments and coffee, among others.

loans.name: Zhanyl

texts.en:
Zhanyl B. is 50 years old, married, and has two sons. Her younger son’s family lives with her, and not so long ago she became the grandmother of a beautiful girl. Zhanyl worked at the kindergarten for a long time and was the best friend to her pupils. 

In order to find an additional means of subsistence for her family, she engaged in the cattle breeding business. Starting with the initial capital of 4,000 KGS, she managed to earn about $129 in a month. Today her farm, which consists of two milk cows, a bull calf and five sheep, still needs to be developed. 

For this reason, Zhanyl has applied for a loan of 100,000 KGS for the purchase of one bull calf and fifteen lambs. With the revenues, she plans to reconstruct a barn for her cattle. In future, she dreams of buying a flat in Karabalta town. 


Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase a bull calf and some lambs.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo, reside en Corinto departamento de Morazán, vive con su esposa y su hijo, don Lorenzo trabaja junto a su familia en la venta de dulce de panela y granos básicos, desde las 6:00am a 5:00pm, todos los miércoles y domingos en el mercado municipal de Corinto, los demás días de la semana venden en su casa, este negocio lo aprendió por sus propios medios desde hace 5 años.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de dulce, maíz y frijol, este préstamo le servirá mucho, ya que por motivos de construcción en su casa, se quedo sin fondos para comprar mercadería para el negocio.
Su esperanza es mantenerse en el negocio, con una buena rentabilidad y continuar mejorando las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Lorenzo lives in the town of Corinto in the Salvadoran "departamento" of Morazan.  He lives with his wife and son.  Don Lorenzo and his family operate a business selling "dulce de panela"--a sugar-based food product that is a main ingredient for some local deserts--and everyday commodities.  He works from 6:00am to 5:00pm.  He works at the Corinto town market on Wednesdays and Sundays and from his house the rest of the week.  He has operated the business for 5 years, learning the business as it's grown.  Now he's applying for a loan to buy stocks of dulce, maize and beans.  The loan will help him a lot because he's been building his house and has nothing left to buy supplies for the business. 
Don Lorenzo's goal is to ensure that the business prospers and continues to provide the income that he needs to live.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for his food sales business.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Maria del Carmen vive en el estado de veracruz en el municipio de Tierra Blanca o mejor conocida como la novia del sol, la cual se caracteriza por ser una zona ganadera y sus abuandantes calores en verano  de hasta 54°c. Doña Maria del Carmen tiene la edad de 39 años solo estudio la secudaria y esta casada con el señor Francisco con el cual tiene 2 hijos de nombres Diana de 15  años que asiste a la preparatoria y Andres de 5 años que asiste al preescolar.

Ella nos platica que hace un poco mas de un año su esposo le dijo que si queria trabajar vendiendo ropa americana ya que como el trabajar de obrero en una empresa de construccion viaja mucho y tiene la posiblilidad de comprar pacas de ropa y traersela a su esposa para que ella las venda.

Doña Maria del Carmen para ganarse un poco de dinero extra acepto y ahora vende ropa de segunda mano en su casa, ella nos comenta que cuando llega su marido con la paca de ropa saca una mesa grande emfrente de su casa y pone unos tendederos en los cuales cuelga su ropa y sus vecinos y amigos al ver la ropa van a ver sus productos y hacen las compras.

Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de pacas de ropa para su posterior venta.

Ella nos platica que la ropa sale buena calidad y es economica por eso cuando pone su puesto la ropa se vende muy rapido.

Ella espera que con este credito su negocio propere ya que desea darles calidad de vida a sus hijos y estudien una profesion.
texts.en:
María del Carmen lives in the state of Veracruz in the town of Tierra Blanca, better known as the Sun’s Girlfriend.  It is noted for being a cattle raising area and for its extreme summer temperatures of up to 54°C.  María del Carmen is 39 years old and only finished middle school.  She’s married to Francisco and they have two children: Diana, 15, in high school and Andrés, 5, who goes to preschool.

She tells us that a little more than a year ago her husband asked her if she wanted to work selling American clothes because since he works as laborer for a construction company he travels a lot and has the opportunity to buy large bundles of clothes and bring them to his wife so that she can sell them.

To earn a little extra money, María del Carmen accepted this proposal and now she sells second hand clothes at home.  She tells us that when her husband arrives with a bundle of clothes she sets up a large table in front of her house and sets up some clothes lines where she hangs up the clothes and her friends and neighbors when they see the clothes come by to look at them and make purchases.

She needs this loan to invest in bundles of clothes for subsequent sale.  She tells us that the clothes are of good quality and economical so when she sets up her stand the clothes sell out very quickly.

She hopes that with this loan her business will progress because she wants to provide quality of life for her children and that they study a profession.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Kacerere Women's Group A

texts.en:
Monic is 32 years old and the happily married mother of four. For the past decade, she has operated a bicycle-repair business. Prior to that she was engaged in agriculture, but a close friend prevailed on her to try a hand at this business. Monic’s business is in Ntungamo town where there are many commercial bicycle riders commonly known as boda boda. These are her daily clients. She earns 240,000 UGX a week in profits. 

Monic is requesting a loan to purchase more bicycle spare parts. She figures this will give her an advantage over her competition.

loans.use: to purchase bicycle spare parts

loans.name: Rege Utara 2 Group

texts.en:
Nurhayati is the group coordinator of the Rege Utara 2 group. She is the lady in the light pink shirt and pants in the photo.

Nurhayati is 32 years old, and is married with 3 children. Before starting her own business 3 years ago, she used to help her husband sell porridge for 8 years. In her food stall, she sells coffee, tea, mineral water, instant noodles, cigarettes, milk, sugar, snacks, and other daily needs. Her shop is near her house. She has a lot of competition for her business, but still many loyal customers who have helped her business grow. Within a week of starting her business, her family was able to afford more nutritous meals of chicken and beef 2-3 times a week.

She wants to use the new loan to buy more and new types of inventory for her store. She hopes that with the income, she can support her children's high school graduation.

loans.use: To buy more inventory of soft drinks, instant noodles, milk, sugar etc. for her shop

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie is married and a mother of five school-age children. She is 44 years old and lives in the small village of Sinara Bajo, two kilometers away from the town of Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Vergie has a food business to make a living. She sells snacks and viands to the streets, school, and offices. She has been engaged in this type of business for 24 years. Each month, she earns a total of PHP 3,000 from this business. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 from GDMPC to purchase kitchen utensils and ingredients for food preparation.

Vergie has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Vergie hopes to have a food stall in the town and earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase kitchen utensils and ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is a married woman with four children, two girls and two boys. Two attend school and two have graduated. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past one year, she has operated a natural juice making business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is seasonality in her business.  She dreams of opening a shop to sell natural fruit juices in the future.

With the loan of Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of mangoes, avocados and flavours. She decided to join Kiva partner Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of mangoes, avocados and flavours.

loans.name: Anna Mary

texts.en: Anna Mary is 46 years old, married with one child aged 22 years old, living in her own permanent house in Hioma, Uganda. For 16 years, Anna Mary has been operating a restaurant and from this business she has been able to manage to support her family. She faces a challenge of fluctuations of food prices  and sometimes the fresh food goes bad. Nevertheless,  her dream is to own a hotel. Anna Mary intends to use the loan to buy a fridge.

loans.use: To buy a fridge.

loans.name: Benedicto

texts.es: Benedicto, de 41 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su hijo Elio de 12 años, al que educa y cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay. Valiente padre soltero, así definimos a Benedicto, quien se dedica a las labores agrícolas desde muy joven y con el transcurrir de los años aprendió todas las técnicas necesarias para obtener una buena producción, es por eso que en la actualidad siembra alverjas y papa. Lo que más le gusta es cuidar con esmero sus cultivos, y luego de un tiempo recoge toda su producción de calidad, y la traslada hasta el mercado mayorista de su ciudad. Lo que no le gusta es que muchas veces trabaja solo, porque su hijo estudia, pero le ayuda en lo que puede. Como es un hombre emprendedor tiene grandes planes para el futuro, y uno de ellos es sembrar en mayor cantidad para mejorar sus ganancias, sabe que lo logrará, ya que comenzó con el negocio de compra y venta de papa, donde está obteniendo buenas ganancias que le permitirán invertir más en sus cultivos. Es el sexto crédito con MFP, y esta muy agradecido con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito y también está muy satisfecho con el desempeño de su grupo, pues esta integrado por personas responsables y solidarias. Benedicto de obtener su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de semilla de alverja y fertilizantes naturales, pues necesita mejorar su producción para la siguiente campaña.
texts.en:
Benedicto, 41, lives in his own house with his son Elio,12, whom he educates and takes care of at home in the hamlet of Cumutay. 'Brave single parent', is how we define Benedicto, who has been working in farming since a young age.  Through the passing of the years he learned all the techniques needed for good production.  That is why now he is planting peas and potatoes. What he likes most is to carefully take care of his crops, and after some time to gather all the quality production, and bring it to the wholesale market of his city. What he does not enjoy is that he often works alone, because his son is in school, but he helps as he can.

As an entrepreneur, Benedicto has big plans for the future, and one of them is to plant more to improve his profits.  He knows that he will succeed.  He already began the business of buying and selling potatoes, which are producing good profits that allow him to invest more in his crops. This is his sixth loan with MFP, and he is very grateful to everyone who made the loan.  He is also very satisfied with the performance of his group, which is composed of responsible and caring people. With your support, Benedicto will invest the requested loan to buy bags of pea seeds and natural fertilizers, as he needs to improve his production next season.

loans.use: to buy pea seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Nonvignon G Group

texts.fr: Le groupement NONVIGNON G est composé de seize membres. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Houinsi Victorine est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une première fois,l'appui financier de ALIDé. Houinsi Victorine est âgée de 62 ans et vit au Bénin. Houinsi Victorine est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Léonard. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés. Houinsi Victorine n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Houinsi Victorine vend de la friperie à son domicile. Parallèlement à cette activité, Houinsi Victorine prépare de la nourriture qu'elle vend à son domicile. Houinsi Victorine mène cette activité il y a une vingtaine d'année. C'est dans un marché du Bénin que Houinsi Victorine s'approvisionne. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Houinsi Victorine et les autres membres du groupe NONVIGNON G sollicitent un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The group NONVIGNON G is made up of 16 members. The representative of the group, Houinsi Victorine, is the one who is raising her hand in the photo. Wishing to grow their businesses and better respond to the needs of their clientele, this group is requesting a first-ever loan from ALIDé. 

Houinsi Victorine is 62 and lives in Bénin. She is married to a driver named Léonard. The couple have five children, all having attended school. Houinsi Victorine never attended school. To support herself, she sells used clothing at her home. She also prepares food that she sells out of her home. She has been in these businesses for some 20 years. She buys her goods in a market in Bénin.

With the aim of bolstering their businesses and better satisfying their clientele, Houinsi Victorine and the other members of the NONVIGNON G group are requesting their first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy used clothing and various products.

loans.name: Maricela Elizabeth

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, en este lugar se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Maricela, tiene 25 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 2 años y un bebé de siete meses de edad. Su esposo es Economista y trabaja en una empresa.
 
Nuestra amiga se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos,  Nos cuenta que realiza sus recorridos todas las tardes ya que a esa hora su esposo ya está en la casa y puede cuidar a sus pequeños hijos, deja a crédito sus productos  y cobra cada quince días. La mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene dos  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace  dos años y medio y le gusta porque gracias a su primer crédito empezó su negocio. 

Sus sueños es seguir realizando sus ventas y tener un local donde vender.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the communal bank "Para el Futuro de la Mujer" meets in the Montecristi Canton. This place is known in the province and country for its rich traditional culture. One can find here a wide variety of handicrafts that are made by the local people following traditional customs.

Here we meet Mrs. Maricela, 25, who is married and has two children ages 2, and 7-months.  Her husband is an economist and works for a company.

Our friend sells all kinds of clothing, both on a door-to-door basis and out of her home where she attends to those customers she knows best.  She tells us that every afternoon she goes out to sell since her husband is home then to take care of the children.  Her products are sol on a cash basis and payment is collected every two weeks.  She goes to Guayaquil to buy the clothes when neccessary.  For two years she has been in business and it is going very well.

She plans to use the loan to buy merchandise such as trousers, blouses, t-shirts and childrens' clothing.  She has been involved with the communal bank for two and a half years and was able to start her business thanks to her first loan.

Her dream is to continue her sales activity and have a large shop someday.

loans.use: Comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 42 years old, married and has four children who are in school.  

For over ten years, he has operated a green grocery store.  He also grows coffee and rears goats for extra income.  Previously, he sold charcoal.

Bernard is a new member of Faulu Kenya, but he has become more business oriented through ideas he's shared with his group members.  

He has requested a 20,000 Kenya shilling loan to start a poultry farming business.

loans.use: To start poultry farming

loans.name: Nasrullo

texts.ru: Насрулло родился  23 февраля в 1990 году в Таджикистане. В 2008 года он окончил среднюю школу № 17  и поступил в Таджикский Национальный Университет в городе Душанбе. Сегодняшний день он учиться в 3-ем курсе данного университета. Он старательный и активный парень. Насрулло учиться отлично и хорошо и всегда старается выполнить все свои уроки во время. Займ запрашивает для оплаты обучения.
texts.en: Nasrullo was born on February 23, 1990 in Tajikistan. In 2008 he graduate from high school #17 and was admitted to the Tajik National University in the city of Dushanbe. He is now in his third year of study. He is   hard-working and energetic. Nasrullo gets good grades and always tries to finish all his assignments at time. He is requesting a loan in order to pay his tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay university tuition

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy shock absorbers, nuts and bolts, and brake pads

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is a hardworking businessman who is 34 years old. He is married and blessed with one child who is in school. For the last 10 years, he has been selling chicken to bring up his family. Jackson has employed one person to help him to manage the business. The major challenge he faces is competition. In the next five years, he plans to own a wholesale business. Since Jackson joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access loans to boost his business. He has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy chickens for resale.

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a very industrious mother who helps her husband operate their corn field business.  

She is 47 years old and has three school-age children.  Due to financial difficulty, she is asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and insecticides.  Rosemarie hopes that they will get better crop production during the next harvesting season so they can afford to pay for the schooling of their children.

Rosemarie is hoping that disastrous typhoons will not enter her country again, especially in her area so she can avoid farm income losses. 

She hopes that through her patience and hard work, she will be able to improve her family's standard of living.  Rosemarie would also like to see her children graduate from college.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Ignasius

texts.en:
Ignasius, 36, is married to Judriani, 35. They are blessed with two children: Wendo, 10, who is studying at elementary school grade 5 and Merlyn, 8, who is studying at elementary school grade 3.
Ignasius runs a tire repair business and sells gasoline. He started the business 8 years ago by selling gasoline. As his income started to improve he then purchased a compressor and a billiard table. 
Ignasius also sells rice to generate extra income. He is planning to buy more rice for resale. Due to his limited capital, Ignasius is seeking a loan of  10,000,000 IDR from Kiva partner TLM. He will use the loan to buy rice in large quantities. He hopes that his loan application will be approved by TLM.

loans.use: to purchase rice in large quantities.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin es un hombre admirable. Tiene 35 años y es un padre soltero,  vive con Ángel, su hijo de 5 años, en un cuarto alquilado en el distrito de Perené – Chanchamayo. Por problemas de incompatibilidad, Edwin se separó de la madre de su hijo, pero vive feliz al lado de lo más preciado que tiene. Ángel es su fortaleza  e inspiración para buscar el progreso. Por esa razón se dedica al trabajo duro del campo. Cuenta con parcelas de terrenos propias, en ellas cultiva café, cuya producción ha sabido negociar inteligentemente. Más adelante sembrará piñas ya que se está iniciando la temporada de sembríos. 
Así también se dedica a las labores del hogar, cocinando, lavando y atendiendo a su hijo.
Y como no se conforma, Edwin trabaja como guardia de seguridad para distintas empresas. Y en verano tiene planeado viajar a la ciudad de Lima para vigilar viviendas en el balneario de Asia (Sur de Lima), gracias a su hermano quien lo recomendó. Uno de los sueños realizables de Edwin es tener su casa propia, de esa manera le dará albergue y cobijo seguro a Ángel,  para ello trabajará igual o más duro que ahora. Este sería el préstamo número 5 de MFP, que obtendría gracias al apoyo de ustedes, por eso da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Con respecto a su banco comunal “Alto Yapaz” se siente respaldado y seguro gracias al trabajo solidario que realizan. Invertirá el dinero del crédito en la compra de un terreno de 6 por 10 metros en su comunidad, para iniciar la construcción de su casa propia, lo cual no costará mas de 1500 soles.
texts.en:
Edwin is a remarkable man. He is 35 years old and is a single parent. He lives with Ángel, his five year old son in a rented room in the district of Perené – Chanchamayo. Due to incompatibility issues, Edwin separated from the mother of his son, but lives happily by the side of the most precious thing that he has. Ángel is his fortitude and inspiration to seek progress. For that reason he does the hard work in the fields for a living. He has his own parcels of land, on which he cultivate coffee, whose production has been known to negotiate intelligently. Additionally, he will plant pineapples which are starting the seasonal crops.
Also he does the household chores: cooking, cleaning, and caring for his son.
As if that weren’t enough, Edwin works as a security guard for different companies and in the summer he has planned to travel to the city of Lima to guard resort homes of Asia (South of Lima), thanks to his brother who recommended it. One of Edwin’s realizable dreams is to have his own house, and in this way he will give refuge and secure shelter to Ángel. For that he will continue working hard or harder. This would be the 5th loan from MFP that he would obtain thanks to your support. For that he gives his word to be punctual with his monthly payments. With respect to his communal bank, “Alto Yapaz” he feels supported and secure thanks to the joint work that they do. He will invest the money from the loan into the purchase of land of 6 by 10 meters in his community, in order to begin the construction of his own house, which will not cost him more than 1500 soles.

loans.use: To buy land to build his house.

loans.name: Abdulmoin

texts.en:
Abdulmoin has been managing his clothing business for nine years. He is glad because he is able to earn P6,000 a month. He utilizes his profits for his children's allowances, tuition fees and daily needs. He is hard working person and industrious man.

Abdulmoin is 53 years old, married with five children. One of them is already married, two are still studying and the remaining two are working abroad. His family members help each other to improve their living condition. Abdulmoin would like to help his two children to finish their studies so that they can find better opportunities someday. He would like to ask for a loan P50,000 to improve and buy additional stocks of clothing for his retail business. He is hoping that his business will continually grow so that his income will continue to grow and provide for his family's living expenses.

loans.use: to buy clothing for his retail business

loans.name: Martha Leonor

texts.es:
La Señora Martha es socia del banco comunal Las Morlaquitas, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es desde diciembre de 1999 patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, cuenta con una gran belleza, riqueza natural y cultural, su gente es amable, cordial, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora Martha tiene 34 años, es madre soltera de un hijo de 14 años de edad que está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su mamá con quien comparte los gastos del hogar.
 
Ella es empleada privada hace 4 años y trabaja de lunes a viernes, los fines de semana trabaja ambulantemente en la venta de frutas y vegetales, negocio en el que se encuentra desde que tenía 14 años de edad.
 
Es su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su mamá. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de frutas y verduras para su negocio y también en pollos para iniciar con esta actividad.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha is a member of Las Morlaquitas Communal Bank. She lives in Cuenca, a city that was declared a World Heritage Site in December, 1999. It is known for its great beauty and natural and cultural riches as well as its friendly, cordial people who maintain the culture and traditions of their villages. 

Martha is 34 and is a single mother of a 14-yar-old son who is studying at a school in the city. She does not own her own home and lives with her mother with whom she shares household expenses.

She has been privately employed for 4 years and works Mondays to Fridays. On the weekends she is a street vendor, selling fruits and vegetables, a business she has had since she was 14 years old.

This is her second loan with the communal bank, which she was invited to join by her mother. She will invest this new loan in the purchase of fruits and vegetables for her business and also in chickens, so she can start another business.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables and chickens.

loans.name: Maria Natali

texts.es: A sus 22 años de edad, la joven Maria Natali se dedica a la cría y venta de cerdos en una finca familiar desde hace un año, gracias a la oportunidad que le dio un hermano para que utilizara un espacio disponible para que lo adecuara y construyera la vivienda para los cerdos. La joven Maria Natali es madre de 3 hijos de 7,5 y 4 años de edad, quienes requieren de muchos cuidados y gastos de sostenimiento, por lo cual necesita ampliar la vivienda de los cerdos (cochera) y comprar varios cerdos, con la esperanza de mejorar sus ventas y así poder brindarle un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en: At the young age of 22, María Natalí breeds and sells pigs at her family farm. A year ago, her brother gave her the opportunity to use an empty space, which she adapted to the construction of a pigpen. The young María Natalí is the mother of three children, aged 7, 5 and 4, who require much care and bring about high living expenses. This is why she needs to expand her pigpen and buy several pigs, hoping to increase her sales and thus provide her children with a better future.

loans.use: to expand the floor and the roof of her pigpen and to buy several pigs.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 26 year old single man from Al Hashmi Amman Jordan. He is requesting a loan of 1000 JOD to pay for his home improvements, he would like to maintenance of the room. he wants to provide for his family a good environment to live in.
Since Mahmoud is under 30 year old, his loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for his home improvements

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which is scarce of available land. He has 3 children, and has been doing this work for 12 years. His primary income sources are eggs, crops, and personal business.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'The yield and income.' His biggest challenge is: 'Lack of enough capital.' Animals on the farm have been given the name of 'Nyeusi.'

Thomas was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'Good customer care and service delivery.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'How to save.'

His highest monthly expenses are farming costs. When asked: 'How will this loan benefit his family', Thomas replied: 'Improve our lives.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Thomas owns the following: 'cow and poultry,' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net,' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, or DVD'.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Béatrice Saida's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de quatre personnes qui se cohabitent. La représentante du groupe, nommée Béatrice Saida (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo)âgée de 43 ans n’a pas fréquentée. Béatrice Saida est mariée à un certain Billa. Le couple n’a pas d’enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par le couple. C’est pour cette raison, que Béatrice Saida vend du riz et de l’huile végétale depuis vingt ans environ. Béatrice Saida s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Béatrice Saida ensemble avec les membres de son groupe sollicite pour une première fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter du riz et de l'huile végétale.

loans.name: Ami

texts.en:
Miss Ami D. was born in 1980 at Boloumodji (Tsévié). She is single without children and has a level of elementary studies. Feeling the hard difficult conditions of his future life, she was launched in the cereals produces and general food trading. She is living miserably in a renting house and comes to assist her old aged parents. Very serious and determine to succeed, she has the gift of businesses and show the proof of a young girl of trust from her two credits repaid without incident. To strengthen her activity, she requests a credit of $ 850 which will serve to buy the essential basic products. This project will allow her to hire a descent lodging, to take care of herself, to improve her living conditions and beyond that of her very old parents

Mademoiselle D. Ami est née en 1980 à Boloumodji Tsévié. Elle est célibataire sans enfant. Elle est de niveau d’études élémentaire.
