Sentant son avenir hypothéqué, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce des produits céréaliers et d’alimentation général. Elle vit péniblement dans une maison en location et vient en aide à ses parents avancés en âge. Très sérieuse et appliquée, elle a le don des affaires et fait preuve d’une jeune fille de confiance à partir de ses deux crédits remboursés sans incident. Pour renforcer son activité, elle sollicite un crédit de $850 qui servira à acheter les produits de première nécessité. Ce projet va lui permettre de se loger convenablement, de se prendre entière en charge, d’améliorer ses conditions de vie et par delà, celle de ses parents très fatigués.

loans.use: to buy the essential basic products

loans.name: Korkor

texts.en: Madame Korkor is a 72-year-old woman who has been left to fend for herself by her family. She therefore sells clothes to cater for her basic needs. She would like a loan of $650 to expand her business. She is familiar with the TEACH Lending program and simple accounting methodologies because she is a client of Kraban Support Foundation.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Dan

texts.en: The father is blind and his daughter just work as a day laborer just plants rice. They must provide food and school fees for 4 family’s members. Their income is low $ 9.375/person/month, so they want to borrow $75 to buy a steer to rise and they will pay back this money during 7 months.

loans.use: Cow husbandry

loans.name: Karen Lisbeth

texts.es:
Hi! My name is Karen. I have a small business that I run from home. I sell intimate clothes for women. I've had this business for about a year which has put me through school and helped my family financially. My plans are to open up a store where I can hire others and give them a job. It would be great if you can help me since I would like to purchase more merchandise to satisfy client demand.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola, mi nombre es Karen, yo tengo un pequeño negocio en mi casa de ropa intima para mujeres. Este negocio lo tengo hace un año el cual me ayudado mucho para poder terminar mis estudios y ayudar un poco a mi familia. Tengo planes de poner una pequeña tienda para poder dar trabajo a otras personas. Me gustaria que me ayudaran para poder comprar mas mercaderia ya que tengo varios pedidos.

loans.use: To purchase under garments & sleep wear

loans.name: Rren

texts.en: Mrs. Rren N. , 29, lives in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia with her husband, 31, and 3 children. Rren N. and her husband are both employed at a private company, earning $2.50 a day each. They have applied for this loan in order to buy a motorcycle so that they can get to work without having to pay the fares of moto-drivers.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to get to work

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Mr. Antonio C. is 45 years old, and married with two children. He is the owner of a tire repair shop in Caacupé, Paraguay. In addition to tires, his shop also does minor repairs and sells a variety of tires of various sizes and other hardware for automobiles. His business is located in a busy commercial zone, and because of this he is able to attract many customers. Antonio has been dedicated to his business for 12 years. He is thankful to have a job, which earns him enough money to take care of his family and educate his children.

The loan he has asked for would go towards buying more tires for his shop. He has been presented with the opportunity to acquire a larger quantity of tires at very low prices. However, in order to be able to buy this quantity right now he will need to secure a loan. The added inventory at lower costs will allow him to attract more customers and grow his business. His ultimate goal is to expand his business enough to be able to sell a greater variety of items in his store.

loans.use: To buy tires

loans.name: Clorinda

texts.es:
From a very young age Clorinda was always a capable girl with many goals in life. In order to better her domestic situation she looked for work immediately after concluding her studies in junior high. Because her parents didn’t have many economic resources to help out financially to fulfill he hopes and continue a professional career. Since then, thanks to the interest, dedication, and altruism that she put into her business it has been doing well. This permits her to offer her young daughter Luz a better quality of life, since she is her principal motive and what gives her drive to work relentlessly. Her ultimate desire is to rent another location much larger to transfer her clientele more comfort. In order to solidify her plans she wishes to obtain a load that she will invest completely in this project. Clorinda hopes to realize her plans with your generous help.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde muy jovencita Clorinda, siempre fue una muchacha hábil con muchas metas en la vida. Para mejorar su situación familiar buscó trabajar inmediatamente después de concluir sus estudios secundarios, porque sus padres no contaban con suficientes recursos económicos para que la apoyen a cumplir sus deseos y seguir una carrera profesional, desde entonces, gracias al interés, dedicación y altruismo que puso en su negocio de venta de abarrotes al por mayor está teniendo mucho éxito, permitiéndole ofrecer a su pequeña niña Luz una mejor calidad de vida, puesto que es su principal motor para trabajar incansablemente.El anhelo de esta ejemplar madre es alquilar otro local mucho más grande, para trasladar su mercadería para mayor comodidad de ella y sus clientes. Para concretar sus planes desea obtener un préstamo que invertirá totalmente en este proyecto.Clorinda espera contar con tu generosa ayuda para concretar sus planes.

loans.use: Rent a bigger location for her clients comfort, in order to be able to grant them a better service

loans.name: Ocheng B (I) Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Florence is a 48 year old widow with three children. She has a market stall where she sells raw foods like cassava stems, sweet potatoes, and matooke. She would like to use the profits to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs

loans.name: Nuri

texts.en:
Nuri N. is 49 years old, and is married with three children. Her husband is a pensioner, so Nuri is the main bread-winner in the family.

Nuri sells dried fruits and nuts in the central local market, and has been in this business for 11 years. Dried fruits and nuts are very popular in Tajikistan, and any hostess always has dried fruits and nuts available for serving in case there are guests. Moreover, dried fruits and nuts are, as a rule, served during family occasions such as wedding parties, birthday parties, and others. Considering the constant demand for this kind of goods, Nuri's business is quite successful and brings in a stable income for the family.

Now, Nuri is requesting 875.00 US Dollars for the term of 6 months. She is going to use the loan to purchase dried fruits like raisins and apricots, and nuts such as almonds and pistachios, in order to increase the range of goods for sale. Nuri has already demonstrated herself as a client with a positive credit history, and she would also like to thank everyone for their support and promises to pay the loan in time.

loans.use: Purchase dried fruits like raisins, apricots, and almonds, pistachios in order to increase the range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es:
Janeth has a mini sawmill, and her arduous work has intensified lately since her small shop where they work is located in her home, and the discomfort and lack of space have become more evident. For this reason, they have planned to move and to rent a space in an adequate place for its operation. With your important contribution, these beloved and hard-working parents will continue with their work.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Janeth tiene un mini aserradero y el arduo trabajo de un tiempo a esta parte se ha intensificado ya que el pequeño taller en el que laboran está ubicado dentro de su domicilio y la incomodidad y falta de espacio se han hecho más que evidentes por esa razón han planeado mudarse y alquilar un espacio en un lugar adecuado para su funcionamiento.Con tu importante contribución estos queridos y trabajadores padres continuarán con su labor.

loans.use: To move and to rent an adequate space to establish her shop

loans.name: Sili 1 Centre - Group 4

texts.en:
Faamalie and Aunuua from Sili 1, Savaii, are borrowing from SPBD for the first time. They both have undergone four weeks of training in business management and maintenance of a savings account, and have passed a written test on the SPBD principles: business, savings, weekly meetings, payments, and group guarantee. Over the next 52 weeks, they will support each other in their individual business development and in repaying their loans on time. 

Faamalie Fiti A., 67, widowed, has 10 children. She would like to enter the vegetable farming business. Her sons are already farmers. With her loan, Faamalie will purchase a knife, pesticides, a weed-killing sprayer, a spade, and a wheel barrow.    

Aunuua Fiu S., 37, is married and has 8 children. She has two years of experience in making handbags, a practice she learned from her sister-in-law. Her loan will be used to purchase plastic bags (clear and colored), materials, four scissors, and thread.

loans.use: Purchase of a weed-killing sprayer, machete, a spade, etc.

loans.name: Solemba Self-Help Group

texts.en:
Salima K. is an average Kenyan woman aged 30 and married with 4 children. Salima has been in this business for a period of 4 years, and she got her initial capital by accumulating savings from her former work place. Currently Salima deals in ladies’ wear, but she would like to diversify to men’s and children’s wear as well.

Salima purchases her bales of clothes every month from various shops in Nairobi, the capital city of Kenya. With the little profit she gets from her business, Salima is able to clothe, feed, and educate her children. With the help of her loan, Salima will be able to purchase clothes in bulk to enable her to increase her monthly sales. Her long term vision is to open up a boutique.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase clothes in bulk for re-sale

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
Mr. Sophat L., 42, and his wife, Mrs. Sophary Keang, 35, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 1994 and have three children, two sons and one daughter. All of them are in local schools.

Mr. Sophat has been a mechanic since 1991. He repairs all kinds of vehicles in his village and nearby villages, while Mrs. Sophary stays at home to take care of the children.

Now Sophat is requesting a loan of US$1000 to purchase a motorcycle to use in the family and to buy spare parts for his business of repairing vehicles.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to use in the family and buy spare parts for business of repairing vehicles.

loans.name: Paese

texts.en: Paese S., 22, is married with 3 children. She has 3 years of experience in the  fish business and also in vegetable selling. She sells to the village people 3 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD). SPBD loans are Paese’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Aall will be used for her vegestable business. Her husband is doing fishing while she is doing selling.

loans.use: Buy seeds, fishing net, and a new canoe.

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es:
Zulma Beatriz works at a company that offers all kinds of office equipment (copy, fax and other office machines). She lives alone with her two children (she is a single mom) and her work is the family’s sole source of income.

Her home needs some expanding being that the rooms are very small and the children need more space. Zulma has received loans from FVP before and has been punctual in her payments. She now looks for Kiva’s support to construct a room for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Zulma Beatriz trabaja en una compañía donde vende todo tipos de equipos de oficina (copiadoras, fax, y maquinas de oficina). Ella vive sola con sus dos hijos (es madre soltera) y su trabajo es la única fuente de ingresos de la familia.

La casa donde vive necesita una ampliación ya que los cuartos están reducidos y los niños necesitan mas espacio. La Sra. Zulma ya ha tenido créditos con FVP el cual ha sido puntual en sus pagos. Ella quiere ahora contar con el apoyo de Kiva para la construcción de un cuarto para los niños.

loans.use: Construction of a room for her children.

loans.name: Mwanakharusi's Jang'ombe Group

texts.en:
Mwanakharusi is 36 years old. She is married with 4 children aged between 19 and 7 years old. She has been a potatoes and spices seller since 2001. Every day, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Mwanakharusi is now requesting a loan to buy more potatoes and spices for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Mbake and Salma.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes and spices for her business

loans.name: Savalia

texts.en:
Savalia F., 31, is married with three children. She has many years of experience growing vegetables on her farm. She sells her crops to the villagers and the public three days per week.

Savalia has had one previous loan with SPBD. This loan will be used to purchase chemicals, pesticides and vegetable seeds for the business. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~41 USD). SPBD loans are Savalia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals, pesticides and vegetable seeds for the business

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida baji is a wife of M.. She has lived in Arifwala, Pakistan for the past 10 years. She is the mother of seven children: one son and six daughters. Her first two daughters are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. The other children are free and don’t do anything.

Zubaida baji’s husband has a shoe-selling business. He has been selling shoes for the past 5 years. Zubaida baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy more shoes for her husband's business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

The loan group includes three other members. Samina baji and Shamim baji each want a loan to buy cooking oil and spices for their food businesses. Naseem baji wants a loan to buy candies to sell in shops.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Marhamat

texts.en:
R. Marhamat has had her own business for the past 12 years. She runs a small store where she sells kid’s clothing at the market in Isfara,Tajikistan. Together with he husband, they have three children. 

Difficult living circumstances has forced her husband to leave for Russia to earn income. That’s why Marhamat’s business is an important source of income for her family. Marhamat's income helps her daughter with iniversity expenses and helps cover her parents' expenses too. 

Lending services from IMON were a key support for Marhamat as she has developed her business. She has proven to be a great client and has maintained a perfect payment record. Marhamat is requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni ($ 600 USD) to boost her available capital and allow her to purchase new inventory. We are grateful for the opportunity to further assist in the success of this dedicated entrepreneur.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing to increase her range of goods

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị H. năm nay 41 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1997. Hiện tại gia đình chị H.  đang chăn nuôi 500 con  gà vịt để phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Chồng chị ngoài thời gian làm ruộng, chăn nuôi còn đi phụ xây để tăng thêm thu nhập.  Với mức thu nhập 2.500.000đ/ tháng kinh tế gia đình chị hoà đang ngày càng ổn định hơn. 
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm 150 con gà giống và thức ăn phục vụ chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H. is 41 years old. She joined TYM Fund in 1997. Currently, her family raises 500 chickens and ducks to improve her family's livelihood. In addition to raising livestock, her husband also works as a construction worker. With an income of 2,500,000 VND her family's economy is gradually becoming more stable. She would like to borrow 10,000,000 VND to invest in 150 chickens and chicken feed for her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: M. is a widowed rice farmer with two children who lives in Phsaleu Village in Pursat Province, Cambodia. Growing rice is the main source of income for her  and she has been farming since 1990. Her daughter, Miss Chansy, 20, works growing rice with M. and they work hard every day to support themselves. She also cares for her elderly parents. Normally, she plows farmland, renting oxen from neighbors and paying a high rent. Hence, she wants to own oxen to use for her business but she lacks money to carry this project out. She would like to ask for a loan to purchase two oxen.

loans.use: to purchase two oxen for farming

loans.name: Asaf

texts.en:
Asaf is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town. He is settled in the Fuzuli region, in the Mahmudlu-1 village. Asaf was born in 1984. This young man is married and has a little daughter, who is one year old. 

Asaf has been in the sheep breeding business for six years. He is requesting a loan to purchase ten pregnant sheep to improve his sheep-breeding business.

He will sell the lambs of these sheep after six months and buy more pregnant sheep. This is a usual method for increasing the flock of sheep breeders. In the future, Asaf plans to build a winter stable and summer shed for his sheep.

loans.use: To purchase ten pregnant sheep

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Inés es socia del Bancomunal  Unidas Triunfaremos.
Inés es casada tiene 59 años, cuatro hijos 29, 28,26 y 16 años este ultimo en la escuela estatal.
Inés siempre se dedica a su casa, por que su esposo no quiso que trabaje y que cuide a sus hijos, y le apoye en el trabajo que él realizaba; Hace siete años  ella   empezó con una pequeña bodega “Diana” con pocas cosas, ahora gracias a los prestamos tiene un poco más surtida su bodega.   
Inés necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles,   para invertir en su bodega va comprar gaseosa, cerveza, azúcar, sal, arroz.  
Cuando entro a finca, ella no-tenia nada y gracias al préstamo que dan, pudo invertir y aumentar su capital. 
El sueño de Inés es que su  hijo el menor estudie una carrera que  sea un profesional, por que los demás no quisieron estudiar.
texts.en:
Ines is a member of the Communal Bank 'Unidas Triunfaremos' ('United we will Triumph').

Ines is married and is 59 years old with 4 kids who are 29, 28, 26 and 16, and the last one is at a state school.

Ines has always been in the house as her husband did not want her to work while looking after their kids, and he supported her with the work he did. Seven years ago she started a small grocery store called 'Diana', with a few things. Now, thanks to loans, she has stocked her store better.

Ines needs a loan of 2000 soles to invest in her store, and she is going to buy fizzy drinks, beer, sugar, salt, rice.

When she entered Finca she did not have anything and thanks to the loans they have given her she has been able to invest and increase her capital.

Ines' dream is that her youngest son would study a degree and become a professional, as the rest did not want to study.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ines needs a loan of 2000 soles to invest in her store, and she is going to buy fizzy drinks, beer, sugar, salt, rice./Inés necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles,   para invertir en su bodega va comprar gaseosa, cerveza, azúcar, sal, arroz.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris es socia del Banco Comunal Corí Soncco que significa Corazón de Oro en quechua.
Doris es casada, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, Doris se dedica a la compra y venta de tara, cochinilla, sus productos los adquiere en algunos pueblos y también los productores le traen a su casa, luego de acopiar los envía a la ciudad de Lima.
Doris necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tara, cochinilla.
Doris sueña con brindar una buena educación a sus hijos para que tengan un buen futuro y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Doris is a member of the “Corí Soncco” Communal Bank which means Heart of Gold in Quechua. Doris is married, 35 years old, and has 2 children. Doris buys and sells tara tree and pork She acquires her products in various towns and also the producers bring the items to her house, after gathering up her goods she sends them to Lima. Doris needs a loan for 1600 soles which will be invested in the purchase of tara tree and pork. Doris dreams of providing a good education to her children so that they can have a good future and also to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tara tree and pork

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience O. is 32 years old and married with four children. Three are schooling and the last born is breastfeeding. She and her husband are a humble couple who want to invest in their children's future by providing them with an education. Patience lives at Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

She sells foodstuffs such as cooking oil, tinned tomatoes, bags of rice, spices, vegetables etc. in the community market. She says these products move very fast and you can easily recover your money quickly. She takes delivery of goods from the surrounding villages and the capital city of Ghana. Patience deals directly with the wholesalers rather than retailers. She has eight years' experience in selling foodstuffs.

She is requesting a loan to buy more goods so that she can help her husband to raise the family. She will buy more bags of rice, cooking oil, tinned tomatoes, flour and margarine and other foodstuffs. Patience belongs to a village bank called ‘Adwumapa’ which means Good work.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs like cooking oil, bags of rice, spices and tinned tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled A. is 42 years old. He is married and the father of 5 children. He manages a grocery store where he sells bread, juice, sweets, and other preserved foods.  In order to expand the variety of goods that are sold in the store, Khaled is requesting a loan of US $1,200. Khaled is very grateful to everyone who will help him achieve business success with this loan.

loans.use: Increase variety of inventory

loans.name: Solmaz

texts.en:
Solmaz M. is a married mother of five children. She has spent all her life in touch with the land, since her parents and grandmother taught her how to farm. Agriculture and livestock are her passions, and she is highly motivated as these are the source of livelihood for her family.

Her husband is also a farmer and helps her with the business. She raises young calves until they have grown enough to be sold. She nurtures her animals with such care that she has a name for every animal. She would like to expand her business and purchase more young cattle. To reach her aspirations, Solmaz calls out to your generous hearts to receive the loan that she is requesting.

loans.use: To purchase three heads of cattle.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en: "After I resigned my previous job, I got married and we had three children. On the same date, I also started to grow seaweed. The income that I get from my farm has helped a lot in providing the needs of my wife as well as my children," says Wilfredo T., an entrepreneur and father of three children. He would like to ask for a loan of Php 25,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy additional seedlings for his seaweed farm. The loan will really help him improve their family income. CEVI aims to help small businesss to grow. It provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy additional seedlings for his seaweed farm

loans.name: Sujaddin

texts.en:
Sujaddin Q. is 34 years old and is married with two sons. He sells home products and other foodstuffs in the market and has been in this business for fifteen years. This activity generates the main income for his family.

Since Sujaddin is very popular in the market selling fresh and tasty foodstuffs, he tries to maintain a wide range of goods. Thus, today, Sujaddin requests $2,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Cervandicia

texts.es: Cervandicia tiene 58 años, vive con sus hijos Omar de 20 y Katy de 27 años, sus hijos mayores Simeón de 38 y Joel de 23 ya son independientes. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la elaboración de manualidades, las cuales aprendió asistiendo a unos talleres de capacitación y desde el primer momento le gustó esta labor, pues se siente muy contenta con la libertad de horarios que tiene, además de distraerse mucho realizándolo. Actualmente está trabajando en un pedido de vestidos para fiesta, que le hicieron para el centro comercial “Gamarra”, uno de los más conocidos de la ciudad de Lima. Su principal actividad consiste en adornar con mostacillas los vestidos que le dan a trabajar, lo bueno es que Cervandicia no trabaja sola, ya que tiene a 6 personas que la ayudan a bordar, pues sola no se daría abasto para terminar con la gran cantidad de vestidos. Además esta labor requiere de muy buena vista y paciencia para lograr encajar cada mostacilla en la aguja y darles un bonito acabado, con cada vestido se demora una hora, tomándole casi todo el día lograr una buena cantidad. Pero Cervandicia piensa seguir trabajando duro, como hasta ahora, para lograr expandir su negocio y tener un taller más grande. Este es su tercer préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y siempre ha sido muy puntual en todos sus pagos, sin tener problemas en cancelarlos a tiempo. Con el dinero solicitado comprará tela y mayor cantidad de materiales en mostacillas, hilos, etc., ya que cada vez aumentan su precio y es mejor comprarlos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Cervandicia is 58. She lives with her children; Omar, 20; and Katy, 27. Her older children; Simeón, 38; and Joel, 33; are independent. She has been making handicrafts for four years. She learned how to do this by going to a training shop. From the first moment, she liked the work. She is very happy with the scheduling freedom that she has and the enjoyment she gets from doing the work. She is currently working on an order for party clothes for the Gamarra business center, which is one of the most well known centers in the city of Lima. Her primary job is decorating the clothes with beads. The good part is the Cervandicia do not work alone. She has six people who help her embroider; she could not finish the large quantity of clothes by herself. This work requires good eyesight and patience to be able to put each bead on the needle and give it a pretty finish. Each outfit takes an hour, and it takes almost all day to complete a good quantity. Cervandicia will continue to work hard to expand her business and have a larger shop. This is her third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She has always been very punctual with all of her payments, and she has not had problems paying on time. She will use the money she is asking for to buy fabric and a larger quantity of beads and threads etc. Every time their price increases, and it is better to buy them wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials

loans.name: Normat

texts.en:
K. Normat is a humble man who earns a living in the cattle-farming business. He is the father of three children, who motivate him to work harder every day to be able to meet their needs. It is important to note that this business requires a lot of physical work, mainly because he needs to transport the animals from one point to another, crossing long distances under the exposure of the sun. This can cause illnesses and can weaken the body. Nonetheless, Normat continues to work hard and has now come to IMON International to obtain the loan that will allow him to purchase young bulls to raise and sell in his area.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing young cattle

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia, tiene un taller de costura donde elabora edredones y camas de bebe, tiene un hijo y esta separada de su esposo, es la única persona que solventa los gastos de su familia. 
Vive en la zona de Rió Seco de la ciudad de El Alto de La Paz. en casa de sus hermanos.
El crédito será destinado para el capital de inversión (compra de tela e hilos).
Es la octava vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su historial la califica como buena clienta.
texts.en:
Lidia has a sewing workshop where she makes quilts and baby bedding. She has one child and is separated from her husband. Therefore, she is the only wage earner in her family. Lidia lives in the Rió Seco area of the city of El Alto de la Paz with her siblings.

Her loan will be used to purchase fabric and yarn. This is Lidia’s eighth loan with IMPRO. Her payment history qualifies her as a good client.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric & yarn

loans.name: Iliana

texts.es:
Iliana es socia del Banco Comunal Kausachun que significa ¡Que Viva! En quechua.
Iliana es soltera, tiene 25 años y vive con sus padres, Iliana tiene un bar Discoteca llamado de Parranda, en un local alquilado, para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de personal, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Iliana necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de bebidas.
Los sueños de Iliana es estudiar otra carrera, tener otro negocio y apoyar a sus padres.
texts.en:
Iliana is a member of the Kausachun Community Bank (the name means “Long Live!” in Quechua). She is single, 25 years old, and lives with her parents. Iliana has a bar-discotheque called “Of Revelry” in a rented locale. She has employees and is busy there everyday.

Iliana needs a loan of $375 to buy drinks to sell. Her dreams are to study for another career, to have another business, and to assist her parents.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY DRINKS TO SELL

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth, who lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria, is a 40-year-old married mother of six children.  A seller of drinks and provisions, Elizabeth hopes for the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en:
Eseta I. is a 28-year-old woman living in the town of Tiavea.  She is married and has 3 school-aged children.  To make a living, Eseta owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community.  Eseta has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 600 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Eseta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Eseta is requesting for the first time a loan from SPBD.    Eseta is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Eseta plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ulziit

texts.en: D. is 30 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a house in the Uvurkhangai province of Mongolia. Her son and daughter both attend a local secondary school and her husband is a taxi driver in their town. D. operates a retail cosmetic business and beauty salon in a rented space. Her business started in 2000 and has grown steadily over the years due to her loyal customers. Twice a month, D. transports beauty products from Mongolia’s capital city, Ulaanbaatar, back to her business. She wants her children to be able to continue their education at university so that they can contribute to their country’s development. D. is requesting a 4,000,000 tugrug (~2800 USD) loan in order to purchase more beauty products and tools for her growing salon.

loans.use: To purchase more beauty products and tools for her growing salon

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn M. is 33 years old. She is married to a driver named Willie Sr., and they are blessed with four children: Edieber, 16, followed by Willie Jr., 13, Angelie, 8, and their youngest, Adrianne, who is five months old. They live in the small village of Santa Maria, Alicia, Isabela. Rice farming is one of the major sources of income in their village, and they only have a harvest season twice a year.

For almost one year now, Jocelyn has managed a typical retail store in her village. Her daily net income is 200 Philippine pesos (PHP). She is requesting a loan amount of 5,000 PHP from Kiva lenders, which she will use to purchase additional grocery items to sell.

According to Jocelyn, strong determination is one of the characteristics that one should develop in order to run a business that produces a bountiful income. She always gives her very best to improve her small general store.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items for her store.

loans.name: Josef

texts.en:
Josef is married with four children and his business is the only source of income for his family.

Josef has operated his workshop for fifteen years; his father used to work in it. He makes souvenirs from olive wood. He makes crosses, grottos, and many other souvenirs for Christians. He sells them to retail shops and merchants who export them to the U.S. and Europe. He appears in the photo at his workshop.

This is Josef’s second loan from FATEN. He has requested 2,000 USD to buy olive wood as now is the best time to buy it after the olive harvest.

loans.use: To buy more olive wood

loans.name: Nary

texts.en:
Mrs. Navy S., 30, and her husband, Mr. Srorn Sreng, 32, have been married for more than ten years. They have two children: one son and one daughter. Both of them currently attend school. The family lives in the area surrounding Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Navy has been a garment worker for more than eight years, while her husband has been a construction worker for more than ten years. Her kitchen is so small that the smoke blows into the house, making it both uncomfortable and unsafe for her family to sleep.

loans.use: To renovate the kitchen where she cooks.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: El señor Julio Cesar es casado y ya anteriormente ha tenido un crédito con nosotros para la realización de un cuarto en construcción en la parte trasera de su vivienda, el obtiene sus ingresos a través de la venta de barbacoa para la cual ya tiene varios trabajadores, y al igual que su esposa han demostrado ser una familia muy trabajadora y responsable que lucha para salir adelante, y demostraron un gran sentido de responsabilidad realizando sus pagos siempre con puntualidad y por ello están tramitando este crédito para el enjarre y colocación de alambrado eléctrico de su nuevo cuarto que construyeron con el crédito anterior.
texts.en:
Señor Julio Cesar is married and has already had a loan with us in order to construct a room at the rear of his house. He earns his income through the sale of barbecue and already has several employees. He and his wife have shown themselves to be a very hardworking and responsible family that fights to get ahead, and they have shown a great sense of responsibility in always making payments on time. That’s why they are seeking this loan for plaster and the placement of electric wire in the new room that they built with the previous loan.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installation of electric cable and plaster for interior walls

loans.name: Kutimuy Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Kutimuy que significa Regresa en Quechua, inicia su 41 ciclo con  14 socias.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. verduras, abarrotes en general, pescado, artesanía, golosinas, chicha, verduras, vino, comida, tuna.

Como es el caso D. la señora Aurea que es soltera, tiene 59 años y 3 hijos, Aurea venD. refrescos que prepara ella misma, sus ventas los realiza ambulatoriamente, además junto a sus hijos realizan artesanía en piedra D. Huamanga.

Marcelina es conviviente, tiene 40 años y 2 hijos, Marcelina se dedica a la compra y venta D. tuna que compra D. los productores y los venD. en la ciudad D. Lima, también compra tara y cochinilla.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600soles, 1000 soles  haciendo un total D. 8,300 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. frutas, tuna, tara, azúcar, arroz, fideos, pescado, piedra D. huamanga.

Los sueños D. las socias son tener casa propia, un negocio estable, sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The communal bank Kutimuy, which means "return" in Quechua, starts is 41st cycle with 14 members.

The members run different businesses such as selling vegetables, general groceries, fish, crafts, candies, a local drink, wine, foods, and prickly pear.

. One example is Aurea, who is single, 59 years old, and has three children. Aurea sells soft drinks, which she makes herself. She sells her product in the streets. Also, together with her children, she makes crafts in the Huamanga stone.

Marcelina lives with her partner, is 40 years old, and has two children. Marcelina buys and sells prickly pear which she buys from the producers and sells in the city of Lima. She also buys grasshoppers and the beetles that make red food and fabric dye.

The members need different loan totals such as 300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles, making a total of 8,300 soles ($2,875) in loan from the communal bank.

Their loans will be invested in buying fruits, prickly pear, grasshopper, sugar, rice, noodles, fish, and local stone.

The members dream of having their own houses, stable businesses, and that their children will be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits, prickly pear, grasshopper, sugar, rice, noodles fish, and local stone

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 26 years old, and he is still single. He lives in Nyaruguru, in the Southern Province of Rwanda.

Emmanuel started his business of selling secondhand clothes in 2008. He operates his business from 6 a.m. to 4 p.m. every day.

Emmanuel is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business through purchasing more clothes (clothes for babies and women) because he used to sell only men’s clothes. Because those clothes seem to be so much demanded by a number of his customers, he hopes to earn more profits.

With these profits, Emmanuel will build his secure future as he is also in the process of getting married.

loans.use: To buy secondhand clothes for babies and women

loans.name: Eab

texts.en:
Mrs. Eab K. is 47 years old and she lives in Chheu Teal Phluoh village, Takeo province. She is married with three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the last one is a student in the public school.

Mrs. Eab K. and her husband are farmers who own a 3-hectare field to cultivate rice on. They lack financial resources to support dry-season cultivation of rice. So now, Mrs. Eab K. is requesting 2,000,000 Riel from AMK to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline to support their crops. With the help of her loans from AMK, she has been able to increase the family income from her farming work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline for their crops

loans.name: José María

texts.es: José María H. M. de 53 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa, la cual se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar,  viven en San Francisco Goteras, ubicado en el departamento de Usulután. Desde hace 25 años atrás, que José se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, negocio el cual fue heredado por parte de su padre, y en el cual  posee mucha experiencia. De lunes a viernes José se encarga de vender el ganando y los sábados y domingos, compra el ganado necesario, para luego criarlos y venderlo. El solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar ganado, y comida de la mejor calidad para los animales, esto le permitirá aumentar el precio del ganado y la calidad de productos que comercializa, de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas. José es un hombre muy trabajador el cual depende por completo de este negocio, es por ello que es de mucha importancia el poder mantenerlo a flote, ya que es la única fuente de ingresos que posee. Él desea aprovechar no solo la experiencia con la que cuenta sino también el terreno que tiene el cual es apto para la crianza del ganado.
texts.en:
Jose Maria Hernandez Martinez is 53 years old. He lives with his wife, who is a housewife. They live in San Francisco Goteras. located in the department of Usulután. For 25 years years, Jose has been buying and selling cattle. He inherited this business from his father, and he has a lot of experience in it. From Monday through Friday, Jose sells the cattle. On Saturdays and Sundays, he buys the necessary cattle to then raise them and sell them. He is asking for a loan with which he can buy cattle, and a better quality of feed for the animals. This will allow him to increase the price of the cattle and the quality of the product that he sells, and thus increase his sales. Jose is a very hardworking man who depends completely on this business. This is why it is very important for him to keep it afloat, since this is the only source of income that he has. He wants to take advantage not only of the experience that he has, but the land that he has which is suited for raising cattle.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase feed and cattle.

location.town: San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán

loans.name: Mari

texts.es:
Mari tiene 33 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y alegre; vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Jeremías de 24 años, quien trabaja como obrero en una mina de la zona, y con sus dos menores hijos, a los cuales desea dar una buena educación.

La siembra de papa, choclo y alverja es la actividad a la que se dedica. Todas las mañanas, desde muy temprano, trabaja en sus chacras para hacerlas más fértiles y que así sus cultivos sean más abundantes y tenga más productos para llevar a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden malograr sus sembríos. Lleva 18 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado, ya que tiene que llevarlos con mucho cuidado. Con el tiempo, desea tener un puesto de ventas fijo.

Este es el sexto préstamo de Mari con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy comprometida con el desarrollo su grupo. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará semillas de alverja, también abono e insecticidas para sus chacras.
texts.en:
Mari is a 33-year-old woman who is very unassuming and cheerful. She lives in her own house with her husband, Jeremías (age 24), who works as a miner in the area, and their 2 under age children, to whom she wishes to give a good education.

She grows potatoes, corn and peas for a living. Every day, she wakes up very early in the morning to make her crop fields more fertile so that they can be more abundant and she can have more produce to sell at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma.

What she likes most about her job is protecting her fields from any pests that can spoil the crops. She has been in business for 18 years, and she thinks that the most difficult thing for her is transporting her produce to the market because she has to do so with much care. In the future, she would like to have her own permanent produce stand.

This is Mari's sixth loan from MFP, and she is ready and willing to repay her loan punctually. She is very committed to the development of her group at her communal bank. With the 3,000.00 PEN that she is requesting, she will purchase pea seed, fertilizer, and insecticide for her crop fields.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds, fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Nou's Group

texts.en: This loan group has five members, all of whom live in Preaek Bak village in Kandal province. Mrs. Nou K. was elected leader by the members, each of whom  will use this loan for a different purpose. Nou K. and her husband are farmers who own a half-hectare of land on which they will grow vegetables to sell, which is how they support their family. It is time to plant their crop but they need money to buy corn and sesame seed, which is why they are applying for this loan. The couple has three children, all of whom are in school.

loans.use: To buy corn and sesame seed

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa S. sells a variety of biscuits at Jukwa market. Adwoa has not received any form of education. She is a widow blessed with two children. She is responsible for the welfare of the home. Her loan will serve as additional income to be added to her business income to buy more provisions and biscuits to sell to her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her expanded business to save to build a shop.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and biscuits to sell to her customers

loans.name: Alttsetseg

texts.en:
Alttsetseg is a widow and the mother of three children. She and her family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest daughter, aged 14, attends a local secondary school. Her two youngest daughters, aged 12 and seven, attend a local primary school. Alttsetseg operates a second-hand products trading business at a market called Yalalt. She has been operating her business since 1995, and has gained significant experience and steadily expanded her business.

Since Alttsetseg's husband passed away, she has been operating her business and taking care of her family on her own. She is a very hard-working person and is optimistic about the future. To save on transportation costs, she purchases her products with other traders. Alttsetseg purchases her products once or twice a month and spends 800,000 – 1,200,000 tugrugs (~570 – 860 USD) per purchase. As her business is the only source of income for her family, it is very important to her. She says, “As prices have increased, being in business requires more working capital. I will operate my business from one shipping container until my daughters have grown up.” She is requesting a 2,200,000 tugrug (~1570 USD) loan to purchase second-hand products for summer which she will sell from her shipping container.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand clothes

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofía  vive en la zona “Rio Seco”, ubicada en una zona populosa de la ciudad de El Alto.

Es casada y vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y su hijo.

Trabaja  como administrativa en una radioemisora local de la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito lo destinará en la adquisición de materiales de construcción (cemento, arena, piedra, etc.) para realizar mejoras en la infraestructura de su vivienda y así mejorar su calidad de vida
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Sofia lives in the Rio Seco (Dry River) area located in a very populated part of the city of El Alto. She is married and lives in her own home with her husband and their son. She works as an administrative assistant in a local radio station in La Paz. She will use the loan to buy construction materials (cement, sand, rocks, etc.) to make improvements to her home and improve her quality of life. This is her first loan through Impro; her evaluation qualified her to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Mame Cheikh

texts.fr: Monsieur Mame Cheikh F. est un jeune tailleur de 26 ans qui a commence à exercer ce métier depuis 1999 après  avoir quitte les bancs de l’école. C’est en 2006 qu’il a ouvert un atelier de couture en association avec son frère qui a présentement  voyage et vit au Gabon. C’est une activité  qu’il a choisi par amour. Monsieur F.  est membre de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis janvier 2010 et il sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs. L’objet de son prêt est l’achat d’une machine a coudre dans le but de renforcer son outil de production. Et avec l’accroissement de ses gains  il parviendra a mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille car il est célibataire mais soutien t ses parents qui sont établis  au village.
texts.en:
Mr. Mame Cheikh F. is a young tailor, aged 26, who started working at his trade in 1999 after having dropped out of school. In 2006, he opened a clothing workshop along with his brother, who is presently on travel and living in Gabon. Mr. F. chose tailoring for the love of it. He has been a member of Baye Laye branch since January 2010 and is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs. The purpose of his loan is to buy a sewing machine with the aim of enhancing his tool of production. With the growth in his profit, he will manage betterin providing for his family, since he is unmarried and supports his parents, who are situated in the village.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a sewing machine

loans.name: Tailoring Group

texts.en: Korbo B., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called "Tailoring." She is 28 years old, married and has two children 3 and 5 years old. She was not able to attend school due to lack of financial support. For 3 years, she has been sewing and selling garments and school uniforms in the ELWA community outside Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more cloth to sew more garments and school uniforms. She describes herself as easy going. Her goal is to improve her business and continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more cloth to sew more garments and school uniforms.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith G. is from the village of San Roque, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 35 years old, is married, and has six school-aged children. Judith owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Judith joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Milagro De La Paz

texts.es:
Milagro tiene 24 años de edad, reside en San Fransico Gotera, departamento de Morazan, es soltera vive los padres, y tiene un negocio de procesamiento de productos lacteos.
Hace tres años se deica al procesamiento y venta de productos lacteos, el cual se lo enseño la madre y le colabora en el procesamiento, ella compra la leche a otras personas, elabora y comercializa el queso y crema en la casa de avitacion, sus cleintes son en mayoria los vecinos, Milagro se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar un prestamo para compra de leche por mayor y que le den un precio bajo permitiendole continuar con el necocio, obtener mayores ingresos.
los sueños ser una proveedora al mayoreo de productos lacteos, y poder dale una mejor calidad de vida a la familia.
texts.en:
Milagro is 24 years old and lives in San Fransico Gotera, in the Morazan department. She is single, lives with her parents, and runs a business processing milk products. She’s been processing and selling milk products for the past three years. Her mother taught her how to do this and helps her with the processing. She buys her milk from other people and uses it to make cheese and cream in her home. Her neighbors are her primary customers. Milagro has seen the need to request this loan so that she can buy milk in bulk, which she can do at better prices, and which will allow her to continue with her business and obtain greater earnings. Her dream is to become a large provider of milk products and be able to give her family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Milk in bulk

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es:
El señor es casado, vive en el barrio San Miguel de la ciudad de Pilar, su señora es ama de casa, es empleada del estado.
Posee casa propia, con las comodidades dentro del bienestar familiar, posee móvil de transporte propio, camioneta, moto.
El mismo es comerciante, también cuenta con una  empresa de servicios que realiza la actividad de ventas de servicios de comidas.
Solicita el crédito para compras de insumos para su negocio como: harina, fideos, azúcar, lácteos, panificados, aceites y otros.
Cuenta con una antigüedad en el ramo más de 10 años.
Agradece también a la Organización por los buenos servicios que le brinda la institución para su empresa comercial y de servicios.
texts.en:
The gentleman is married, lives in the city of Pilar’s San Miguel neighborhood, is a state employee and his wife’s a housewife. He owns his own house with all the basic comforts and owns his own means of transportation: a pick-up truck and a motorcycle. He is a merchant and also has a firm that provides meals. He is asking for funds to buy ingredients for his business like: flour, pasta, sugar, dairy products, baked goods, cooking oils and others. He has over 10 years experience in this line of work. He is grateful to the Organization for the good services it provides his commercial and service firm.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, pasta, sugar, dairy products, baked goods, cooking oils and others.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda N. is from Barangay Tuao North, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 58 years old, married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Rosalinda owns & operates a business selling fruits & vegetables in the local community. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosalinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rosalinda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Rosalinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 30 years old and married.  He is a hardworking man who owns and runs a retail shop.  He hopes to expand the business in the future.  He is a member of Destiny Group under Faulu Kenya.  In the group, the members save money, guarantee each other loans, and share business ideas.

Daniel has requested a loan of 20,000 KES through the group.  With the loan, he will buy wheat flour.  He sees himself expanding his business into a big wholesale business.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour

loans.name: Olga Guadalupe

texts.es: Olga Guadalupe D. L. N. es madre soltera D. tres hijos los cuales quiere ofrecerles una mejor calidad D. vida, pues ella se dedica a vender en la pulga como lo es la ropa usada, zapatos y bolsas a un bajo precio para así cubrir sus gastos. La vivienda que tiene la construyo con ahorros propios lo cual le hace falta el remodelar su baño.
texts.en:
Olga Guadalupe D. L. N. is a single mother of three children, for whom she wants to proviD. a better quality of life. She works at a flea market selling used clothing, shoes, and bags at a lower price to cover her expenses. She built the house where she lives with her own savings, but she still hasn’t remodeled her bathroom.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To remodel her bathroom

loans.name: Uranjargal

texts.en:
Mrs. Uranjargal is 44 years old and lives with her husband, Erdenesukh (48), and son, Munkherdene (16), in a rented house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has one more son who studies at a local University and lives separately. 

Uranjargal’s husband is a taxi driver. Since 1996 Uranjargal has been running a retail business. She rents space in Bayanzurkh market and sells a variety of domestic cleaning products. She buys her products from wholesalers who import them from China and Russia. Her starting capital was 500 USD. Today, her working capital is 2500 USD. 

She is a very hardworking and persistent person. Her future plan is to improve her family’s living conditions by buying a family house and to give her kids a good education. 

The loan Mrs.Uranjargal is requesting will be used to pay her son’s annual University fee and to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to pay her son’s annual University fee and to increase her working capital

loans.name: Kaneez Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Kaneez Fatima belongs to Kasur, which is a small city famous for its leather industry, in Punjab, Pakistan. She has a two-room brick house where she moved 10 years ago with her family.   

She has a business of making thread rolls. She gets thread from old, warm clothes such as sweaters and sells to different thread dealers at the market to earn a good income. She started doing this work when she moved to Kasur. She does this work to help her husband financially. 

Kaneez has given birth to a son who is just 8 years old and studying in 3rd class. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her thread-roll business. With the loan, she will buy warm clothes such as sweaters in a bulk quantity and get thread from them for selling.  

She hopes that through this investment, her income will double in size and she will gradually take her business toward success.

loans.use: To buy sweaters for making and selling rolls of thread

loans.name: Matilde Del Carmen

texts.es: Matilde del Carmen H. de 36 años de edad, es madre de dos pequeños de 10 y 7 años de edad, junto a los cuales vive en el departamento de Cuscatlán, así mismo vive junto a su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura. Matilde posee una tienda de productos de primera necesidad como comestibles y productos de uso diario en el hogar, muchos productos poseen una gran demanda por parte de las personas, las cuales Matilde desea mucho poder aumentar, ya que le permitirán tener mayores ganancias lo cual es muy importante para ella, ya que es gracias a la tienda que tanto ella como su esposo poseen una vida estable. Matilde solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la tienda comprando productos como leche en polvo, pan, golosinas y sodas, entre otro número de productos más. Matilde posee una gran ilusión de poder ver su negocio en mejores condiciones y de esta manera salir adelante.
texts.en: Matilde del Carmen H., 36, has two young children, 10- and 7-years old, respectively.  They live in the Salvadoran "departamento" of Cuscatlan, along with Matilde's husband, a farmer.  Matilde operates a business selling everyday commodities, the food and other products that people use at home every day.  Demand among her customers for some of her products is greater than for others and Matilde wants to increase her inventory of the products in more demand so that she can, in turn, increase her income.  Increasing her income is important to her because the family budget depends as much on her income as on her husband's.  Matilde is applying for a loan so that she can buy merchandise--powdered milk, bread, snacks and sodas, among other things--that she will then resell.  Matilde feels empowered by the success of the business and sees it as a way to move ahead.

loans.use: Compra de productos perecederos.

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en:
This is 49 year old Amadu. He is married and has 8 children ages 5, 8, 10, 12, 14, 16, 18 and 22 years. He has 8 additional dependents living with him who help him with his business.
In 1990, Amadu established his fish business as a way of improving his standard of living. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 1,200,000 SLL every month. He needs a loan of 3,000,000 SLL in order to buy additional stock for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 800,000 SLL.
In the future, Amadu plans to be a wholeseller and becomes a supplier to other traders. He also hopes to educate his children to university level. Amadu is serious and determined.He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of dry fish

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
56-year-old Daniel is a resident of Kisii Town in Western Kenya and has been doing mixed farming for over twenty years. He produces tea, vegetables, maize, beans, bananas and poultry which he sells on the local market. He has employed four farmhands. He has seven children with one still attending school.

He has requested this loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the dairy cow will reduce his family's expenditure and expand their income and asset base. He is focusing on having three dairy cows and opening a retail shop for his products.

Fluctuating weather patterns and high cost of pesticides are his greatest challenge.

loans.use: Purchase of  a dairy cow

loans.name: Glory

texts.en:
Glory D. R. is from the village of Rizal West San Isidro. She is 55 years old. Glory is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Glory owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Glory has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP when she sells one of her raised animals.

In 2006, Glory joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Glory has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Glory is requesting a new loan of 18000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Glory from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Fawziye

texts.en: Fawziye is a 58-year-old married woman; the mother of five children. She has been working as a tailor from home for 30 years. Fawziye is good at her work and well known in her area. She lives in a popular neighborhood. Fawziye is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy a modern sewing machine that can ease her work and help her finish it faster. Fawziye hopes to open a shop in the future and expand her business more.

loans.use: To buy a modern sewing machine

loans.name: Adil

texts.en: M. is currently in a business of selling matooke and yams. She is 35 years old, married to a businessman with seven children and only two go to school. M. borrowed a loan to stock more matooke and yams. She hopes to increase her business in future.

loans.use: Stock more matooke(unripped bananas) and yams.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes N. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Agnes has a business selling fruits and vegetables, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Agnes has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase fruits and vegetables for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Agnes hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to take a course in tailoring.
Agnes is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to work with others – developing team work skills has helped her understand what she did not previously know, mostly in terms of business.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Muhoi

texts.en:
Muhoi K. has been practicing mixed farming for twelve years now in Murang'a town, central Kenya. He sells his tea through Kenya Tea Development Authority and milk to the local market. He depends primarily on the income from his farm to cater for the basic needs of his family.

Muhoi is 44 years old and married with 3 children, who all attend school.

Muhoi has requested a loan of 55,000 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo, for poultry farming. This loan will allow him to buy layers and chicken feed, which will enable him to expand his poultry farming. The extra income from the the sale of eggs will help improve his family's livelihood. In the future, he would like to expand his poultry farm and raise broilers as well. He says that diseases and the high cost of chicken feeds against low prices of eggs have been his major challenges.

loans.use: poultry farming.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 23-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and three siblings. He has been working as a freelance car trader and broker for 6 years.  He helps his father to support the family. He obtained his first Kiva loan and he was an excellent client with on-time payments. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform the needed maintenance on the cars before selling them so that he can guarantee his clients that they will purchase a safe car with top quality, inside and outside. In the future, he is hoping to expand his business and open his own car showroom.

loans.use: to perform the needed maintenance on cars he will sell

loans.name: Sainte Therese Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SAINTE THÉRÈSE est né au jour de l'inauguration du Banc Villageois de SAINTE ANNE1 qui l'abrite. Il est composé de 10 femmes qui sont de quartiers différents mais qui se réunissent tous les mois pour les activités du Banc Villageois. Leurs activités sont très diverses: elles font de l'élevage, de l'embouche porcine, du petit commerce etc.

Madame Louise Coumba D. (à droite de la photo) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 36 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants en charge. Elle a aussi la garde de ses deux petites sœurs et d'un garçon qui lui est confié par des proches. 

Elle fait de l'élevage de porcs depuis environs 05 ans. Elle fait également de l'abattage de porcs. Elle achète des porcs adultes les fait abattre pour vendre la viande au kg. Sa clientèle est constituée de son voisinage immédiat. 

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra d'acheter 05 pourceaux qu'elle va élever et 04 porcs adules destinés à l'abattage.

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille. Par exemple l'achat de la nourriture, prise en charge de la santé des enfants et la participation à la prise en charge de leur scolarité
texts.en: The Sainte Thérèse solidarity group began on the same day as the inauguration of the Banc Villageois of Sainte Anne, which hosts it.  It is made up of 10 women who are from different neighborhoods but who come together each month for the operation of the Banc Villageois.  Their businesses are very diverse: they raise livestock, fatten pigs, run small businesses, etc.  Madame Louise Coumba D. (to the right of the photo) is the leader of the group.  She is 36 years old.  She is married and the mother of three children, who are in her care.  She also cares for her two little sisters and a boy who is entrusted to her by her close friends.  She has raised pigs for around 5 years.  She slaughters the pigs as well.  She buys adult pigs and slaughters them to sell the meat by the kilogram.  Her customer base is made up of her immediate neighbors.  This new loan will allow her to buy 5 piglets, which she will raise, and 4 adult pigs meant for slaughter.  Her objective is to support her husband in caring for the family.  This includes purchasing food, caring for the health of the children, and participating in paying for their education.

loans.use: to purchase 5 piglets and 4 adult pigs

loans.name: Kakin

texts.en:
Kakin A. is 54, widowed, and has five children.  She has been engaged in cattle breeding and land cultivating since 1994. Her elder son Abylgazy is her main helper, who in spite of his disability, makes every effort to provide his family with all they need. 

Kakin and her son cultivate beans and potatoes and also run a farm with one milk cow and twenty sheep. These activities allow them to earn about 6,500 KGS a month.  Kakin plans to use her loan of 120,000 KGS to purchase milk cows, which will allow her to increase her milk and meat sales. With the revenues, she plans to help her son build a barn for the cattle and to reconstruct her house. 

About Bai-Tushum and Partners:

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to expand her farm

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther W. M. is a 29-year-old businesswoman. She operates a salon so as to earn a living. She has been in the business for eight years and has employed one person. She also sells secondhand clothes for extra income.

Since Esther joined Faulu Kenya, a partner of Kiva, she has been able to boost her business with her previous loans. She has requested 20,000 KES to add to her stock of clothes and buy hair weaves, chemicals, combs and a hair drier.

loans.use: To add to her stock of clothes and buy hair weaves, chemicals, combs and a hair drier

loans.name: Jerlyn

texts.en:
Jerlyn is 38 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jerlyn is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase pigs, feed and vitamins. Jerlyn has been raising pigs for 9 years and also earns additional income from a transportation (tricycle) business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream:  to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase pigs, feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Petrona Yojana

texts.es: Yojana Petrona tiene 43 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería. Desde hace mas de 9 años que tiene este negocio, ella ha sido una mujer muy emprendedora que disfruta de su actividad económica, por lo que siempre le ha gustado relacionarse con sus clientes ya que la mayoría son sus vecinos, amigos y familiares. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, granos básicos, refrescos, papel y más productos. Su sueño es ver su tienda abastecida y contar con lo necesario para que los clientes siempre encuentren lo que buscan. Para él lo más importante son sus clientes siempre se preocupa por brindarles el mejor servicio y de hacerlos sentir que son importantes, de esta forma ha logrado una clientela muy grande y cada día le demandan más sus productos.
texts.en:
Yojana Petrona is 43 years old and runs a grocery store.  She has owned this business for more than nine years.  Yojana is a very entrepreneurial woman who enjoys her work.  She has always enjoyed interacting with her custoemrs since most of them are her neighbors, friends and family members.

Yojana requires this loan to buy candies, soft drinks, bread, basic grains, paper and other products.  Her dream is to have a well-stocked store and to have available everything that her customers need so that they always find what they are looking for.  Yojana's customers are very important to her.  She always tries to provide them with the best service she can and tries to make them feel important.  In this way, she has managed to attract a lot of customers and every day they request more of her products.

loans.use: to buy candies, soft drinks, bread, basic grains, paper and other products

loans.name: Cesar Daniel

texts.es:
El señor Cesar Daniel esta solicitando un préstamo para la construcción de un cuarto al frente de su casa ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la compra de material que es block, cemente y varilla y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora. 
Don Cesar Daniel se dedica a la elaboración de figuras de fiero este negocio es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia, con una parte de estas ganancias pagara el crédito.
El cuarto que construirá será para que sus dos hijos tengan su propio espacio para ser las tareas de la casa. Desea que tengan la comodidad necearía y segura para que puedan terminar sin ningún problema sus estudios.
texts.en:
Cesar Daniel is requesting a loan to construct a room at the front of his house, since he does not have the money he needs to buy the materials, such as blocks, cement, and reinforcing bars, and to pay the person who will carry out the work.
