Cesar Daniel works making figures in cast iron. This business is the source of income he has for his family, and he will pay off the loan with part of these earnings.

The room he is going to build is to give his two children their own space to do their homework. He wants them to have the necessary comfort and security so that they can complete their education without any problems.

loans.use: to build a room at the front of his house.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok, 48, has been working in crop-planting since 2000 in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham. From this work, she can generate an average income of US $2.5 each day. 

She was married but she is divorced from her husband and currently lives with her two married children. One of her children sells many kinds of goods in a kiosk store. 

Besides the farming business, Sok also assists her daughter in the same business and the photo shows her in front of this store. Sok would like to apply for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers and other farming materials in order to start to plant her crop.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers and other farming materials in order to start to plant her crop.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with two children, all of whom are still too young for school.  She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is for the family.

For the past four years she has operated a tailoring business, making dresses and uniforms for sale from home to her neighbors and parents with school going children.  Mejumaa faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation incurred when purchasing materials for her business.  She dreams of becoming self reliant in the future.

With the KES 15,000 loan she wants to purchase clothing material and thread for her tailoring business.  She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase clothing material and thread for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet, 34 years old, is a married woman who has three school-aged children. To make a living, Juliet owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. Juliet's main source of income comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Juliet has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

Juliet is asking for a loan of PHP 16,000 to buy fertilizer and seeds to grow her corn farm.

In the future, Juliet hopes that her corn will grow better and increase her profit, which she will use to supply the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds to grow her corn farm.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is a married lady with four children.  She operates a boutique to earn a living. She has been in the business for 11 years. She has grown her business with her previous loan from Faulu Kenya. Monica hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future. She has requested 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy clothes, shoes and cosmetics.

loans.use: To buy clothes, shoes and cosmetics

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha is a farmer from the village Vale, South Georgia. He is 47 years old and lives with his wife Venera and  two sons – 23 and 21 years old — and his 83-year-old mother (retired). Gocha’s sons are students. 

Gocha grows potatoes and cabbages on a family owned plot of land. Harvested vegetables are sold locally to vegetable retailers. At the same time, the family runs a sheep-breeding operation. They have approximately 350 sheep and sell on average 10 lambs per month. Total average monthly income of the family is 1100 Laris, including the pension of Gocha’s mother. 

With the requested credit Gocha plans to supply his sheep with food for the winter. In particular, he will use it for pressing the hay and bringing it home. The supplied hay will be enough for the sheep and lambs for the winter season. 

Starting in September, the most significant part of the family’s income will be used for financing Gocha’s son’s education at the high school.

loans.use: to pay for pressing hay and transportation it home

loans.name: Noel

texts.es: El señor Noel, se dedica a la fabricación de mallas,  casado con la señora Lenndy, desde hace 3 años, tienen 2 hijos y actualmente están dedicados a este emprendimiento de la fabricación de mallas olímpicas, toda la familia se dedica a esta actividad, necesitaban el préstamo para la compra de motor eléctrico y materia prima y así poder  equiparse poco a poco y formar una empresa rentable ya que tienen muchos pedidos. El cliente esta agradecido con ese crédito.
texts.en:
Sr. Noel manufactures screens. He has been married to Sra. Lenndy for three years. They have two children and currently engage in this venture of making large screens. Everyone in their family participates in this business. Noel needs a loan to buy an electric motor and raw materials so that he will be equipped. Gradually over time, he hopes to have a profitable business since he already has many orders.

Noel is grateful to Emprender for this loan.

loans.use: to buy an electric motor and raw materials for making screens.

loans.name: Maria Del Rocio

texts.es: Rocío tiene 37 años de edad, ella es originaria de una localidad rica en cultura e historia, ella es madre soltera y tiene un niño de 9 años de edad el cual estudia la primaria y el orgullo de ella ya que es un buen deportista seleccionado en futbol de su escuela. Doña Rocío tiene una tienda de abarrotes en casa de su mama desde hace cinco años, dice que abrió su negocio para ayudar a sus papas con los gastos de la casa ya que le dan permiso de vivir ahí con su hijo, ella esta pidiendo un crédito en la financiera para comprar artículos para su tienda de abarrotes como leche, huevo, aceite, arroz, dulces, refrescos, galletas, enlatados etc. ella surte ese tipo de productos en diferentes tiendas de su localidad donde le dan precios baratos para después ella ganarle algo a los productos que vende en su tienda de abarrotes. La meta que tiene la señora Rocío es tener mejor surtida su tienda para que sus vecinos no se trasladen hasta el centro de la localidad para que no gasten en trasportes y ella tenga ganancias.
texts.en:
Rocío is 37 years old and originally from a town that is rich in culture and history. She is a single mother and has a nine-year-old son who is in elementary school. Doña Rocío has managed a grocery store at her mother’s house for the past five years. She said that she started this business in order to help her parents with the household expenses since they have allowed her and her son to live with them.

Rocío is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy products for her grocery store such as milk, eggs, oil, rice, candy, soft drinks, cookies, canned goods, and other items. She acquires these types of products from different stores in her town where the prices are lower. This allows her to earn some profit when she sells these items in her grocery store. Her goal is to have a well-stocked store so that her neighbors do not have to travel to the central part of town. They save on transportation costs and she is able to earn some profit.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Transito Dolores

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres De Lucha se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Transito, tiene 62 años de edad, hace varios años atrás su esposo falleció y quedo muy triste y sola, pero sus 4 hijos frutos de esta relación fueron su soporte y razón de seguir adelante, en la actualidad ya todos son mayores de edad pero  aun viven con ella. 

Nuestra amiga para ganarse el sustento diario y para sacar adelante a sus hijos continuo con el negocio que tenía su querido esposo, ella tiene un puesto en el mercado en el cual todos los días vende frutas y legumbres, además también vende plátano al menudeo y por racimos, trabaja todos los días desde las 05h00 hasta las 19h00, dice que es un trabajo duro pero que lo hace con gusto ya que así recuera a su esposo cuando trabajaban juntos, tienen este negocio ya por casi 40 años desde que su esposo empezó.
 
Este crédito es para comprar plátano, otras frutas y legumbres. Lleva tres años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda y apoyo del grupo y de la institución.
 
Sus sueños son tener un local propio.
texts.en:
The Mujeres de Lucha [Women of Struggle] Communal Bank meets twice a month in the parish of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for being a commercial zone and for its traditional Saint Peter and Saint John festivals and for the happiness of its people.

In this place we meet Transito, who is 62 years old. Her husband died some years ago, and she is very sad and lonely, but her four children are her support and reason to carry on. They are all adults now but still live with her.

Our friend, in order to survive daily and to secure a good future for her children, continues with the business that her beloved husband had. She has a place in the market and every day sells fruits and vegetables, and bunches of bananas. She works every day from 5:00am until 7:00pm. She says that it is hard work but she does it with enthusiasm remembering her husband and how they worked together in this business that he began almost 40 years ago.

This loan is to buy bananas, and other fruits and vegetables. Transito has been with the communal bank for three years and she likes the help and support of the group and the foundation. She dreams of having her own store.

loans.use: to buy bananas, and other fruits and vegutables

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao is a hard-working and conscientious person. She is married to the loving father of her three children.  One is married and lives in a separate house.  The other two living with Mao. 

Presently, she and her humble husband generate a living as rice cultivators, in Kompong Speu Province, Cambodia.  They learned this skill from their ancestors.  Both have been involved in their business since 1981.  They earn approximately $5 for each day to support their family.

Mao wishes to purchase farmland but lacks some capital, so she has decided to request funds through HKL, a Kiva partner.  

Mao is expecting that, through this loan her family will gain more happiness, prosperity and profit.  Mao is grateful to all in advance for their help and support.  She is shown with her loving husband.

loans.use: to purchase a farmland.

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en:
Sawsan is a married woman and a mother of three children. She sells fish and has been for twenty years. She is still working on improving her business as much as she can.

Sawsan is a hard-working woman, and she aims to raise her children to be educated. That’s why she insists on educating them to get high degrees in the future.

Sawsan is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to pay for her children's educational fees. Her business is going fine but not enough to cover all of her requested expenses.

loans.use: to pay for her children's educational fees.

loans.name: Elena Emperatriz

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Elena Emperatriz; ella tiene 70 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia sigue en su negocio de venta de animales como ganados, ovejas y chanchos, la socia vende animales en las diferentes ferias que existe en la provincia de Anta, la socia quiere seguir ampliando y mejorando el negocio de venta de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales como chanchos,cuyes y gallinas al por mayor y tambien para comprar comida para los animales.
                                                    
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Her name is Elena Emperatriz. She is 70 years old, single, and she has 2 children. She has a business selling livestock such as cattle, sheep, and pigs. She sells the livestock at the different fairs that exist in the province of Anta. She wants to keep growing and improving her livestock sales business. She requests a loan to purchase livestock such as pigs, guinea pigs, and poultry in wholesale, and to purchase feed for them.

She is happy for the loan and she is committed to making the loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase livestock such as guinea pigs and poultry in wholesale, and to purchase their feed.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 29 years old and lives in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past three years, Emmanuel has been working hard to manage his grocery store, which sells food and home supplies to local customers. 

To help expand his business, Emmanuel has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar and cooking oil for resale, and will help Emmanuel to generate greater profits and improve his family's welfare. Emmanuel hopes that in the future he will be able to continue growing his business. 

Emmanuel is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Emmanuel who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice, age 23, is a food vendor. She has run a food stall in Yei, South Sudan, for three years. She is unmarried and has no children.
 
Alice has requested a loan through BRAC, South Sudan, in order to purchase tomatoes and cooking oil to offer for sale. With her extra income expected from this loan, she hopes eventually to build a commercial house.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and cooking oil to offer for sale

loans.name: Tuul

texts.en: Tuul is 32 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. His wife babysits her youngest daughter at home and the other two children are school students. Tuul operates a clothes-selling business. He started his business earlier this year by buying a 20-foot container at the market. His business is doing very well. Now that winter is approaching, he needs warmer clothes to sell. He is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy winter clothes. Tuul is a sharp and diligent man who says, "Even though I'm fairly new to the business, the income is fairly good and I have a mission to build my own store one day."

loans.use: to buy winter clothes to sell.

loans.name: Isabel Rocio

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres Unidas De Los Bajos se reúnen cada 15 días en Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y por su artesanía como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país.

Aquí conocimos a Isabel, tiene 24 años, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres junto a sus hermanos menores. Lleva dos ciclos  en el Banco Comunal, es la fiscal de pagos del grupo y le gusta porque los créditos le facilitan su vida.

Ella trabaja en una casa en la ciudad de Montecristi realizando los quehaceres domesticas, esto lo hace de lunes a viernes ya que los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende por el lugar donde trabaja a sus conocidos, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada ocho días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a Portoviejo cada vez que necesita. Lleva cuatro años con su negocio y  le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños ya que quiere aprovechar la temporada de Navidad y Año Nuevo que es muy bueno.
 
Su sueño es tener un local en Montecristi para vender ropa.
texts.en:
The communal bank group called Mujeres Unidas de los Bajos get together twice a month in the city of Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its rich culture and for its handicrafts such as the straw hats known inside and outside the country.

Here we meet Isabel, who is 24 years old, single and lives together at home with her parents and her younger brothers. She has had two cycles with the Communal Bank and it is the group assessments that she likes because it makes her life easier. 

She works at home in the city of Montecristi, currently doing housework. She does this Monday through Friday and on the weekends she works selling all types of clothing. She sells door-to-door and also she sells from the place where she works to people she knows, giving her customers credit and collecting payment every 8 days. She go to Portoviejo to buy her merchandise each time that she needs to. She has been in this business for 4 years and it is going very well.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, t-shirts and children’s clothing as she wants to take advantage of the Christmas and New Year season that is approaching when sales are good.

Her dream is to have her own store in Montecristi in order to sell clothing.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children’s clothing

loans.name: Raafat

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, married, and has one child.

Raafat is a carpenter; in 2008, he decided to open his own workshop. He makes bedrooms and furniture. He has sufficient experience in this field, a good reputation, and he is well-known in his area.

He decided to apply for $2400 loan in order to purchase a large generator. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a large generator.

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Lim, 50, resides in Kampong Cham Province. She and her husband grow rubber trees for rubber to sell. Lim is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a tractor to plow the farmland in order to grow rubber trees. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. 

In the future, Lim would like to use any additional income to purchase pigs to raise and sell. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a tractor to plow the farmland for a rubber plantation.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.es: Cynthia de 24 años, aprendió por tradición a elaborar con sus propias manos el oficio de artesanías, su tía se dedicó a enseñarle y ella ahora teje mochilas, hamacas, bolsos, sombreros sandalias, vestidos y cuanto diseño se le ocurre. Con las técnicas en crochet y punto ganchillo y de telar vertical ha salido adelante; ella vende sus productos a los almacenes del municipio de San Jacinto, transportadores que reposan en hostales y que llevan a sus familiares y amigos un producto de Cynthia. Su sueño es tener su propio almacén de artesanías colombianas que diga “hechas en San Jacinto Colombia”. Cynthia está aplicando a su primer credikiva, también primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas como hilos, así como también productos ya elaborados como vestidos ecuatorianos sombreros y ponchos, con esta inversión logrará su éxito porque diversificará con artesanías de otros países y también tendrá un punto de exhibición en su casa debido a que está ubicada en la carretera troncal justamente al lado de un punto comercial que oxigenaría el suyo y a un  lado de su casa planea ella desarrollar su propio almacén de artesanías
texts.en:
Cynthia, 24 years old, learned the tradition of hand-making traditional crafts from her aunt.  Now she knits bags, hammocks, hats, sandals, dresses, and other designs that come to her.  With the techniques of crochet and vertical weaving she has succeeded.  She sells her products in stores in the town of San Jacinto.  Travelers who stay in hostels bring their family and friends one of Cynthia's products.  Her dream is to have her own store of Colombian crafts that say "made in San Jacinto, Colombia".  

Cynthia is applying for her first Kiva loan and her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo  to purchase materials such as yarn, and also some pre-made products such as Ecuadorian dresses, hats, and ponchos.  With this investment she will meet her goal because she will diversify with crafts from other countries, and also have a place to exhibit them at her house, since it is located on the main highway next to a commercial area.  She is planning her own craft store next to her house.

loans.use: to purchase primary materials such as yarn, and also pre-made products such as Ecuadorian dresses, hats, and ponchos.

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en: Immaculee is aged 42 and has seven children all of whom go to school. She is married to an artist. She sells meat and she has been running this business for 20 years. With the loan, she plans to buy more meat to sell. The profits from the business will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: To buy more meat to sell.

loans.name: Jogie

texts.en:
Jogie, is married and has three children. Jogie is 50 years old and resides at Taguitic, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte, Philippines. 

Jogie raises pigs for sale to earn a living and she's been five years in this business. Each month, she earns 3,500 PHP doing this business. 

She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. 

In 2011, Jogie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Jogie wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente has a small stand where he sells traditional Ecuadorian dishes. His best dish is encebollado, a stew made with albacore and yucca. Vicente started off as a waiter at a local restaurant, but soon learned how to cook and started his own business. Vicente is looking to take the next step for his business and set up a restaurant. He has already identified the spot he will rent and is looking to make the necessary investments in utensils and chairs.

Vicente is 59 years old and has two children. One of his sons is mentally and physically disabled. He has a speech impediment that makes communication very difficult. Vicente has dedicated his life to providing his son with the best care possible. He wants to save up in order to send him to school for people with disabilities.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Vicente is looking to take the next step for his business and set up a restaurant.

loans.name: Galina

texts.en: With close to 20% of the Moldovan population working abroad in different countries life can be very difficult for many families.  Galina C. is 66 years old and lives by herself in the small village of Pruteni, close to the Romanian border, while her husband works in Russia for most of the year.  Remittance from her husband has helped pay for a part of their lives in the village but times have been tough, her son is pursuing his dreams of studying at the national sports school to become a football (soccer) player and she sends him whatever spare money she earns at the local market. Galina, sells brinza at the local market in order to help her son with expenses in the capitol, Chisinau. Brinza is Moldova’s national cheese, a type of sheep cheese which is eaten by every Moldovan, she has decided to start selling more of her product in the local market and at the regional center 45 min away.  She would like a loan to purchase additional livestock, some sheep, to start producing more brinza.

loans.use: To purchase sheep to raise and use the milk to produce Brinza

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is a single parent raising her daughter on her own. For 5 years, she has been running a small business selling children’s clothing at one of the local markets in Melitopol. Currently, Olga has over $2,600 in stock. Her gross income is about $900 a month. Her net profit is normally less than $300.

Olga is an experienced entrepreneur. She understands the power of planning and always tries to estimate costs, predict sales rates, and control her risks. Olga knows how to focus on her customers and gain their trust, and has many loyal clients. 

She is looking for a loan for $400 to re-stock her inventory for the summer season and enable her to compete with other vendors by offering a wider variety of clothing items. The profits generated will promote the continued growth of Olga’s business and provide a good income for her family.

loans.use: To increase inventory for the summer season
